作者

The author

弗拉基米尔·雅科夫列维奇·普罗普（Vladimir Jakovlevich Propp，1895-1970）在彼得堡大学学习斯拉夫语言学。 1918年完成学业后，他在学校教授俄语和文学，然后在列宁格勒大学教授德语。他的主要活动领域是民俗研究。他的意大利语作品包括：俄罗斯民歌、喜剧与笑声、民间传说中的俄狄浦斯、俄罗斯童话和童话形态。

Vladimir Yakovlevič Propp (1895-1970) studied Slavic philology at the University of Petersburg. After completing his studies in 1918, he taught Russian language and literature in schools, then German language at the University of Leningrad. The main field of his activity was the study of folklore. Among his works translated into Italian: Russian folk songs , Comicity and laughter , Oedipus in the light of folklore , The Russian fairy tale and Morphology of the fairy tale .

阿尔贝托·M·西雷塞 (Alberto M. Cirese) 介绍

Introduction by Alberto M. Cirese

V. Ja童话故事的历史根源。普罗普于 1946 年以俄语出版，并于 1949 年在都灵出版了克拉拉·科伊松 (Clara Coϊsson) 的意大利语译本，该书是第一本、至今仍是唯一一本“西方”语言的著作。

The Historical Roots of V. Ya. Propp's Fairy Tales appeared in Russian in 1946, and already in 1949 they were published in Turin in the Italian translation by Clara Coϊsson which has the merit of having been the first and of still remaining the only one in "Western" languages .

普罗普多年来在西方世界享有盛誉的《童话形态学》于1928 年以俄文出版，三十年后被翻译成（美国）英文，并于 1960 年获得了广泛的国际反响。列维-斯特劳斯在这篇文章中认识到了其预期的重要性，并于 1966 年最终在利益扩展的框架内或之后到达了意大利。结构主义的。

Morphology of the Fairy Tale, which on the other hand is responsible for the fame that Propp has enjoyed for some years in the Western world, was published in Russian in 1928, was translated into (American) English thirty years later, acquired vast international resonance in 1960 thanks to the essay in which Lévi-Strauss recognised its anticipatory importance, and in 1966 finally arrived in Italy too , in the context or on the wave of the expansion of structuralist interests .

因此，在我们中间，后来产生的东西（在其他地方仍然鲜为人知）以前就被人所知和翻译过（并且出于我们文化状况完全内部的原因或驱动力）；反之亦然，它是在更早的作品之后才被人所知并被翻译的，并且已经在其他地方闻名。

Among us, therefore , what was known and translated first (and for reasons or impulses entirely internal to our cultural situation) was what had been produced later (and which elsewhere continues to remain little known); vice versa, what was known and translated later was what had been produced much earlier, and which had also already become famous elsewhere .

如果我们考虑到划分《形态学》和《历史根源》原始版本的时间距离伴随着变化（但并非缺乏连续性），这些变化影响了《形态学》和《历史根源》的实质内容，那么这些时间和观点的颠倒或不匹配似乎并非纯粹巧合。两部作品。

These inversions or discrepancies in time and perspective appear not to be purely coincidental if one considers that the chronological distance that divides the original editions of Morfologia and Radici storiche is accompanied by variations (not without continuity, however) that touch the very substance of the two works .

形态学，诞生于俄罗斯形式主义的方向，准确地说，是一种形态类型，并且是共时的或同步的，因为它致力于识别恒定元素和它们所产生的统一规则（一种语法或句法）。构建了某些传统上被称为“魔法”的童话故事（与历史根源的翻译中被称为“童话故事”的童话故事相同）。支配形态学的一般和基本信念一方面是“在询问寓言起源于哪里之前，有必要澄清它的组成部分” （第 3 页），另一方面“可以检查寓言的内容”。寓言的形式与研究有机形态的形态具有相同的精度”（第 9 页），甚至达到了真正的“概括”（第 114 页）。因此，该著作的结构和发展一方面与该领域以前的研究相比具有根本性的创新性，另一方面它们本身并不脱离马克思主义领域，更不用说反对它了。 。事实上，我想说，在这个领域内，我们必然会认识到并分享对文学研究进行严格分析的普遍需求，普罗普正是通过这种需求强烈敦促的。然而，我们决不能忘记，即使在马克思主义领域之外，也可以感受到和分享这些需要：如果确实如此，当一个人想成为一名马克思主义者时，即使在这样的环境中，人们也会情不自禁地倾向于形式和实质上的严格化。 ——所谓的“人文主义”领域，同样如此。确实，仅仅致力于这些严格化还不足以称自己为马克思主义者。还需要一些其他东西，这些东西要么在形态学中缺失，要么在任何情况下都不明显。

Morphology , born in connection with the orientations of Russian formalism , is of a morphological type , precisely, and synchronic or synchronistic, in that it is dedicated to identifying the constant elements and uniform rules (a sort of grammar or syntax) with which certain fairy tales are constructed that are conventionally called "magical" (and which are then the same ones that in the translation of the Historical Roots were called "fairy tales"). The general and basic beliefs that support Morphology are on the one hand that "before asking where the fairy tale originates, it is necessary to clarify what it consists of" (p. 3), and on the other that it is "possible to examine the forms of the fairy tale with the same precision with which one studies the morphology of organic formations" (p. 9), even going so far as to make real "generalizations" (p. 114). The structure and development of the work , therefore, while on the one hand they are radically innovative with respect to previous studies in the sector, on the other hand they do not, in themselves , place themselves outside the Marxist area, much less are they against it. I would say, on the contrary, that, within that area, one necessarily comes to perceive and share the general needs for analytical rigorization of literary studies that Propp was so strongly urged by. One must not forget, however, that those needs can also be perceived and shared outside the Marxist sphere: if it is true that, when one wants to be a Marxist, one cannot help but tend towards formal and substantial rigorization even in the so-called "humanistic" field, it is equally true that it is not enough to apply oneself to such rigorizations in order to be able to call oneself a Marxist. Something else is needed, which in Morphology is either missing or in any case does not shine through .

对于历史根源来说，情况有所不同。这项在形态学中已经清楚预见到的工作现在是一项基因研究，并且是历时性的或历时性的，因为它试图再次为“魔法”童话故事建立历史的哪个时代或阶段以及哪个特定的机构。进化社会必须追踪各个组成要素的具体内容及其组织成统一的整体序列。从非常普遍的角度来看，这部作品的目的和技巧在童话研究领域是相当传统和常见的：事实上，尽管不时得出各种各样的结论，格林兄弟的意图并不十分明显。不同的是，马克斯·穆勒（Max Müller）、西奥多·本菲（Theodor Benfey）、安德鲁·朗（Andrew Lang）、芬兰学派、皮埃尔·圣蒂维斯（Pierre Saintyves）等。与这些前人相比，普罗普的著作的新颖性，以及与形态学中进行的创新研究结果的联系，在于对马克思主义观点的公开假设，特别是对于两个概念：结构-上层建筑这一基本概念关系，以及从原始共产主义社会到社会主义社会的历史发展阶段的典型继承关系。因此，虽然'28的形态学著作没有提及马克思主义作家（理想的理论参考是自然科学学者歌德，最直接的文化影响是维谢洛夫斯基），'46的“遗传学”著作却明确提及马克思、恩格斯、列宁和斯大林，而不仅仅是强制性提及（即使不应忽视，从 28 世纪到 46 世纪，苏联的内部政策发生了很大变化）。

For The Historical Roots things are different. The work, already clearly predicted in Morphology, is now a genetic and diachronic or diachronistic research, in that it tries to establish, always for the “magical” fairy tales, to which epochs or phases and to which specific institutions of the historical-social evolution the concrete contents of the individual constituent elements and their organization in uniform overall sequences must be traced back. From a very general point of view, the aims and techniques of the work are quite conventional and usual in the field of fairy tale investigations: not very different in fact, despite the variety of conclusions reached from time to time, are the intentions of the Grimms, of Max Müller, of Theodor Benfey, of Andrew Lang, of the Finnish school, of Pierre Saintyves etc. The novelty of Propp's work compared to these antecedents, in addition to the connection with the results of the innovative investigation conducted in Morphology, lies in the declared assumption of the Marxist perspective, especially for two concepts: the essential one of the structure-superstructure relationship, and that of the canonical succession of the phases of historical development, from primitive communism to socialist society. And so, while the morphological work of '28 does not present references to Marxist authors (the ideal theoretical reference is constituted by Goethe the scholar of natural sciences, and the most immediate cultural influence is Veselovskij), the "genetic" work of '46 explicitly refers to Marx, Engels, Lenin and Stalin, and not as a mere obligatory mention (even if it should not be overlooked that from '28 to '46 internal political matters had changed considerably in the Soviet Union) .

这就是这两部作品之间的关系——第一部是形态上的、共时性的，而不是直接马克思主义的；第二部是形态上的、共时性的，而不是直接马克思主义的；第二部是形态上的、共时性的，而不是直接马克思主义的；第二部是形态上的、共时性的，而不是直接马克思主义的。第二个是遗传性的、历时性的，并具有明确的马克思主义立场——意大利和美国事件的多样性得到了很好的解释。在罗曼·雅各布森（Roman Jakobson）在美国发展的意识形态科学方向的背景下（除其他外，它也与俄罗斯形式主义事件有传记联系），形态学占据了卓越的地位似乎是很自然的，而且（如果就其本身而言，它是孤立的） ，而不是作为更广泛和更全面的研究的一个时刻或阶段）允许虚假的意识形态中立的不在场证据，或者在任何情况下都不会立即参与更广泛和更紧迫的历史和人类问题。另一方面，在 1949 年的意大利背景下，可以很好地解释为什么左翼文化和编辑领导层转向历史根源的普罗普（而且在某种程度上，它似乎与“历史主义”利益相似）。马克思主义或多或少完全认同我们自己的），而应该忽视形态学（而且它太“科学”，不能不受到右翼和左翼历史主义的共同谴责）。

Such being the relations between the two works - the first morphological, synchronic and not immediately Marxist; the second genetic, diachronic and of declared Marxist positioning - the diversity of their Italian and American histories is explained quite well. In the framework of the ideological-scientific orientations developed in the USA by Roman Jakobson (among other things also biographically linked to the events of Russian formalism) it seems quite natural that Morphology should assume a pre-eminent prominence which, moreover (if taken in itself, isolated, and not as a moment or phase of a broader and more comprehensive research) allows the alibi of a false ideological neutrality or in any case does not immediately engage with broader and more urgent historical and human problems. In the Italian context of 1949, on the contrary, it is quite easy to explain why the left-wing cultural and editorial leadership turned to the Propp of the Historical Roots (which, moreover, appeared to be in some way similar to the "historicist" interests with which Italian Marxism more or less completely identified), and instead had to ignore Morphology (which, moreover, was too "scientific" not to fall under the joint condemnations of right-wing and left-wing historicism) .

无论今天对于这本重印本可能针对的年轻读者来说，这可能看起来很奇怪，在 1949 年意大利的气候下，即使是一本肯定不像《历史根源》那样具有攻击性的书，也可能会产生直接的政治影响，甚至引起丑闻和争议。右边的愤慨。让我们先把一些次要或最小的事件放在一边，比如儿童事物学者朱塞佩·范丘利(Giuseppe Fanciulli)在面对他认为的“明显的反宗教目的”时感到的“厌恶”，或者更确切地说是“愤怒”。作者，并面临这样一个事实：童话故事可以成为历史和科学研究的对象，而不是成为或多或少微弱的白日梦的借口。更重要的是，贝内代托·克罗齐（Benedetto Croce）在两个不同的地方感到他必须献给普罗普的书，其中他发现了​​他眼中一些最严重的错误：对马克思主义“唯物主义”概念的启发或参考（而且来自苏联），是一部“语言学”而不是“历史”的作品，用比较标准来对待童话故事，寻找它们可能的起源或来源，而不是审美标准，显然是理想主义标准（“Quaderni della 'Critica'”，N. 15，1949，第 102-05 页）。

And as strange as it may seem today to the younger readers to whom this reprint is presumably addressed, in the Italian climate of 1949 even a book that was certainly not aggressive like Le radici storiche could have an immediate political bite and even arouse scandal and indignation on the right. Let us leave aside minor or minimal episodes such as the “disgust,” or rather the “horror,” that a scholar of children’s things, Giuseppe Fanciulli, felt invaded by when faced with what he considered the author’s “obvious anti-religious purpose,” and when faced with the fact that fairy tales could become an object of historical and scientific study instead of remaining a pretext for more or less feeble fantasies. Much more significant remains the annoyed and spiteful note that Benedetto Croce felt it necessary to dedicate in two different places to Propp's book in which he found some of the faults that in his eyes were most serious: the fact that it was inspired by or referred to the "materialistic" concepts of Marxism (coming from the Soviet Union, moreover), that it was a work of "philology" and not of "history", and that it treated fairy tales with comparative criteria, in search of their possible origins or sources, rather than with aesthetic and, obviously, idealistic criteria ("Quaderni della 'Critica'", N. 15, 1949, pp. 102-05) .

几乎没有必要说克罗齐没有深入探讨普罗普的论文和解释的优点。事实上，讨论他试图用马克思主义概念阐明童话故事的历史问题并在童话材料分析中阐明这些概念的意义何在？马克思的论点“一举连根拔起哲学的根基”（第103页）和恩格斯的论点“是最宽容和最无意识的”，谴责它们是错误和矛盾的。处理哲学概念的污染者”（第 105 页）？但即便如此，对于克罗齐来说，任何在历史上寻找童话故事起源的尝试本身都是毫无意义的。事实上，在他眼中，这些只是“诗意的有机体”，因此，“如果我们想严格地思考，它们的起源，即它们的作者，就在每一个用新口音叙述或重新叙述童话故事的人身上”。并因此自己创造了它”；此外，至于他们的材料，“对他们来说，就像每部诗歌作品一样：谁能说清楚它的材料从何而来，那是无限的存在之海？当一切都经过了感觉和想象，变得奇幻而富有诗意的时候，谁能说哪一部分是历史的，哪一部分不是历史的呢？ （第 104 页）。显然，这种谴责不再只影响普罗普一人，而是涉及到大批学者，而根本不是马克思主义者，包括那些被尊称为“马克思主义的创始人和大师”的格林、康雷蒂或皮特雷。对流行传统和信仰的语言学调查”。

It goes without saying that Croce does not enter into the merits of Propp's thesis and interpretations. What is the point of discussing, in fact, his attempt to illuminate the historical problems of the fairy tale with Marxist concepts and to articulate these concepts in the analysis of fairy tale materials, when for some time now, and once and for all, Croce had condemned as erroneous and contradictory the theses of Marx "who uprooted the plant of philosophy in one fell swoop" (p. 103) and those of Engels , " who was the most accommodating and the most unconsciously contaminator in the handling of philosophical concepts" (p. 105)? But even leaving this aside , for Croce any attempt to search in history for the genesis or origin of fairy tales is in itself senseless. In his eyes, in fact, these are only “poetic organisms” and therefore, “if we want to think rigorously , their origin, that is, their author , is in each one who narrates or retells a fairy tale with a new accent and thus creates it on his own account”; furthermore, as regards their material, “the same thing happens to them as to every work of poetry: who can say where its material, which is the infinite sea of ​​being, is drawn from? And who can say which part of it is historical and which is not, when everything has passed through feeling and fantasy and has become fantastic and poetic?” (p. 104). With this, as is evident, the condemnation no longer only affects Propp but comes to involve a vast array of scholars, not at all Marxists, including those Grimm or Comparetti or Pitré who are nevertheless mentioned with honour as “founders and masters” of “philological investigations into popular traditions and beliefs” .

更直接地论及其优点，带着各种各样的欣赏和保留，由意大利出版物《 Radici Storico》引起的其他更专业或技术性的著作也进入了：朱塞佩·科基亚拉（Giuseppe Cocchiara）对上一版的序言，保罗·托斯奇（Paolo Toschi）的评论（现在在《流行文学研究》中） ，第 45-63 页），Raffaele Corso 的（《民俗》，第 3 卷，NN.3-4，1948-49，第 117 页及其后）。

More directly into the merits, with appreciations and reservations of various kinds, other more specialized or technical writings aroused by the Italian publication of the Radici storiche entered: the preface by Giuseppe Cocchiara to the previous edition , the review by Paolo Toschi (now in Rappresaglia di studi di letteratura popolare, pp. 45-63), that by Raffaele Corso (in “Folklore”, vol. 3, NN. 3-4, 1948-49, pp. 117 ff.) .

但是，尽管我们刚才提到了各种意识形态或技术干预，尽管这部作品客观上提供了两项方法论创新（它对形态学结果的使用，以及它对马克思主义方法的引用），但当然不能说《根》历史研究对我们产生了真实而具体的影响，无论是在更专业的研究上，还是在更广泛的框架内。

But despite the various ideological or technical interventions that we have been recalling, and despite the two methodological innovations objectively offered by the work (its use of the results of Morphology, and its reference to Marxist approaches), it certainly cannot be said that The Historical Roots have exercised a real and specific influence among us, neither on the more specialized studies nor in a broader framework .

如果说它引起了克罗齐的愤慨，那么马克思主义的灵感实际上并没有引起左派的特别热情：在这方面，埃内斯托·德·马蒂诺在1950年的苏联研究报告中对这一工作的仓促冷漠的提及苏联科学与文化会议上的民族志和民俗学。如果当时的苏联官方评论中对普罗普的沉默并非没有影响，那么可以肯定的是，《历史根源》的背景设定不免显得有点过于粗糙和概括（也许过于语言自然主义和过于实证主义进化论）也在我们的左翼文化眼中，长期受客观和主观需要的制约，需要处理克罗齐唯心主义历史主义的遗产，甚至在内部，并致力于将自己从它中解放出来。渐进的调解、整合或克服，而不是决定性的撕裂和破裂。另一方面，作为意大利童话选集家的伊塔洛·卡尔维诺所从事的文学和趣味兴趣，也不是那些一方面反对比较自然主义，另一方面反对非理性主义的历史主义论战的兴趣。德马蒂诺对神话和仪式的研究可以在普罗普的作品中找到许多直接和具体的联系或刺激。对于拉斐尔·佩塔佐尼（Raffaele Pettazzoni）对民族学世界的神话和寓言的研究来说，尽管出于与之前不同的原因，也可以这样说。

If it aroused Croce's indignation, Marxist inspiration did not in fact arouse particular enthusiasm on the left: indicative in this regard is the hasty coldness of the reference that Ernesto De Martino dedicated to the work in 1950, in the report on Soviet studies of ethnography and folklore at the Conference on Science and Culture in the USSR. And if perhaps the silence on Propp in the official Soviet reviews of the time was not without effects, it is certain that the approaches of the Historical Roots could not help but appear a little too rough and schematic (and perhaps too philological-naturalistic and too positivistic-evolutionary) even in the eyes of our left-wing culture, long conditioned by the objective and subjective need to come to terms, even internally, with the legacy of Croce's idealistic historicism, and committed to freeing itself from it more with gradual mediations, integrations or overcomings than with decisive tears and ruptures. Nor, on the other hand, could the literary and taste interests that motivated Italo Calvino's activity as an anthologist of Italian fairy tales , or those of historicist polemics against comparative naturalism on the one hand and against irrationalism on the other that underpin De Martino's studies on myth and ritual, find many direct and specific connections or stimuli in Propp's work. The same could be said, albeit for reasons different from the previous ones, for Raffaele Pettazzoni's studies on myths and fables of the ethnological world .

至于《历史根源》中客观存在的第二个新奇之处，相信如果被察觉的话，也不会受到很大的青睐；然而，由于缺乏形态学知识，它完全被忽视了，第二部作品中对它的参考文献和参考文献当然没有给出足够的概念。随之而来的是，有关“母题”、“主题”、“情节”或“类型”的历史根源的话语被错误地同化为所谓的芬兰方向（从阿恩到汤普森）的话语，而它们却截然不同，而且普罗普对此产生了直接而明确的争议。

As for the second novelty objectively present in the Historical Roots, it is to be believed that if it had been perceived it would not have received much favour; in any case it went completely unnoticed due to the lack of knowledge of Morphology, of which the references and allusions made to it in the second work certainly do not give an adequate idea. It resulted in the discourses of the Historical Roots on “motives” and “subjects” or “interweavings” or “types” being mistakenly assimilated to those of the so-called Finnish school (from Aarne to Thompson), which are instead very different and against which Propp was in direct and explicit polemic .

二十多年后，《历史根源》的重印，陷入了截然不同的思想科学境地。

More than twenty years later, the reprint of Historical Roots falls into a very different ideological-scientific situation .

首先，有一个具体的事实，我们现在不仅有形态学，还有普罗皮 1928 年的文章《魔法寓言的转变》（《俄罗斯形式主义者》，第 275-304 页），其中发展了形态学的一些暗示（例如，参见第 121-23 页），并且在《历史根源》中也能感受到其存在（例如，参见第一章的第 8 段和第 9 段，专门讨论换位关系）以及童话和仪式之间的倒置，它重新加工或改编了之前首先在童话和童话之间的转换方面表达的概念）。

First of all, there is the specific fact that we now have at our disposal not only the Morphology but also the 1928 Proppian essay , The Transformation of Magic Fables (in The Russian Formalists, pp. 275-304), which develops some of the ideas in the Morphology (see for example pp. 121-23) and whose presence can also be felt in the Historical Roots (see for example paragraphs 8 and 9 of the first chapter, dedicated to the relationships of transposition and inversion between fairy tale and rite, which rework or adapt the concepts that had previously been expressed above all in reference to the transformations between fairy tale and fairy tale) .

此外，仍然在普罗普其他作品的知识水平上，我们不仅有1960-66年与列维-斯特劳斯的重要辩论，还有1961年关于俄罗斯民歌的文章，虽然更边缘，但也不容忽视；鉴于我们在意大利也获得了关于俄罗斯形式主义和苏联民族志和民俗学研究方向的更多信息（关于后者，例如参见 GL Bravo 在苏联：人民和习俗，作者：SA Tokarev）。

Furthermore, still on the level of knowledge of Propp's other works, we have in Italian not only the important debate with Lévi-Strauss of 1960-66 but also, more marginal but not negligible, the 1961 essay on Russian folk songs; nor do these works remain deprived of their original context, given the increased information we have available in Italy both for Russian formalism and for the orientations of Soviet studies in ethnography and folklore (on the latter see for example the extensive introduction by GL Bravo to Urss: popoli e costumi di SA Tokarev) .

那么，在更一般的层面上，在传统意大利历史主义危机的框架内，民族人类学兴趣的爆发，一方面，其发生或多或少与结构主义取向直接伴随，另一方面，其他也与对马克思主义更严格的唯物主义方面的重新评估有关，对“生产方式”（或“生产方法”，正如他们在《历史根源》的翻译中所说的那样）提出了新的或重新关注。 ），尤其是“前资本主义”的那些，随着关于进化系列的辩论的恢复，关于更古老的和现在“占主导地位”的那些在更发达和“占主导地位”的事物中的持久性的辩论，等等。

On a more general level, then, and within the framework of the crisis of traditional Italian historicism, there has been an explosion of ethno-anthropological interests which, on the one hand, has occurred in more or less direct concomitance with structuralist orientations, but on the other hand is also linked to a re-evaluation of the more strictly materialistic aspects of Marxism, with new or renewed attention to the "modes of production" (or "methods of production", as they say in the translation of the Historical Roots ) and more especially to the "pre-capitalist" ones, with a resumption of debates on evolutionary seriations, on the permanence of the more archaic and now "dominated" ones within the more developed and "dominant" ones, etc.

在这种背景下，可以相信，阅读或重读历史根源可以更直接地富有成效和刺激。

In this context, it is to be believed that reading or rereading the Historical Roots could be more directly fruitful and stimulating .

在理解文本的最直接层面上，不难立即理解，不仅如此，正如已经说过的，“童话​​”一词的翻译方式与意大利语版本中的相同俄语表达方式不同。形态学是用“关于魔法”的寓言或童话故事来呈现的，而且它们都表明同一组童话故事叙事通常与仙女或实际魔法无关，但它们被聚集在“魔法”的名称下。 Zaubermärchen在 Antti Aarne 于 1910 年建立的国际“类型”索引中，然后在 Stith Thompson 于 1928 年和 1961 年扩展翻译的 Aarne 索引中的Tales of Magic下。建立其他术语也很容易与形态学的联系，例如，在其翻译中，在《历史根源》的翻译中通常称为“主题”的东西通常被称为“情节”。建立其他更重要的概念联系也不会更困难：认识到普罗普在《历史根源》中详细说明他所指的“童话”（第一章第 3 段）所用的后续行动方案无非是列出形态学中确定的故事的主要“功能”（或“谓词”）；因此，要理解，对于普罗普来说，“童话”（或“魔法故事”）的概念并不像以前那样，是根据内容相似的某一组主题的反复出现来确定的，而是根据行为或动机之间建立的结果关系的恒定性，这些行为或动机可能彼此非常不同，但沿着故事的轴线发挥着相同的作用；最终认识到，普罗普声称致力于追溯其起源的一百五十个叙事元素只不过是三十一种功能的“变体”的复合体，即材料中具体行动的复合体。他检查发现它们扮演着恒定元素的角色，可以说，这些元素是不时占据“谓词”句法位置的特定“动词”。

On the more immediate level of understanding the text, it will not be difficult to understand immediately not only that, as has already been said, the expression “fairy tale” translates differently that same Russian expression which in the Italian version of Morfologia was rendered as favola or fiaba “di magia”, and also that they all indicate that same group of fairy tale narratives which often have nothing to do with fairies or with real magic but which were grouped under the name of Zaubermärchen in the international index of “types” established by Antti Aarne in 1910, and then under that of Tales of Magic in the expanded translation of Aarne's index made by Stith Thompson in 1928 and 1961. It will also be quite easy to establish other terminological connections with Morfologia, in whose translation, for example, what in the translation of Radici storiche is often called “soggetto” is usually called “intreccio”. Nor will it be much more difficult to establish other more important conceptual connections: to recognize that the scheme of successive actions with which Propp specifies in the Historical Roots what he means by “fairy tale” (chap. 1, § 3) is nothing other than the list of the main “functions” (or “predicates”) of the tale, identified in the Morphology; to understand therefore that for Propp the notion of “fairy tale” (or “magical tale”) is not determined, as previously, on the basis of the recurrent presence of a certain group of motifs similar in content, but instead on the basis of the constancy of the relations of consequentiality that are established between actions or motifs that are also very different from each other but play identical roles along the axis of the tale; finally, to realize that the one hundred and fifty narrative elements on which Propp claims to be working to trace their genesis are nothing other than the complex of the "variants" of the thirty-one functions, that is, the complex of concrete actions which in the materials he examined find themselves playing the role of constant elements and which are, so to speak, the specific "verbs" which from time to time come to occupy the syntactic position of "predicates" .

更一般地说，形态学知识使今天的读者（或重读者）能够更准确地认识历史根源的某些设置的原因和后果，否则这些设置可能会显得平庸或通用。例如，它使我们能够理解“童话结构”研究的分析原因是什么——证明它们“密切的相互关系”，即揭示单型童话的结构同一性——这种方法带来了两个被先前关于“类型”和“母题”的比较研究所忽视的后果：即“没有一个童话主题可以单独研究”，以及“没有一个童话母题可以无论它的性质如何而被研究”。与整体的关系”（第一章，第3 段）。事实上，受到警告的读者会立即感到回到形态学，尤其是已经提到的关于“构图和情节”的段落，其中“魔法寓言的全部曲目”被认为是“一系列变体”，并且其中作为历史根源基础的“遗传”研究计划在一定程度上是值得期待的。

More generally, knowledge of Morphology allows today's reader (or re-reader) to recognize more precisely the reasons and consequences of certain approaches of the Historical Roots that may otherwise appear either banal or generic. It allows us to understand, for example, the analytical reasons why it is stated that the study of the "structure of fairy tales" - demonstrating their "close reciprocal relationship", that is, revealing the structural identity of the monotypic fairy tale - entails two methodological consequences, ignored by previous comparative studies on "types" and "motifs": that is, that "no subject of a fairy tale can be studied in isolation", and that "no motif of a fairy tale can be studied without considering its relations with the whole" (chap. 1 , § 3). The attentive reader, in fact, feels immediately brought back to Morphology and more especially to that already mentioned paragraph on “Composition and plot” in which “the entire repertoire of magic tales” is considered “as a series of variants”, and in which the programme of the “genetic” study which is at the basis of the Historical Roots is to a certain extent anticipated .

因此，通过这种方式以及通过这篇关于童话故事转变的文章的许多其他方式，我们认识到分离和连接形态学和历史根源的协调和有意的观点多样性，以及从对童话故事的研究中得出的结论。文本的构成内在性质导致对文本与它们诞生或可能诞生的历史背景之间的关系的考虑。

And so, through this and many other paths that also pass through the essay on the transformations of fairy tales, we are led to recognize the coordinated and intentional diversity of perspectives that separates and connects Morphology and Historical Roots, and that from the study of the internal constitution of the texts leads to the consideration of the relationships between the texts and the historical context within which they are or may have been born .

在从形态学到遗传学研究的转变中，马克思主义观点的假设似乎与其说是一种补充，不如说是对最初已经瞥见的内容的发展、深化和严格化。无论如何，事实是，虽然在《形态学》中我们只限于宣称“生命形式和宗教之间很可能存在着精确的联系，另一方面宗教和童话之间也存在着精确的联系” ”（第 113 页），某些信仰与一定程度的社会文化发展之间的关系只是偶尔泛泛地提及，现在，在《历史根源》中，这些仍然模糊的指示通过明确引用马克思主义的原则得到了澄清： “物质生活的生产方法决定了过程普遍的社会、政治和精神生活”，而童话被公开地视为“一种上层建筑性质的现象”，因此需要与它所对应的经济结构、生产方式和社会制度联系起来。

In this passage from morphological to genetic study, the adoption of the Marxist perspective seems to constitute not so much an addition as a development, a deepening and a rigorist of what had already been initially glimpsed. In any case, the fact remains that, while in Morphology one limited oneself to declaring that "it is very probable that there exists a precise connection between forms of life and religion, on the one hand, and religion and fables on the other" (p. 113), and one spoke only occasionally and generically of the relationship between certain beliefs and certain degrees of socio-cultural development, now, in Historical Roots, these still vague indications are specified in explicit reference to the Marxian principle that "the method of production of material life conditions the social, political and spiritual process of life in general", while the fable is openly assumed "as a phenomenon of a superstructural nature" that must therefore be connected with the economic structure, the mode of production, the social regime to which it corresponds .

普罗普在这方面经过长时间的分析考察得出的结论是，童话故事的构成要素在很大程度上必须追溯到（“氏族政权”的）“原始”仪式和神话，尤其是到“起始循环”和“死亡表征”。正如《历史根源》在意大利首次出现时所指出的那样，童话故事与“原始”世界之间的联系已经得到了英国人类学派（尤其是朗）的支持。据报道，圣蒂维斯已经看到了童话故事和启蒙运动之间的关系。我们还必须补充一点，即使这一点似乎没有被注意到，它与神话仪式理论的论点存在某种普遍的类比，并且与功能主义理论的某些可能的巧合。然而，不能说普罗普的作品可以简化为这些前因，或者说它是对它们的纯粹和简单的改编：倾斜是不同的，不仅是普罗普所处的意识形态框架，而且是对普罗普的承诺。他将其应用于使其前提有序且合理明确，并微调其调查标准。

The conclusion that Propp reaches in this regard, through a long analytical examination, is that for the most part the constitutive elements of fairy tales must be traced back to “primitive” rites and myths (of the “clan regime”), and more especially to the “initiation cycle” and to the “representations of death”. As was noted at the time of the first appearance of the Historical Roots in Italy, the connection between fairy tales and the “primitive” world had already been supported by the English anthropological school (and more especially by Lang); it was also pointed out that the relationship between fairy tales and initiation had already been seen by Saintyves. It should also be added, even if it does not seem to have been noticed, a certain general analogy with the theses of the ritualistic theory of myth, and some possible coincidence with the functionalistic one. However, it cannot be said that Propp's work can be reduced to these antecedents , or that it is a pure and simple adaptation of them: the approach is different, not only because of the ideological framework in which Propp places himself but also because of the commitment with which he applies himself to making his premises explicit in an orderly and rational way and to developing his criteria of investigation .

事实上，我想说，《历史根源》当前的兴趣不仅仅在于结论，还在于提出某些方法论观点，这些观点一方面与结构主义和结构主义之间的辩论或多或少地直接相关。另一方面，人们正在尝试将一般的马克思主义取向阐明为真正“符合”构成人口学或民族人类学研究对象的具体现象的操作标准。在这方面看来最刺激和最容易进行富有成果的讨论或发展的观点中，我仅限于仓促而随意地指出科学研究必须按顺序从形态水平到遗传水平的一般标准。历史性的一次且唯一的一次（它拒绝了许多通用的全球主义假设，其正确性多于错误性）；对个别主题起源的研究和重建与对整个童话故事起源的研究和重建之间的区别（这提出了不同研究层次的阐明和联系的问题）；神话与童话之间的区别不是基于“形式”，而是基于各自的“社会功能”（我们再次触及与列维-斯特劳斯概念的本质分歧点）；该论点认为童话故事叙述了曾经做过的事情，并且它准确地按照完成的顺序进行了叙述（这导致了“做”根据其他人的说法应该与“思考”相关的事情，即使那时问题在一个新的层面上再次出现：为什么要按照这个顺序“做”，而不是按照另一个顺序“做”？）； “直接反应”、“意义转换”和“倒置”等概念用于童话故事和仪式之间建立的关系，但也用于在一般和仪式之外的调查中进行分析操作。也许是对“原则”的混淆，马克思主义的概念是，上层建筑的变化是由结构的变化决定的（并与之相关），但因此不是直接的和机械的。

I would say in fact that the interest of Historical Roots today, more than in the conclusions, lies in proposing certain methodological perspectives that are connected more or less directly on the one hand to the debate between structuralism and Marxism and on the other to the attempts that are being made to articulate the general Marxist orientations in operational criteria that are truly "on the scale" of the specific phenomena that constitute the object of demological or ethno-anthropological investigations. Among the points that in this regard seem more stimulating and susceptible to fruitful discussion or development, I limit myself to pointing out, hastily and indiscriminately, the general criterion according to which scientific investigation must pass, in order, from the morphological level to the genetic one and only then to the historical one (with which many generic globalist assumptions are rejected, more rightly than wrongly); the distinction between the study and reconstruction of the genesis of individual motifs and the study and reconstruction of the genesis of the fairy tale as a whole (which raises the question of the articulation and connection of the different levels of investigation); the identification of the difference between myth and fairy tale not on the basis of "form" but on the basis of their respective "social function" (which again touches on a point of essential disagreement with the Lévi-Straussian conceptions); the thesis that the fairy tale narrates what was once done, and that it narrates it precisely in the order in which it was done (which brings back to "doing" what according to others is instead to be related to "thinking", even if then the problem arises again at a new level: why that "doing", and in that order, and not another in another order?); the notions of "direct correspondence", of "transposition of meaning" and of "inversion" which are used in relation to the relationships which are established between fairy tale and rite, but which are also used to make analytically operative in the investigation, outside of the generic and perhaps confused reference to "principles", the Marxian concept that the changes in the superstructures are determined by (and correlated to) those in the structure, but are not for this reason immediate and mechanical .

阿尔贝托·M·西雷塞

ALBERTO M. CIRESE

1972 年罗马

Rome 1972

E. M ELETINSKI，L'étude Structuree et Typologique du conte，收录于 V. Propp，Morphologie du conte，由 M. Derrida、T. Todorov 和 C. Kahn 编辑，Seuil，巴黎 1970 年，第 145 页。 201-54。

3. 关于意大利历史根源的讨论似乎并没有超出引言中克罗齐、科基亚拉、托斯基和科尔索的注释。然而，自 C. Lévi-Strauss 的文章以来， 《形态学》的美国译本（由印第安纳大学 S. Pirkova-Jakobson 编辑，1958 年；修订版，由 A. Dundes、奥斯汀和伦敦编辑，1968 年）在国际上引起了反响， 1960 年的《结构与形式》 ，在Morfologia（1966 年编辑）附录中翻译成意大利语引文，第 163-99 页），严格审查于

3. The discussion on the Historical Roots does not seem to have gone much further in Italy than the notes by Croce, Cocchiara, Toschi and Corso indicated in the Introduction. On the other hand, the American translation of Morfologia (edited by S. Pirkova-Jakobson, Indiana University 1958; revised edition edited by A. Dundes, Austin and London 1968) has had a very wide international echo starting from the essay by C. Lévi-Strauss, La structure et la forme of 1960, translated into Italian as an appendix to Morfologia (ed. 1966 cit., pp. 163-99), critically examined in

AM C IRESE，关于一些符号学的符号学原因，1：从普罗普到列维斯特劳斯，人与文化，n。 1976 年 15-18 页，第 15-18 页。 15-45，

AM C IRESE , Of some semiological semiological reasons, 1: From Propp to Lévi-Strauss , Uomo & Cultura, n. 15-18, 1976, pp. 15-45,

并再次展开关于童话与神话之间关系的辩论

and taken up again for the debate on the relationship between fairy tale and myth by

F. J ESI，《论神话与童话》，G. Cusatelli 等人，“一切都是童话”，国际童话研究会议记录，AM Cirese、Emme Edizioni 的序言，米兰 1980 年，第 43 页- 53.

F. J ESI , On myth and fairy tale , in G. Cusatelli and others, "Everything is a fairy tale", Proceedings of the International Conference on Fairy Tales, preface by AM Cirese, Emme Edizioni, Milan 1980, pp. 43-53.

更一般地说，关于普罗普泛函方法在西方以及因此在苏联的应用和发展的大量信息，可以在 Meletinski 的上述文章和以下文章中阅读：

More generally, a lot of information on the applications and developments that the Proppian functional method has had in the West, and by extension in the USSR, can be read in the aforementioned essay by Meletinski and in:

D. F ERRARI B RAVO，关于故事结构分析的历史，见 EM Meletinski（编），“童话故事的结构”，译。它。塞莱里奥，巴勒莫 1977 年，第 17 页。 25-35；

D. F ERRARI B RAVO , For a history of the structural analysis of the story , in EM Meletinski (ed.), “The structure of the fairy tale”, Italian translation. Sellerio, Palermo 1977, pp. 25-35;

B. HOLBEK，《口头叙事的形式和结构研究》。参考书目，Folkemindevidenskab 研究所，哥本哈根，1978 年。

B. H OLBEK , Formal and Structural Studies of Oral Narrative. A Bibliography , Institut for Folkemindevidenskab, Copenhagen 1978.

“童话结构主义研究：V. Ja 的作品”一章也颇有成效。普罗普”，在

M. L UTHI，《欧洲流行童话：形式与本质》，G. Dolfini 作序，穆尔西亚，米兰 1979 年；

while various writings on Propp reproduce the n. 33-34 of “Russian Literature” (vol. XII, 1982).

普罗普工作的各个方面都在

Various aspects of Propp's work are examined in

E. D ELITALA、C. R APALLO和 L. O RRÙ、Vladimir Propp：从童话研究到农业节日研究，1982-83 年课程笔记，Cuec 编辑，卡利亚里大学文学院 1983 年。

E. D ELITALA , C. R APALLO and L. O RRÙ , Vladimir Propp: from fairy tale studies to the study of agricultural festivals , notes from the 1982-83 course, Cuec ed., Faculty of Letters, University of Cagliari 1983.

4. 对于普罗普有时在《历史根源——童话类型和主题》中提到的芬兰学派的标准，请参见

4. For the criteria of the Finnish school to which Propp sometimes refers in Historical Roots — Fairy-tale Types and Motifs — see the exposition given by

圣霍普森，流行传统童话，译。它。 《Il Saggiatore》，米兰 1967 年，第 123 页。 501-620。

ST HOMPSON , The Fairy Tale in Popular Tradition , trans. it. Il Saggiatore, Milan 1967, pp. 501-620.

在这方面，请参阅《历史系统框架》

In this regard see the historical-systematic tables contained in

AM C IRESE，霸权文化和底层文化，帕伦博，巴勒莫 1973 年（A.3.11；A4.1；B3.22.1）；

AM C IRESE , Hegemonic culture and subaltern cultures , Palumbo, Palermo 1973 (A.3.11; A4.1; B3.22.1);

以及 M. Luthi 在已经引用的著作中致力于“童话研究”的富有成果的章节。

and the fruitful chapter that M. Luthi dedicated to “Studies on fairy tales” in the work already cited.

普罗普也提到过，按类型和主题划分的国际童话剧目包括：

The international repertoires of fairy tales by types and motifs, also mentioned by Propp, are:

A. A. ARNE和 S. T HOMPSON，《民间故事的类型》，FFC n。 184，赫尔辛基，1961 年；

A. A ARNE and S. T HOMPSON , The Types of the Folktale , FFC n. 184, Helsinki 1961;

S. T HOMPSON，民间文学主题索引，哥本哈根 1956-58，6 卷。

S. T HOMPSON , Motif-Index of Folk-Literature , Copenhagen 1956-58, 6 vols.

它们以意大利的以下曲目为蓝本：

The following are modelled for Italy on these repertoires:

DP R OTUNDA，意大利中篇小说散文主题索引，布卢明顿 1942 年；

S. Lo Nigro ，《西西里民间故事：分类和参考书目》，Olschki，佛罗伦萨，1958 年。

S. Lo NIGRO , Sicilian folk tales: classification and bibliography , Olschki, Florence 1958.

所编编的目录也遵循国际分类法的类型和式样

The catalogue edited by also follows the international classification by types and motifs.

AM C IRESE和 L. S ERAFINI，非歌唱口头传统。第一个国家童话、传说等类型、主题和主题清单。 1968-69 年和 1972 年，Discoteca di Stato 在意大利所有地区推广的现场录音中提到，最初与 1975 年罗马 Discoteca di Stato 的 A. Milillo 合作。

First national inventory of types, motifs and subjects of fairy tales, legends, etc. from the field recordings promoted by the State Record Library in all Italian regions in the years 1968-69 and 1972, with the initial collaboration of A. Milillo, State Record Library, Rome 1975.

5.关于神话的仪式理论，普罗普的立场在某种程度上与它相似，参见

5. On the ritualistic theory of myth, which Propp's positions can in some way be compared to, see

J. FONTENROSE，《神话的仪式理论》，加州大学出版社，伯克利，1966 年；

J. F ONTENROSE , The Ritual Theory of Myth , University of California Publications, Berkeley 1966;

E. D E M ARTINO，《神话、宗教科学和现代文明》，载于《愤怒的象征价值》，《Il Saggiatore》，米兰，1962 年，特别是第 175 页。 35 及以下。

E. D E MARTINO , Myth, religious sciences and modern civilization , in Furore simboli valore , Il Saggiatore, Milan 1962, particularly pp. 35 et seq.

对于功能主义理论，请参见

For the functionalist theory see

B. MALINOWSKI，《魔法、科学与宗教》，译。由 M. Arioti 编辑，Newton Compton，罗马，1976 年。

B. M ALINOWSKI , Magic, Science and Religion , trans. edited by M. Arioti, Newton Compton, Rome 1976.

6. 对于历史根源（以及引言）中所包含的马克思主义的提及，指出一些具有民族人类学影响的马克思恩格斯文本将是有用的：

6. For the references to Marxism contained in the Historical Roots (and in the Introduction) it will be useful to indicate some Marx-Engelsian texts with ethno-anthropological relevance:

K. M ARX，前资本主义经济形式，译。它。 《Riuniti 编辑》，罗马，1967 年；

K. M ARX , Precapitalist Economic Forms , it. trans. Editori Riuniti, Rome 1967;

F. E NGELS，《家庭、私有财产和国家的起源》，译。它。 《Riuniti 编辑》，罗马，1963 年；

F. E NGELS , The Origin of the Family, Private Property and the State , it. trans. Editori Riuniti, Rome 1963;

K. M ARX、F. E NGELS和 N. L ENIN，论前资本主义社会，译。它。费尔特里内利，米兰，1970 年。

K. M ARX , F. E NGELS and N. L ENIN , On Pre-Capitalist Societies , trans. it. Feltrinelli, Milan 1970.

西方对马克思主义和人类学的讨论远远超出了历史根源的苏联主题和时代；这里提到就足够了

The Western discussion on Marxism and anthropology goes far beyond the Soviet themes and times of Historical Roots ; here it is enough to mention

E. TERRAY，《马克思主义与原始社会》，译。它。萨莫纳和萨维利，罗马，1969 年；

E. T ERRAY , Marxism and Primitive Societies , it. trans. Samonà and Savelli, Rome 1969;

M. GODELIER和 L. SÈVE ，《马克思主义与结构主义》，译。它。埃诺迪，都灵 1970；

M. G ODELIER and L. S ÈVE , Marxism and Structuralism , trans. it. Einaudi, Turin 1970;

PG S OLINAS等人，《马克思主义取向和意大利人类学研究》，Angeli，米兰 1980 年；

PG S OLINAS and others, Marxist orientations and Italian anthropological studies , Angeli, Milan 1980;

AM C IRESE，《虚构性、标志、生殖：民族人类学笔记》，Cisu，罗马 1984 年。

AM C IRESE , Fabricality, signs, procreation: ethnoanthropological notes , Cisu, Rome 1984.

7. 在普罗普在《历史根源》中提到的俄罗斯童话中，读者将能够看到意大利文集里的那些童话。

7. Among the Russian fairy tales that Propp refers to in Historical Roots, the reader will be able to see in Italian those from the collection of

AN A FANASIEV，古老的俄罗斯童话，译。它。埃诺迪，都灵 1953 年；为了进行比较或比较，您至少可以首先使用其他意大利、法国、德国、挪威童话故事集等。由同一出版社出版。

AN A FANASIEV , Ancient Russian Fairy Tales , Italian translation, Einaudi, Turin 1953; and for comparisons or checks, he may avail himself, at least initially, of the other collections of Italian, French, German, Norwegian, etc. fairy tales published by the same publisher.

航空医学中心

——《民族协会杂志》。

— « Zeitschrift des Vereins für Volkskunde ».

我们介绍的工作有一个介绍性章节，因此在前言中我们可以限制自己进行一些技术观察。

The work we present has an introductory chapter, so in the preface we can limit ourselves to some technical observations.

在书中，我们经常会看到童话故事或童话故事中的段落。这些步骤应被视为说明而不是演示。这个例子的背后隐藏着一个或多或少普遍存在的现象。为了分析这一现象，需要引用的不是一两个插图，而是所有现有的案例，但这会将本书缩减为一个索引，由于其篇幅，该索引将超过整本书。这个困难可以通过参考已有的主题和主题索引来规避。但是，一方面，童话故事按主题的划分以及主题按这些索引所采用的主题的划分通常是完全传统的，另一方面，在作品的过程中，对某些童话故事的引用会出现数百次，并且每个主题都会被引用。如果有必要，请指出对索引的引用。所有这些迫使我放弃了为每个主题引用类型编号的传统。读者将理解本文引用的材料仅代表示例。

In the book one often encounters references to fairy tales or passages from fairy tales. These passages should be considered as illustrations and not as demonstrations. Behind the example lies a more or less widespread phenomenon. To analyze the phenomenon one should cite not just one or two illustrations but all the existing cases, but this would reduce the book to an index that would exceed the entire work in size. One could get around the difficulty with references to the existing subject and motif indexes. But, on the one hand, the division of fairy tales by subjects and subjects by motifs adopted by these indexes is often completely conventional, on the other hand the references to certain fairy tales are encountered hundreds of times in the course of the work and each time it would be necessary to indicate the references to the indexes. All this has forced me to abandon the tradition of citing the type number for each subject. The reader will understand that the materials cited here represent samples.

这同样适用于风俗、仪式、邪教等领域的例子。所有引用的事实仅是示例，其数量可以随意增加或减少，并且所引用的示例可以由其他示例替换。因此，本书并没有提及任何新的事实，只是这些事实之间建立的联系是新的，而这一联系是全书的重心。

The same applies to the examples taken from the field of customs, rites, cults, etc. All the facts adduced are only examples, the number of which can be increased or decreased at will, and the examples cited could be replaced by others. Therefore this work does not give news of any new fact, only the connection established between these facts is new, and in this connection lies the center of gravity of the entire book.

对于暴露的方法仍然有必要进行保留。童话故事的主题彼此紧密相连，一般来说，任何主题都不能孤立地构思，但为了加以阐述，必须将其分成几个部分。因此，在本书的开头，我们找到了仍然需要开发的元素的参考资料，而在本书的后半部分，我们找到了已经公开的元素的参考资料。

It is necessary to make one more reservation regarding the method of exposition. The motifs of the fairy tale are so intimately connected with one another that, as a general rule, no motif can be conceived in isolation, but in order to expound it one must divide it into parts. For this reason at the beginning of the book one encounters references to elements that still have to be developed and in the second half to elements already expounded.

这本书是一个整体，你无法从中间开始阅读以获取有关各个主题的信息。

The book is a whole and you cannot start reading it from the middle to get information on the individual motifs.

在这部作品中，读者将找不到他有权在此类研究中寻求的许多主题的分析。很多东西都没有在那里找到位置。我们坚持分析基本的、本质的童话形象和母题，其余的部分已经发表过，这里不再重复。在某种程度上，也许将来它会以个人草图的形式出现。

In this work the reader will not find the analysis of many motifs that he would have the right to look for in a study of this kind. Many things have not found a place in it. The emphasis has been on the analysis of the fundamental and essential fairy-tale images and motifs; the rest has already been partly published before, and we will not repeat it here. Partly, perhaps, it will appear in the future in the form of individual sketches.

这项工作来自列宁格勒国立大学的墙壁。我的许多同事愿意分享他们的知识和经验，为我提供帮助。我特别感谢教授。伊万·伊万诺维奇·托尔斯泰 (Ivàn Ivànovic Tolstoi)，科学院通讯院士，他为我提供了有关我使用的经典材料和工作中的一般问题的宝贵信息。在此，我向他表示最深切、最诚挚的谢意。

This work came out of the walls of Leningrad State University. Many of my colleagues have willingly assisted me by sharing their knowledge and experience. I am especially indebted to Prof. Ivan Ivanovich Tolstoy, Corresponding Member of the Academy of Sciences, who has given me valuable guidance both on the classical material I have used and on the general problems of the work. I hereby express to him my deepest and most sincere gratitude.

第一章 场所

Chapter OnePremises

1.根本问题。

1. Fundamental problem .

革命之前，民间传说是被压迫阶级的创造：文盲农民、士兵、半文盲工人和工匠。在我们这个时代，民俗是真正意义上的大众创造。革命之前，民俗学是一门自上而下的科学。它由一种抽象的哲学组成，对其革命动力视而不见，在文学上枯竭，因此被视为文学研究的一个分支。在我们这个时代，民俗本身已经成为一门科学。在革命之前的时期，他的方法面对复杂的问题是无能为力的：一种理论接踵而至，但没有一种理论经得起严厉的批评。今天马克思列宁主义的方法，马克思、恩格斯、列宁、斯大林的方法，使我们放弃抽象理论的道路，而走具体考察的道路。

Before the revolution, folklore was a creation of the oppressed classes: illiterate peasants, soldiers, workers, and semi-illiterate artisans. In our time, folklore is, in the truest sense of the word, a popular creation. Before the revolution, folklore was a science that proceeded from the top down. It consisted of a kind of abstract philosophy, was blind to its revolutionary dynamic, was exhausted in literature, and was therefore considered a branch of literary studies. In our time, folklore has become a science in itself. In the period before the revolution, its methods were impotent in the face of its complex problem: theories followed one another, and none of them could stand up to even the most serious criticism. Today, the method of Marxism-Leninism, the method of Marx, Engels, Lenin, Stalin, allows us to abandon the path of abstract theorizing for that of concrete investigation.

但真正研究童话意味着什么？我们应该从哪里开始呢？如果我们仅限于对童话故事进行比较，那么我们就停留在比较主义的范围内。我们想要扩大调查的范围，找到童话故事产生的历史基础。目前，我们仅限于非常笼统地阐述调查童话故事历史根源的问题。

But what does it mean to study fairy tales in practice, and where should we begin? If we limit ourselves to comparing fairy tales with one another, we remain within the realm of comparativism. We want to broaden the scope of the investigation and find the historical basis that gave rise to the fairy tale. For the moment, we limit ourselves to formulating very generally the problem of investigating the historical roots of the fairy tale.

乍一看，解决这个问题的方法似乎没有什么新意。甚至更早的时候，人们就尝试过对民俗进行历史研究。俄罗斯民间传说有一个完整的历史学派，其领袖是弗谢沃洛德·米勒。因此，例如，斯佩兰斯基在他的俄罗斯口头文学课程中说道：“研究口头史诗传说，我们努力猜测其基础上的历史事实，并从这一假设出发，证明故事主体的身份。”我们已知的具有某些事件或事件循环的口头史诗传说 » 1．我们无意猜测历史事实，也无意用民间传说来证明其同一性。对于我们来说，问题通常是不同的。我们想要调查俄罗斯童话对应于历史过去的哪些现象（而不是事件），以及这个过去在多大程度上产生和孕育了它。换句话说，我们的目的是澄清历史现实中童话故事的来源。对一种现象的起源的研究还不是对这种现象的历史的研究。历史研究不可能当场完成，它是长期的工作，不是一个人的工作，而是几代人的工作，它是我们中间正在兴起的马克思主义民俗科学的工作。起源研究是朝这个方向迈出的第一步。

At first glance, there seems to be nothing new in the formulation of this problem. Earlier attempts were made to study folklore historically. Russian folklore had a whole historical school, the head of which was Vsevolod Miller. Thus, for example, in his course on Russian oral literature, Speransky says: "Studying the oral epic legend, we try to guess the historical fact that underlies it and, starting from this assumption, we prove the identity of the subject of the oral epic legend with certain events or cycles of events known to us." 1 We do not intend to guess historical facts or prove their identity with folklore. For us, the question is fundamentally different. We want to investigate to what phenomena (and not events) of the historical past the Russian fairy tale corresponds and to what extent this past produced and gave birth to it. In other words, our aim is to clarify the sources of the fairy tale in historical reality. The study of the genesis of a phenomenon is not yet the study of the history of this phenomenon. The study of history cannot be accomplished there and then, it is the work of long years, it is not the work of a single individual, but of entire generations, it is the work of the Marxist folkloristic science that is emerging among us. The study of genesis is the first step in this direction.

这是我们工作提出的根本问题。

This is the fundamental problem that our work addresses.

2.处所的含义。

2. Meaning of the premises .

每个学者都是从某些前提出发的，这些前提在他开始研究之前就已经存在了。

Every scholar starts from certain premises, which existed in him before he began his work.

自 1873 年以来，维谢洛夫斯基就指出需要首先为我们自己澄清我们的立场，批判性地考虑我们的方法2。维谢洛夫斯基以德古贝尔纳蒂斯的《动物神话》一书为例，证明了尽管该书的作者博学多才，能力强，但缺乏自制力会导致错误的结论。

As early as 1873, Veselovsky had pointed out the need to clarify our positions first of all for ourselves, to critically consider our method 2 . Using the example of De Gubernatis' book Zoological Mythology, Veselovsky demonstrated how the lack of self-control leads to erroneous conclusions, despite all the erudition and combinational ability of the author of the work.

至此，我们应该对童话研究的历史给出一个批判性的概述。我们不会这么做。这些研究的历史已经被反复追溯，我们觉得没有必要一一列举。但如果我们问自己，为什么迄今为止还没有完全安全且得到所有人认可的结果，我们就会发现，这往往恰恰源于作者从错误的前提出发的事实。

At this point it would be necessary to give a critical sketch of the history of fairy tale studies. We will not do so. The history of these studies has been repeatedly traced and we do not feel the need to enumerate these works. But if we ask ourselves why up to now there have been no completely certain and universally recognized results, we see that often this comes precisely from the fact that the authors started from erroneous premises.

所谓的神话学派的前提是，两种现象的明显相似性，它们明显的类比，构成了它们历史联系的证据。因此，举例来说，如果英雄不是一天一天地成长，而是一小时又一小时地成长，那么这种快速成长应该反映出太阳从地平线升起的速度3。但是，首先，太阳在我们眼中并不是变大，而是变小；其次，类比与历史联系不是一回事。

The so-called mythological school started from the premise that the apparent similarity of two phenomena, their apparent analogy, constitutes the proof of their historical connection. Thus, for example, if the hero grows not from day to day, but from hour to hour, this rapid growth should mirror that of the sun rising above the horizon . 3 But, first, the sun does not grow before our eyes, but diminishes, and second, analogy is not the same as historical connection.

所谓芬兰学派的前提之一在于这样一种假设：比某些其他形式更常见的形式也是主体的原始形式所特有的。抛开主体原型理论本身需要证明这一事实不谈，我们将不断有机会说服自己，古老的形式很少遇到，并且经常被具有普遍传播的新形式所取代4。

One of the premises of the so-called Finnish school consists in the assumption that the forms which are encountered more frequently than certain others are also peculiar to the primordial form of the subject. Leaving aside the fact that the theory of the archetypes of the subject itself requires proof, we will repeatedly have occasion to convince ourselves that the archaic forms are encountered very rarely and are often supplanted by new forms which have had a universal diffusion 4 .

在这方面可以举出很多例子，而且在大多数情况下，证明前提的错误并不困难。为什么作者自己没有意识到他们的错误，而这些错误对我们来说如此明显？我们并不是要责怪他们：即使是最伟大的科学家也会犯这些错误；原因在于他们无法以不同的方式思考，他们的想法受到他们生活的时代、他们所属的阶级的制约。在大多数情况下，前提的问题甚至没有被提出，而才华横溢的维谢洛夫斯基的声音，他反复重新审视和研究他的前提，仍然是一个人在沙漠中哭泣的声音。

Many examples can be given in this regard, and in most cases it is not at all difficult to demonstrate the erroneousness of the premises. Why did the authors themselves not notice their errors, so obvious to us? We do not intend to blame them: these are errors that even the greatest scientists have committed; the reason is to be found in the fact that they could not think differently, their ideas were conditioned by the era in which they lived, by the class to which they belonged. In most cases the problem of the premises was not even raised, and the voice of the brilliant Veselovsky, who repeatedly re-examined his premises and restudied them, remained the voice of one crying in the wilderness.

由此而来的后果是我们需要在开始调查之前仔细检查我们的场所。

From this comes the consequence for us of the need for a careful check of our premises before starting the investigation.

3.童话的界定。

3. Delimitation of fairy tales .

我们想要寻找并调查童话故事的历史根源。我们稍后会讲历史根源是什么意思。在此之前，有必要先澄清一下“童话”这个词。童话故事是如此丰富和多面，以至于不可能全面研究它的整个现象、它的所有延伸和所有民族。因此，材料必须受到限制，我将其限制为童话故事。这意味着我预设了某些特殊童话故事的存在，这些童话故事可以被称为童话故事。事实上，这个前提对我来说是存在的。在我看来，“童话故事”这个名称应该适用于我在《童话形态学》一书中研究过其结构的童话故事 5。其中对童话故事的类型进行了相当准确的界定。在这里，我们将研究那种以对某人造成的损害或伤害（老鼠、被逐出家门等）或以占有某物的欲望（国王派他的儿子去寻找火鸟）开始并发展的童话故事。通过主人公离开父亲的家，与一位捐赠者会面，捐赠者为他提供了一辆仙车或一个帮助者，通过这些帮助他找到了他的研究对象。故事进一步呈现与对手的决斗（主要形式是与蛇的决斗）、返回和追逐。通常这种组合物会带来某些并发症。主角已经回家了，兄弟们把他扔下了悬崖。后来他再次出现，通过艰巨的壮举接受考验，登上王位，并在他的王国或他岳父的王国结婚。这是对构成许多不同主题的构图轴的简要示意性阐述。反映这种模式的童话故事在本书中被称为“童话故事”，它们构成了我们的考察对象。

We want to find and investigate the historical roots of the fairy tale. We will say later what we mean by historical roots. Before doing so, the term "fairy tale" must be clarified. The fairy tale is so rich and multifaceted that it is impossible to study the entire phenomenon in its entirety, in all its extension and among all peoples. For this reason the material must be limited, and I limit it to fairy tales. This means that I premise the existence of certain special fairy tales that can be called fairy tales. And, in fact, such a premise exists for me. The term "fairy tales" should be applied in my opinion to the fairy tales whose structure I have studied in my book Morphology of the Fairy Tale . 5 In it, the genre of the fairy tale has been delimited quite precisely. Here we will study the kind of fairy tale that begins with a disability or harm done to someone (abduction, expulsion from home, etc.) or with the desire to possess something (the king sends his son to look for the firebird) and develops through the protagonist's departure from his father's house, the meeting with a donor who offers him a fairy medium or a helper by means of which he finds the object of his search. Later the tale presents a duel with the opponent (the main form is the duel with the snake), the return and the pursuit. Often this composition presents certain complications. The protagonist has already returned home, his brothers throw him into a precipice. Later he reappears, undergoes a test by performing difficult feats, ascends to the throne and marries either in his own kingdom or in the kingdom of his father-in-law. This is the brief schematic exposition of the axis of the composition that is the basis of many and varied subjects. Fairy tales that reflect this pattern will be called "fairy tales" in this book, and they are the object of our investigation.

所以这是第一个前提：童话中有一个特定的类别，通常称为“童话”。这些故事可以与其他故事区分开来，并可以单独研究。这种划界的事实本身就会引起怀疑。这是否违背了我们研究现象所必须遵循的联系原则？但归根结底，世界上的所有现象都是相互联系的，但科学总是将其研究对象的现象与其他现象分开。关键在于在哪里以及如何绘制分界线。

Here then is the first premise: among fairy tales there is a special category, commonly called "fairy tales". These tales can be distinguished from others and studied separately. The very fact of this delimitation may raise doubts. Does this not violate the principle of connection in the light of which we must study phenomena? But, after all, all phenomena in the world are linked together, and yet science always separates from others the phenomena that are subject to its investigation. Everything depends on where and how the line of demarcation is drawn.

童话虽然构成民间传说的一部分，但并不是整体不可分割的一部分。我不像手之于身体或树叶之于树。虽然它们是一部分，但它们本身构成了一个整体，在本研究中它们被视为一个整体。

Although fairy tales are a part of folklore, they are not an inseparable part of the whole. They are not what the hand is to the body or the leaf to the tree. Although they are a part, they are a whole in themselves, and in this study they are considered as a whole.

研究童话故事的结构表明它们之间的密切关系。这种亲缘关系是如此亲密，以至于人们无法将一个主体与另一个主体完全分开。这给我们带来了两个非常重要的前提。第一：任何童话主题都不能单独研究；第二：研究童话主题时必须考虑其与整体的关系。至此，我们的工作总体上迈上了新的道路。

The study of the structure of fairy tales shows their close relationship to one another. This relationship is so intimate that one subject cannot be exactly separated from another. This leads us to two very important premises. First, no subject of a fairy tale can be studied in isolation; second, no motif of a fairy tale can be studied apart from its relations to the whole . With this, our work moves in principle onto a new path.

到目前为止，我们通常按以下方式进行：我们采取任何主题或任何主题，我们收集可能所有的书面变体，然后从材料的对比和比较中得出结论。例如，波利夫卡（Polivka）研究了“有俄罗斯气味”的公式，拉德马赫（Radermacher）研究了那些被鲸鱼吞下然后呕吐的人的主题，鲍姆加滕（Baumgarten）研究了那些被卖给魔鬼的人的主题（“交出你不想要的东西”）。知道在房子里»）等。6 .这些作者没有得出任何结论，也拒绝得出结论。

Up to now, the usual procedure was to take any motif or subject, collect as many written variants as possible, and then draw conclusions by contrasting and comparing the materials. Thus, for example, Polivka studied the formula "there is a smell of Russian," Radermacher the motif of those who are swallowed and then vomited out by a whale, Baumgarten the motif of those sold to the devil ("hand over what you don't know is in the house"), etc. 6 . These authors do not reach any conclusions and refuse to draw any.

以同样的方式研究个别受试者。因此，马肯森研究了会唱歌的骨头的故事，利杰布拉德研究了感恩的死者的故事，等等。7 .这类研究相当多，它们极大地提高了我们对个体个体的扩散和生命的认识，但它们并没有解决起源问题。因此我们暂时完全放弃从主体的角度来研究童话。对我们来说，童话是一个整体，它的所有主题都是相互联系和制约的。因此不可能孤立地调查动机。如果波利夫卡不仅限于收集“闻起来是俄语”这个公式的所有变体，而是问自己是谁发出了这个感叹号，在什么情况下发出的，是对谁说的，等等，如果如果他结合整体来研究，他很可能会得出正确的结论。母题只能在学科体系中研究，学科只能在它们的相互联系中研究。

Individual subjects have been studied in the same way. Thus Mackensen studied the fairy tale of the singing bone, Liljeblad that of the grateful dead, etc. 7 . Studies of this kind are quite numerous, they have considerably advanced our knowledge of the distribution and life of individual subjects, but they have not solved the problems of origin. Therefore we completely renounce for the moment the study of the fairy tale from the point of view of the subject. For us the fairy tale is a whole, all its subjects are mutually connected and conditioned. From this comes the impossibility of isolating the investigation of the motif. If Polivka had not limited himself to collecting all the variants of the formula "it smells of Russian", but had asked himself the question by whom this exclamation is uttered, under what circumstances it is uttered, to whom it is addressed, etc., if he had studied it in connection with the whole, he would most probably have arrived at a correct conclusion. The motive can only be studied in the system of the subject, the subjects can only be studied in their mutual connection.

4.童话作为一种上层建筑性质的现象。

4. The fairy tale as a superstructural phenomenon .

这些都是对童话结构的初步研究推导出来的前提。但这还不是全部。

These are the premises deduced from the preliminary study of the structure of the fairy tale. But that is not all.

我们在上面指出，作者开始的前提往往是他们生活的时代的产物。

We have noted above that the premises from which authors start are often a product of the times in which they lived.

我们生活在社会主义时代。我们的时代也已经发展了自己的前提，需要在此基础上研究精神文化现象。但与其他时代将人道主义科学引入死胡同的前提不同，我们这个时代创造了将人道主义科学引向唯一正确道路的前提。

We live in the era of socialism. Our era has also developed its premises, on the basis of which the phenomena of spiritual culture must be studied. But unlike the premises of other eras that led the humanitarian sciences into a dead end, our era has created premises that lead the humanitarian sciences onto the only right path.

我们这里讨论的前提是研究历史现象的一般前提：“物质生活的生产方式决定了一般生活的社会、政治和精神过程” 8。由此可以非常清楚地看出，我们必须在过去找到使童话故事成为可能的制作方法。

The premise we are dealing with here is the general premise for the study of historical phenomena: "The method of production of material life conditions the social, political and spiritual process of life in general." 8 From which it follows very clearly that we must find in the past the method of production that made the fairy tale possible.

这是什么方法呢？对童话故事的肤浅了解足以断言，例如，资本主义并未产生童话故事。当然，这并不意味着童话故事中没有反映资本主义的生产方式。相反，我们在其中看到了残酷的主人，贪婪的牧师，压扁肋骨的军官，专横的女士，逃兵，悲惨的醉酒农夫，陷入贫困。需要强调的是，这些都是童话故事，而不是有小说背景的童话故事。真实的童话故事，有翼马、火蛇、幻想国王和王后等。它显然不是资本主义的产物，它显然更古老。不要迷失在无用的言语中，我们可以说童话故事比封建主义还要古老。这将在整个调查过程中显现出来。

What was this method? A superficial knowledge of the fairy tale is enough to assert that, for example, capitalism did not produce the fairy tale. This does not mean, of course, that the capitalist method of production is not reflected in the fairy tale. On the contrary, we find in it the cruel master, the greedy priest, the officer who flattens the ribs, the overbearing lady, the deserting soldier, the miserable, drunken, impoverished peasant. It must be emphasized that here we are dealing with fairy tales and not with fairy tales with a novelistic background. The real fairy tale, with winged horses, fiery serpents, imaginary kings and queens, etc. is evidently not a product of capitalism, it is evidently older. Without wasting time in useless words, let us say that the fairy tale is older than feudalism; this will be evident from the whole course of the investigation.

但结果是什么呢？结果，童话故事与它在很大程度上稳固繁荣的生产形式并不相符。对这种不一致的解释也可以在马克思的著作中找到。 “随着经济基础的变化，其整个庞大的上层建筑或多或少会发生快速的剧变” 9。 “或多或少快”这句话非常重要。意识形态的变化并不总是立即伴随着经济基础的变化。结果对于学者来说是一个非常有趣和宝贵的“不一致”：这意味着童话故事是在资本主义之前的生产和社会生活形式的基础上产生的；这意味着童话故事是在资本主义之前的生产和社会生活形式的基础上产生的；它们是什么还有待调查。

But what is the result of this? It turns out that the fairy tale does not correspond to the form of production under which it has largely and firmly prospered. The explanation of this incongruity is also found in Marx. "With the change of the economic basis there occurs a more or less rapid revolution in its entire colossal superstructure." 9 The words "more or less rapid" are very important. The change of ideology does not always immediately follow the change of the economic basis. The result is an "incongruity" which is very interesting and valuable for the scholar: it means that the fairy tale arose on the basis of the forms of production and social life which preceded capitalism; it remains to be investigated what these are.

让我们记住，正是这种不一致使恩格斯能够阐明家庭的起源。恩格斯在《家庭的起源》中引用了摩根的话并提到了马克思：“摩根说，家庭代表着一种积极的元素；它从来不会保持静止，而是随着社会从低级向高级的演变而从低级形式过渡到高级形式。相反，亲属制度是被动的，只有经过很长的时间间隔，它们才会记录家庭所取得的进步，只有当家庭发生根本性的变化时，亲属制度才会发生根本性的变化。” “马克思补充说，同样的事情也普遍发生在政治、司法、宗教和哲学体系中” 10。就我们而言，我们补充说，童话故事也会发生同样的事情。

Let us recall that an incongruity of this kind was precisely what allowed Engels to shed light on the origin of the family. Quoting Morgan and referring to Marx, Engels writes in The Origin of the Family : "The family, says Morgan, represents an active element; it never remains still, but passes from a lower form to a higher one as society evolves from a lower to a higher degree. On the contrary, kinship systems are passive; only after long intervals of time do they register the progress achieved by the family and only undergo radical changes when the family has changed radically." "And the same thing," adds Marx, "occurs in general with political, legal, religious, philosophical systems." 10 For our part, we add that the same thing occurs with fairy tales.

因此，童话故事的起源与其19世纪初开始写作的经济基础无关。这给我们带来了下一个前提，现在我们用非常通用的术语来表述：童话故事必须与过去的历史现实进行比较，并且必须在其中寻找其根源。

Thus the origin of the fairy tale is not connected with the economic basis on which it began to be written down at the beginning of the 19th century . This brings us to the next premise, which we will now formulate in very general terms: the fairy tale must be compared with the historical reality of the past and its roots must be sought in it.

这个前提蕴含着“历史的过去”的潜在概念。如果我们按照弗塞沃洛德·米勒的理解来理解它，那么我们很可能会到达他到达的地方，例如，多布里奇纳·尼基季奇与蛇的斗争是根据诺夫哥罗德洗礼的历史事实而形成的。

This premise contains the latent concept of the "historical past." If we understand it as Vsevolod Miller understood it, it is quite likely that we will arrive where he arrived, stating, for example, that Dobrychna Nikitich's fight with the serpent was formed on the basis of the historical fact of the baptism of Novgorod.

因此，我们有必要破译历史性过去的概念，确定过去的哪些内容对于解释童话故事是必不可少的。

It is therefore essential for us to decipher the concept of the historical past, to determine what of this past is indispensable to explain the fairy tale.

5.童话故事和过去的社会制度。

5. The fairy tale and the social institutions of the past .

如果把童话看作是在一定经济基础上产生的产物，那么显然有必要考察它反映了哪些生产形式。

If the fairy tale is considered as a product that arose on a certain economic basis, it is clear that it is necessary to examine which forms of production are reflected in it.

在童话故事中，直接提及制作的内容非常少。农业只占其中最小的一部分，狩猎更广泛地体现在其中。通常只有在故事的开头才会有人播种或犁地，而开头是最容易改变的部分。在故事的进一步发展中，猫头鹰、国王的猎人或自由者以及每种野生动物都代表着重要的组成部分。

In fairy tales, immediate references to production are very few and far between. Agriculture plays a small part, hunting is reflected more fully. Usually only at the beginning of the tale are there those who sow or plough, and the beginning is the part most susceptible to change. In the further course of the tale, the strelitzes, the king's hunters or the free ones play an important part, as do all kinds of wild animals.

但是，仅仅从对象或技巧的角度来研究童话故事的创作形式，并没有让我们进一步研究故事本身的来源。重要的不是生产技术本身，而是与之相对应的社会制度。至此，我们首次澄清了与童话故事相关的历史过去的概念。整个调查归结为确定个人主题和整个故事是在哪种社会制度下创造的。

But the investigation of the forms of production in the fairy tale under the sole aspect of the object or technique takes us little further in the study of the sources of the tale itself. It is not the technique of production as such that is important, but rather the social regime that corresponds to it. Thus we derive the first clarification of the concept of historical past with regard to the fairy tale. The whole investigation is summed up in determining under which social regime the individual motifs and the entire tale were created.

但“政权”这个词是一个非常笼统的概念。有必要考察这一政权的具体表现：机构就是其中之一。因此，不可能将童话故事与父权制度进行比较，但可以将其某些主题与父权制度的某些制度进行比较，因为这些制度反映在故事中或起源于那些给定的主题。由此而来的前提是，必须将童话故事与过去的社会制度进行比较，并在其中寻找其根源。这导致对历史概念的进一步澄清，必须在其中寻找童话的起源。因此，例如，我们看到在童话故事中保留了与现在不同的婚姻形式。主角在遥远的国家寻找新娘，而不是在自己的国家。这可能是异族通婚现象的反映：可能由于某种原因，不可能在自己的环境中结婚。因此，必须研究童话故事中的婚姻形式，并找出这些形式实际存在的制度、阶段、阶段或社会发展阶段。例如，我们也经常看到主角登上王位。主角登上的王位归谁所有？我们看到他取代的不是他的父亲，而是他的岳父，而且他经常杀死他的岳父。那么问题来了：童话故事中反映了哪些形式的权力继承？总之，我们的前提是童话保留了现已消失的社会生活形式的痕迹，必须对这些残留物进行研究，并且这项研究揭示了许多童话主题的来源。

But the word "regime" is a very generic concept. It is necessary to consider the concrete manifestations of this regime: institutions are one of these manifestations. Thus it is not possible to compare the fairy tale with the patriarchal regime, but it is possible to compare some of its motifs with certain institutions of the patriarchal regime, since these are reflected in the tale or have given rise to those given motifs. From here comes the premise that the fairy tale must be compared with the social institutions of the past and its roots must be sought in them. This leads to a further specification of the concept of historical past in which the origin of the fairy tale must be sought. Thus, for example, we see that in the fairy tale forms of marriage different from those of today have been preserved. The protagonist looks for a bride in distant countries, and not in his own. It is possible that this is a reflection of the phenomenon of exogamy: probably, for some reason, it was not possible to take a wife in one's own environment. For this reason the forms of marriage in the fairy tale must be studied and the regime, stage, phase or stage of social development in which these forms actually existed must be found. We also see, for example, that the protagonist very often ascends to the throne. To whom does the throne belong to which the protagonist ascends? We see that he takes the place not of his father but of his father-in-law, and that he very frequently kills him. And here the question arises: what forms of succession to power are reflected in the fairy tale? In a word, we start from the premise that the fairy tale has preserved traces of forms of social life that have now disappeared, that these residues must be studied and that this study discloses the sources of many motifs in the fairy tale.

当然，这还不是全部。确实，许多童话主题可以通过以下事实来解释：它们反映了实际存在的制度，但也有一些主题与任何制度没有直接联系。因此，上述领域不足以作为比较的材料。并不是所有的事情都可以通过这个或那个机构的存在来解释。

But this is not all, of course. It is true that many motifs in fairy tales can be explained by the fact that they reflect institutions that actually existed, but there are motifs that are not directly connected to any institution. Consequently, the above-mentioned field is not sufficient as material for comparison. Not everything can be explained by the presence of this or that institution.

6.童话和仪式。

6. The fairy tale and the ritual .

人们早就注意到童话故事与邪教领域、宗教有着一定的联系。严格来说，崇拜、宗教，可以说是一种制度。然而，正如政权体现在制度上一样，宗教制度也体现在某些崇拜行为中。这些行为中的每一个都不能说是一种制度，童话与宗教的联系可以成为源自童话与社会制度的联系的特定问题的主题。恩格斯在他的《反杜林论》中绝对准确地阐述了宗教的本质。 « 每一种宗教不过是人们日常生活中统治他们的外部力量在人们头脑中的奇妙反映；它是尘世力量以超自然力量形式的反映。在历史之初，自然力量首先受到这种反思。但很快，与自然力量一起出现的社会力量也出现了，这些力量反对个人并统治着个人，起初仍然是不可理解的、陌生的，并被赋予了明显的自然必然性，就像自然力量一样。最初只反映神秘的自然力量的奇幻图像，获得了社会属性并成为历史力量的代表» 11。

It has long been noted that the fairy tale has a certain connection with the sphere of cults, with religion. Strictly speaking, the cult, religion, can be called an institution. However, just as the regime manifests itself in institutions, the institution of religion manifests itself in certain acts of worship; each of these acts cannot be called an institution, and the connection of the fairy tale with religion can be the subject of a special problem arising from the connection of the fairy tale with social institutions. In his Anti-Dühring, Engels formulated the essence of religion quite accurately. "All religion is nothing but the fantastic reflection in the minds of men of those external forces which reign over them in their daily life; it is a reflection in which earthly forces take the form of supernatural forces. At the dawn of history, natural forces are the first to undergo this reflection. But soon social forces also appear alongside the forces of nature, forces which oppose the individual and reign over him, remaining at first incomprehensible, alien and endowed with a visible natural necessity, like the forces of nature. The fantastic images in which at first only the mysterious forces of nature were reflected, acquire social attributes and become representatives of historical forces» 11 .

但正如童话故事不能与一般的社会政权相比，它也不能与一般的宗教相比，它必须与这种宗教的具体表现相比较。恩格斯指出，宗教是自然力量和社会力量的反映。这种反思可以是双重的：它可以是认知性的，导致教条和学说，体现在解释世界的程序中，也可以是意志性的，导致以作用于自然并征服自然为目的的行为或行动。我们将这些行为称为仪式和习俗。

But just as one cannot compare a fairy tale with a social regime in general, one cannot compare it with religion in general, one must compare it with concrete manifestations of this religion. Engels notes that religion is a reflection of the forces of nature and social forces. This reflection can be twofold: it can be cognitive and result in dogmas and doctrines, manifesting itself in procedures for explaining the world, or it can be volitional and result in acts or actions aimed at acting on nature and subjugating it. We will call these actions rites and customs.

礼和习俗不是一回事。例如，男人的埋葬是通过火葬进行的，这是一种习俗，而不是一种仪式。但习俗周围充满了仪式，从方法论的角度来看，将其中的一种与另一种分开是错误的。

Rite and custom are not the same thing. Thus, for example, the burial of men is done by cremation, this is a custom, not a rite. But custom is surrounded by rites and separating one from the other is wrong from the point of view of method.

童话里保留了无数礼俗的痕迹：只有通过与礼俗的比较，很多原因才能从基因上得到解释。例如，在童话故事中，据说女孩将牛骨头埋在花园里并给它们浇水。这种习俗或仪式确实存在。不知道出于什么原因，但动物的骨头没有被消耗或毁坏，而是被埋葬了12。如果我们能够证明哪些图案可以追溯到类似的仪式，那么这些图案的起源本身就已经以某种方式得到澄清。有必要系统地研究童话故事与仪式的这种联系。

The fairy tale has preserved traces of a great many rites and customs. Only by comparing them with the rites can many motifs be explained genetically. Thus, for example, in the fairy tale it is said that the girl buries the bones of the cow in the garden and waters them. This custom or this rite really existed. It is not known why, but the bones of the animals were not consumed or destroyed, but were buried . 12 If we could prove which motifs go back to similar rites, the origin of these motifs would already be in itself somewhat clarified. It is necessary to study this connection of the fairy tale with the rites systematically.

这种比较可能比乍一看要困难得多。童话不是编年史。它和仪式之间存在着不同形式的关系、不同形式的纽带，必须简要地加以考察。

Such a comparison may be much more difficult than it appears at first glance. The fairy tale is not a chronicle. Between it and the rite there are different forms of relationships, different forms of ties that must be examined briefly.

7.童话与仪式的直接对应。

7. Direct correspondence between fairy tale and ritual .

最简单的例子就是礼俗与童话故事的完全重合。这种情况很少发生。因此，在童话故事中，骨头是被埋葬的，而在历史现实中，它们正是以这种方式进行的。或者在童话故事中，据说国王的孩子们被关在地牢里，并被关在黑暗中，给他们食物是为了不让任何人看到，而在历史现实中，事情正是这样发生的。找到这些相似之处对于民俗学家来说极其重要。详细阐述这些对应关系是至关重要的，然后往往可以证明给定的主题可以追溯到这个或那个仪式或习俗，并且可以解释它的起源。

The simplest case is the complete coincidence of the rite and custom with the fairy tale. This case occurs rarely. Thus in the fairy tale the bones are buried, and in historical reality this was precisely the case. Or in the fairy tale it is said that the king's children are locked in a cellar and kept in the dark, that food is given to them so that no one sees it, and in historical reality this was precisely the case. The discovery of these parallels is extremely important for the folklorist. It is indispensable to elaborate these correspondences, and then it can often turn out that a given motif goes back to this or that rite or custom, and its genesis can be explained.

8.将仪式的意义转入童话故事。

8. Transposition of the meaning of the rite into the fairy tale .

但是，正如我们已经说过的，童话故事和仪式之间的这种直接对应并不常见。更多时候，我们会遇到另一种关联、另一种现象，这种现象可以称为仪式意义的换位。这里所说的意义转换，是指用另一种更容易理解的元素来替换童话故事中随着历史变迁而变得多余或难以理解的任何元素或仪式的某些元素。因此，意义的转换通常与变形、形式的改变有关。动机经常会发生变化，但构成仪式的部分也可能会发生变化。例如，在童话故事中，据说主角将自己缝在牛皮或马皮中，以便从深坑中逃出来或到达遥远的王国。随后，一只鸟抓住了他，并将皮肤与主角一起运送到他永远无法到达的山上或海上。我们如何解释这个主题的起源？将死者缝在兽皮上的习俗是众所周知的。这个原因是否可以追溯到这个习俗呢？对童话故事的习俗和主题的系统研究表明了它们之间毫无疑问的联系：因此，不仅外部形式而且内部内容、主题的意义、动作的进展和内容都完全一致。该仪式在历史上的意义（见第六章第 3 节）。但有一个例外：在童话中，是一个活人将自己缝进了自己的皮肤里，而在仪式中，它涉及的是死者。这种不对应代表了一个非常简单的意义转换的例子：在习俗中，将死者缝进一张皮里的行为确保了后者到达死者的王国，而在童话故事中，它确保了到达​​遥远的王国。

But, as we have already said, such a direct correspondence between fairy tale and rite is not very frequent. More often we encounter another correlation, another phenomenon, a phenomenon that can be called transposition of the meaning of the rite. By transposition of meaning we mean here the substitution in the fairy tale of any element or of some elements of the rite, which have become superfluous or incomprehensible following historical changes, with another more comprehensible element. Therefore the transposition of meaning is usually connected with a deformation, with a change of forms. Very often there is a change of motivation, but also the parts that constitute the rite can be subject to modifications. Thus, for example, in the fairy tale it is said that the protagonist is sewn into the skin of a cow or horse in order to be able to get out of a pit or to reach the distant kingdom. Later a bird catches him and carries the skin together with the protagonist to the mountain or across the sea where he would never have been able to reach otherwise. How can the origin of this motif be explained? The custom of sewing the dead into animal skins is well known. Can this motif be traced back to this custom or not? A systematic study of the custom and the fairy tale motif shows their undoubted connection: thus one obtains a complete coincidence not only of the external forms but also of the internal content, of the meaning of this motif, of the course of the action and of the meaning of this rite in the historical past (see chap. VI, § 3). But there is an exception: in the fairy tale it is a living man who is sewn into the skin, in the rite it is the dead. This non-correspondence represents a very simple case of transposition of meaning: in the custom the act of sewing a dead person into a skin assured the latter's arrival in the realm of the dead, whereas in the fairy tale it assures the arrival in the distant realm.

术语“意义转换”是合适的，因为它表示已经发生的变化的过程。意义转换的事实证明，人们的生活发生了某些变化，这些变化也带来了动机的变化。必须根据具体情况检测和解释这些变化。

The term "transposition of meaning" is appropriate because it indicates a process of change that has taken place. The fact of the transposition of meaning proves that certain changes have occurred in the life of the people which have also brought with them a change of motif. These changes must be detected and explained case by case.

我们已经给出了一个非常简单明了的意义转换的例子。在许多情况下，原始基础是如此模糊，以至于并不总是能够发现它。

We have given a very simple and clear example of transposition of meaning. In many cases the primordial basis is so obscured that it is not always possible to discover it.

9.仪式的逆转。

9. Reversal of the rite .

我们必须将童话故事中保留所有仪式形式并添加相反的含义或意义、相反的处理方式视为意义转换的一个特例。我们将这些情况称为反转。我们用一些例子来解释我们的观察。民间有杀老人的习俗。但童话里讲述了一个本该被杀的老人却没有被杀。只要这个习俗继续存在，任何怜悯老人的人都会受到嘲笑，甚至侮辱甚至惩罚。在童话故事中，怜悯老人的人就是英雄，他行事明智。有将女孩作为祭品献给河流的习俗，因为土地的肥沃取决于河流。这发生在种植之初，应该有助于植物茁壮成长。但在童话故事中，主角出现了，并将女孩从怪物手中救了出来，而怪物却把她带到了吞噬她的地方。事实上，在仪式存在的时候，这样的“解放者”就会像危害人民福祉和庄稼的恶棍一样被肢解。这些事实表明，这个主题有时源于与先前历史现实的消极关系。当存在需要女孩牺牲的生活条件时，这个主题（或主题）不可能作为童话主题出现。但随着这些生活条件的衰落，曾经被认为是神圣的习俗，女主人公成为有时自愿去牺牲的牺牲品的习俗，变得多余和令人反感，而童话故事的英雄则是古代的恶棍。谁阻止了这种牺牲。总的来说，这是一个非常重要的观察结果。它证明了主体并非产生于对现实的直接反映的演化，而是产生于对现实的否定过程。主题与现实相对应。由此，当列宁将进化发展的概念与作为对立单位的发展概念进行对比时，他的话得到了证实。 « 只有第二个给了我们一切存在物自我运动的钥匙；只是它为我们提供了跳跃、中断渐进性、转变为对立、旧事物的毁灭和新事物的兴起的关键” 13。

We must consider as a special case of transposition of meaning the preservation of all the forms of the rite with the addition in the fairy tale of an opposite sense or meaning, an opposite treatment. We will call these cases inversion. Let us explain our observation with some examples. There was a custom of killing old people. But in the fairy tale it is told how an old man who should have been killed is not killed. As long as this custom remained in force, whoever had pity on the old man would have been laughed at, or perhaps insulted and even punished. In the fairy tale the one who has pity on the old man is the hero, who acts wisely. There was a custom of offering a girl as a burnt offering to the river on which the fertility of the land depended. This happened at the beginning of sowing and was supposed to help the plants to thrive. But in the fairy tale the protagonist appears and frees the girl from the monster to whom she had been brought to devour her. In fact, at the time of the existence of the rite, such a "liberator" would have been torn to pieces like a scoundrel who endangered the well-being of the people and the harvest. These facts demonstrate that the subject sometimes arises from a negative relationship with a previous historical reality. This subject (or motif) could not have arisen as a fairy-tale motif when there were living conditions that required the holocaust of girls. But with the decline of these living conditions, the custom once considered sacred, the custom by virtue of which the heroine was the girl-victim who sometimes voluntarily went to the sacrifice, becomes superfluous and repugnant and the hero of the fairy tale is the ancient scoundrel who prevented this sacrifice. In principle, this is a very important observation. It proves that the subject does not arise from the evolution of the direct reflection of reality but from a process of denial of this reality. The subject corresponds to reality by antithesis. This confirms Lenin's words when he contrasts the conception of evolutionary development with the conception of development as a unity of antithesis. "Only the latter gives us the key to the self-movement of all that exists; only it gives us the key to leaps, to the interruption of graduality, to transformation into antithesis, to the destruction of the old and the rise of the new . " 13

所有这些初步的考虑和观察使我们提出另一个前提：有必要将童话故事与仪式和习俗进行比较，以确定哪些母题可以追溯到这个或那个仪式，以及它们与仪式有什么关系。

All these preliminary considerations and observations lead us to advance another premise: it is necessary to compare the fairy tale with the rites and customs to determine which motifs go back to this or that rite and in what relations they are found with it.

这时就出现了困难。即使是作为对抗自然的手段而诞生的仪式，也不会随着时间的推移而消亡，当人们找到了对抗自然并对其采取行动的理性方法时，它的意义却发生了变化。通过这种方式，民俗学家可以通过将主题追溯到仪式，发现这个主题可以追溯到意义已经改变的仪式，并面临着解释仪式的需要。在某些情况下，仪式的原始基础可能非常模糊，以至于需要对相关仪式进行专门研究。但这不再是民俗学家的任务，而是民族志学者的任务。在建立了童话与仪式之间的联系之后，民俗学家也有权拒绝研究仪式，否则他就会走得太远。

At this point a difficulty arises. Even the rite, born as a means of fighting against nature, does not die, but changes its meaning, as time goes by, when rational methods have been found to fight against nature and act upon it. In this way it may happen that, by tracing the motif back to a rite, the folklorist discovers that this motif goes back to a rite that has changed its meaning and is placed in the need to explain the rite as well. Here certain cases are possible in which the primordial basis of the rite is so obscured that the rite in question requires special study. But this is no longer the task of the folklorist, but of the ethnographer. After having established the connection between the fairy tale and the rite, the folklorist has the right to refuse to study the rite as well, which would take him too far.

那么还有一个困难。仪式生活和民间传说实际上都是由数千个不同的细节组成的。是否有必要针对每一个细节寻找经济原因？对此，恩格斯写道：“史前时期经济发展水平低下，其根源是对自然的不准确表述，有时是其条件，甚至是其原因。尽管经济需要一直并且日益成为先进自然知识的基本驱动力，但想要为每一个原始的废话寻找经济原因仍然是迂腐的”（1890年10月27日致K.施密特的信）14。这些话已经说得很清楚了。对此，有必要补充一下：如果我们在氏族社会阶段、古埃及、古典时期等奴隶制阶段引用同样的母题的话。 （类似的比较会经常发生），在这样做时，我们注意到主题的演变，我们认为没有必要每次都特别强调主题的转变，不是由于内部的演变，而是因为它已经发生了在新的历史环境下。我们不仅要努力避免迂腐的陷阱，还要避免图式主义的陷阱。

There is another difficulty. Both ritual life and folklore are made up of literally thousands of different details. Is it necessary to look for economic causes for each of these details? In this connection Engels writes: "The low economic development of the prehistoric period has as its complement and sometimes as its condition and even as its cause an inaccurate representation of nature. And although economic necessity has always been and is becoming more and more the essential spring of an advanced knowledge of nature, it would nevertheless be pedantry to want to look for economic causes for every primitive trifle" (Letter to K. Schmidt, October 27, 1890) 14 . These words are clear enough. In this connection it is indispensable to add the following: if the same motif is cited by us in the stage of clan society, in the stage of the slave regime of the type of ancient Egypt, of classical antiquity, etc. (similar comparisons will recur very often) and in doing so we note the evolution of the motif, we do not deem it necessary to particularly emphasize each time that the motif has transformed itself not by virtue of an evolution from within, but because it has happened in a new historical environment. We will try to avoid the pitfall of pedantry, not only, but also that of schematism.
