Of all the varieties of the serpent duel (among primitive peoples, in the Rigveda , in classical antiquity, in Egypt, China) the Russian fairy tale has the closest analogy in substance and detail with the Egyptian one (except for the figure of the horse) described in the Book of the Dead . This does not mean that Egypt is the homeland of the Russian fairy tale and that this motif passed from Egypt to Europe. It means something quite different, namely that the fairy tale reflects this late and agricultural conception of myth. It is precisely the stage after which the disintegration begins in the sense of plurality and multiformity, the disintegration in the plurality of local cults (such as we find, for example, in Greece with the Hydra, the Gorgon, Medusa, Python, the Lernaean serpent, Ladon, Cerberus, etc., etc.). Typicality gives way to individualization, on the other hand a fossilization occurs, or, more precisely, an ossification, a skeleton is created which remains intact for centuries and is clothed in the living flesh of a completely different formation, the living flesh of the fairy tale. In view of this fact we must dwell a little longer on the Egyptian materials.

《亡灵之书》中的主要毒蛇战士是太阳神拉（Rha）。在他的日常旅途中，他遇到了阿波菲斯并将他击倒。战斗本身从未被描述过，另一方面，对蛇的胜利及其毁灭却被广泛颂扬。在《亡灵之书》第39章中我们读到：“他（拉）刺穿了你的头，他劈开了你的脸，他把你的头散落在路的两边，它躺在他的地上；他把你的头打碎了。”你的骨头已被打碎，你的四肢已与身体分离。”

The chief serpent fighter in the Book of the Dead is the sun god Rha. On his daily journey he encounters Apophis and strikes him down. The fight itself is never described, but the victory over the serpent and its destruction are lavishly praised. In the 39th chapter of the Book of the Dead we read: "He (Rha) has pierced your head, he has split your face, he has scattered your head on both sides of the road, it is stretched out on its ground; your bones are dashed in pieces, your limbs are torn from your body."

在名为《推翻阿波菲斯之书》的宇宙起源文本中，对这场胜利进行了更详细的描述。在描述了世界和众神的创造之后，我们读到486：

The victory is described even more minutely in the cosmogonic text which goes under the name of the Book of the Slaying of Apophis . After the description of the creation of the world and the gods, we read 486 :

我派他们（即诸神），

I sent them (that is, the gods),

从我的成员中产生，

arisen from my limbs,

以便他们能够击败邪恶的敌人。

so that they might strike down the evil enemy.

他，阿波菲斯，掉入火中，

He, Apofis, fell into the fire,

刀插在他的头上，

the knife is stuck in his head,

他的耳朵被割掉，

his ear is cut off,

他的名字不再存在于这个地球上。

His name no longer exists on this earth.

我命令打伤他（？），

I ordered the wounds to be produced for him (?),

我烧了他的骨头，

I burned his bones,

我每天都摧毁他的灵魂，

I destroyed his soul daily,

。 。 。 。 。 。 。 （差距）

. . . . . . . ( gap )

我把他的四肢从骨头上砍下来，

I severed the limbs from his bones,

我 。 。 。 。 。 他的脚，

I . . . . . his feet,

我砍掉了他的双手

I cut off his hands,

我闭上了他的嘴和嘴唇，

I closed his mouth and his lips,

我咬碎了他的牙齿

I ground his teeth,

我把舌头从他的下巴上割下来，

I cut the tongue out of his jaws,

我夺走了他的演讲，

I took away his speech,

我蒙蔽了他的眼睛

I blinded his eyes,

我夺走了他的听力，

I took away his hearing,

我把我的心移离了原来的位置，

I moved my heart away from its place,

他的名字已经不存在了。

his name no longer exists.

这张纸莎草纸被放在死者手中，因为在旅途中它可以保护他免受阿波菲斯和其他蛇的伤害。在《死者之书》中，“我”不仅指拉哈，有时也指将自己等同于死者的奥西里斯。

This papyrus was placed in the hand of the deceased, because during the journey it protected him from Apophis and the other serpents. In the Book of the Dead "I" is not only Rha, but is sometimes also Osiris who identifies himself with the deceased.

第十七章。 « 哦，胜利的拉……将抄写员内布森特（即死者）从诸神手中解救出来，他的脸像狗的脸，眉毛像人的眉毛；它们以尸体为食，潜伏在火湖蜿蜒的地方，撕裂死者的尸体，吞下心脏，但吐出残骸，保持隐形。”

Chap. XVII. « O Rha the victor… free the scribe Nebsent (i.e. the deceased) from the gods whose face is like the face of a dog, whose eyebrows are like the eyebrows of man; they feed on corpses, they lie in wait at the meander of the lake of fire and tear the bodies of the dead and swallow the hearts, but spit out the remains, remaining invisible ».

在这里，我们发现了正在吞咽和打嗝的火成湖。他们威胁那些没有掌握《死亡之书》所提供的魔法科学的死者。在这里我们还看到了吞咽表征的物化原理。与地狱犬一样，蛇犬也以腐肉为食。在《击倒阿波菲斯之书》中也提到了舌头的截断。然而，在这种情况下，这并不是识别英雄的一种方式，而是与 434 一起提到去除眼睛和心脏，也就是说被认为是灵魂所在地的器官（在埃及尤其是眼睛）。在它的舌头和眼睛被移除之前，这条蛇不能被视为已被杀死。这就是为什么即使是杀害继女的邪恶继母也要求被害女人的眼睛和舌头作为死亡证据。在童话故事中，语言已经从死亡的证明转变为行为已经完成的证明。

Here we find the fiery lake, the swallowing and the belching. They threaten the deceased who is not equipped with the magical knowledge provided by the Book of the Dead . Here we also see the principle of materialization, of the representation of swallowing. Like Cerberus, the snake-dogs feed on carrion. In the Book of the Slaying of Apophis, the amputation of the tongue is also mentioned; however, in this case it is not a means of identifying the hero, but is mentioned alongside the removal of the eyes and the heart, that is, the organs which were believed to be the seat of the soul (in Egypt especially the eyes). Until the tongue and eyes have been removed, the serpent cannot be considered dead. And that is why even the wicked stepmother who has sent her stepdaughter to her death demands the eyes and tongue of the slain woman as proof of death. In the fairy tale, the tongue has been transformed from proof of death into proof that the deed has been accomplished.

让我们抄写《亡灵之书》中的更多段落。

Let us transcribe some more passages from the Book of the Dead .

« 你的敌人，蛇，被投入火中，蛇的敌人塞劳仰面倒下；他的手被锁住，拉砍掉了他的脚”（第 5 章）。 “按照我内心的愿望，我避开了火池并扑灭了火”（第22章）。

"Your enemy the serpent has been given over to the fire, the enemy serpent Selau has fallen on his back; his hands are chained, Rha has cut off his feet" (chap. 5). "According to my heart's desire I avoided the fiery pool and smothered the fire" (chap. 22).

那家伙。 108/a 特别有趣：

Chapter 108/a is particularly interesting:

« 那座山的山顶上有一条长三十噚的蛇。前八只手臂覆盖着燧石和闪闪发光的金属涂层。胜利者奥西里斯努知道这条住在他山顶的蛇的名字。 “他自己的火焰的居住者”是他的名字。现在，拉停下来后，他将目光锁定在他身上，拉的船就会停下来，船上的他就会陷入沉睡，他会吞下七英寻的大水。因此，他将迫使苏提撤退，因为他体内有一根铁鱼叉，这将迫使他吐出所有吃过的东西，因此塞提将被置于禁欲的位置。”

"On the summit of that mountain is a serpent measuring thirty fathoms in length. The first eight fathoms are covered with flint and a sheath of glittering metal. Osiris-Nu, the triumphant, knows the name of this serpent that lives on his own summit. 'Dweller in his own fire' is his name. Now, after Rha has stopped, he has fixed his gaze upon him and the boat of Rha will stop and a great sleep will take hold of him who is in the boat and he will swallow seven fathoms of the great water. Thus he will force Suti to retire, for he will have within him an iron harpoon, and this will force him to vomit all that he had eaten, and thus Seti will be placed in the place of abstinence."

对于民俗学家来说，这段文字最有趣的地方在于它提到了睡眠。在上述任何材料中均未发现此细节。在童话故事中，英雄在战斗前的睡眠是一种暗示，一种他永不屈服的诱惑。即使遇到女巫，英雄也不能睡着。但在这里，睡眠有一个非常不同的，或者说相反的含义。这是获胜的条件。正如我们已经提到的，在战斗之前，英雄会与公主共度时光，并将头放在她的腿上睡觉。他在战斗前睡觉，甚至为这种睡眠创造了一个特殊的绰号“这是bogatyr的睡眠” 487。公主唤醒了他，但在这种情况下，唤醒英雄是非常困难的。

For the folklorist this passage is interesting above all for the reference to sleep. This detail has not been found in any of the above-mentioned materials. In the fairy tale the sleep that falls on the hero before the battle is a suggestion, a flattery to which he never gives in. Even when he meets the sorceress the hero must not fall asleep. But here sleep has a very different, indeed opposite, meaning. It is a condition for victory. As we have already mentioned, before the battle the hero converses with the princess, rests his head on her knees to sleep. He sleeps before the fight, and a special epithet has even been coined for this sleep: "it is the sleep of a bogatyr . " 487 The princess wakes him, but in such cases it is very difficult to wake the hero.

至于吞咽和打嗝，埃及古物学家将能够对埃及的这一主题进行更详细的阐述：对于民俗学家来说，它是更古老、更原始的神话形式的残余。

As regards swallowing and belching, the Egyptologist may present a more detailed elaboration of this motif for Egypt: for the folklorist it is a residue of an older and more primitive formation of the myth.

蛇及其杀戮的形象的所有这些细节（火成自然，火成湖，试图吞下新来者，对蛇所有部分的精心破坏，去除舌头的细节，打瞌睡的细节），所有这些特征使我们认为，蛇进入童话故事是对它在先进农业国家中存在的相同表征的折射，并且准确地说是作为死亡王国的守护者，作为“死者的食者” 。这是朝圣的最后阶段，死者在此之后将获得永恒的幸福。

All these details of the image of the serpent and its killing (fiery nature, fiery lake, attempt to swallow the newcomer, meticulous destruction of all the parts of the serpent, detail of the removal of the tongues, detail of the slumber), all these characteristics lead us to suppose that the serpent entered the fairy tale as a refraction of those same representations in which it exists in advanced agricultural states, and precisely as the guardian of the kingdom of the dead, as an "eater of the dead". It is the last stage of the wanderings, after which the deceased reaches eternal bliss.

34.精神停滞。

34. Psychostasis .

在这里，吞噬已经变成了令人恐惧和令人厌恶的东西。但这还不是全部：它被转化为惩罚，也就是说，整个理由被赋予了道德色彩。吞噬（当它发生时，但通常是避免的）是在审判之前进行的，这个细节也保留在童话故事中。 Budge 488说：“那些被法庭判处死刑的人会立即被移交给死亡吞噬者受折磨，然后他们就不再存在了。 ”看起来，与怪物的决斗和吞噬前的判断之间存在着矛盾；但这些矛盾并没有让埃及人的心态大为不安。审判和法庭是一种更现代的现象：根据莫雷特的说法，它们从第六王朝489开始相遇，决斗更古老，这两种表现形式共存而没有冲突。 “死亡吞噬者”有时被描述为一种混合生物，前面是鳄鱼，后面是河马，中间是狮子。他也经常被描绘成一只狗。判决包括在天平上称量新死者的心脏。死者的心脏，即他的良心，无论是光明的还是因罪孽而恶化的，都被放在盘子上；另一方面，真理以女神玛阿特的小雕像或钢笔的形式放置，这是女神的象形文字。由此可见，装有心脏的盘子下降意味着死亡，但如果盘子上升或与另一个盘子保持在同一水平，则意味着赦免。

Here the devouring has been transformed into something frightening and repugnant. But that is not all: it has been transformed into a punishment, that is to say, the whole motif has been given a moral colouring. The devouring (when it occurred, but usually it was avoided) was preceded by a judgement, and this detail has also been preserved in the tale. "Those condemned to the tribunal were immediately handed over to the Devourer of the Dead to be tortured, and they ceased to exist," says Budge . 488 It might seem that there is a contradiction between the duel with the monster and the judgement that precedes the devouring; but these contradictions do not greatly disconcer the Egyptian mentality. Judgement and tribunal are a more modern phenomenon: according to Moret they meet from the sixth dynasty onwards . 489 The duel is older and these two representations coexist without collision. "The Devourer of the Dead" is sometimes depicted as a hybrid being, crocodile in the front, hippopotamus in the back, lion in the center. He is also often depicted as a dog. The judgment consisted of weighing the heart of the newly deceased on a scale. On one plate was placed the heart of the dead person, that is, his conscience, light or burdened by sins; on the other was placed the truth in the form of a statuette of the goddess Ma'at, or a pen, a hieroglyph of the goddess. From this we see that the lowering of the plate containing the heart meant death, while if the plate rose or remained at the same level as the other, it meant absolution.

只有一部俄罗斯童话保留了灵魂的重量，或者说精神停滞。这是《女巫与太阳的姐妹》（Aph.50）。吞噬所有人的女巫伊万生下了一个妹妹。他逃离了“太阳姐妹”。 « 与此同时，伊凡策马奔向太阳修女的房间，大声喊道：“索利塞洛！索利切洛！开门！ “太阳姐姐打开窗户，小国王和马一起跳了进去。女巫开始要求他们把她哥哥的头给她。太阳修女没有听她的话，也没有把她交出来。然后女巫说：“我想让小国王伊万跟我一起去称一下体重，看看我们谁更重。如果是我，我就吃掉他，如果是他，就杀了我吧。”他们也确实这么做了。伊凡国王第一个爬上天平，然后女巫也爬了上去；但他刚踏上盘子，小伊凡国王就被猛地向上抛起，直冲云霄，进入了太阳姐妹的房间。相反，蛇女巫仍然留在地球上。”

Only one Russian fairy tale has preserved the weighing of souls, or psychostasis. It is The Witch and the Sister of the Sun (Aph. 50). Ivan is born a sister, a witch who devours everyone. He runs away from the "Sister of the Sun." "At the same time Ivan galloped to the room of the Sister of the Sun and shouted: 'Little Sun! Little Sun! Open the door!'" The Sister of the Sun opened the window and the little king jumped in with his horse. The witch began to demand that they give her her brother's head; the Sister of the Sun did not listen to her and did not give it to her. Then the witch said: 'I want little King Ivan to come with me to weigh himself, let's see which of us is heavier. If it is I, I will eat him; if it is he, let him kill me.' And so they did. First the little King Ivan climbed onto the scales, then the witch climbed in too; But as soon as he had put his foot on the plate, King Ivan was thrown up with such force that he landed straight in the sky, in the room of the Sun Sister; but the witch-serpent remained on the earth."

在这个故事中，甚至还保留了轻者必胜、重者吞噬致死的表现。英雄到达的王国是太阳王国的事实也被保留下来。只是死者在被欢迎进入太阳王国之前所有这些事情都会发生在他们身上的说法已经消失了。

Even the idea that a light weight ensures victory, while a heavy weight can cause death by being devoured, has been preserved in this tale. The fact that the kingdom the hero arrives in is the realm of the sun has also been preserved. Only the idea that all these things happen to the dead before they are welcomed into the realm of the sun has been lost.

35.蛇与出生之间的联系。

35. The connection between the serpent and birth .

在分析童话故事时，我们发现蛇的形象在某种程度上与英雄及其出生有着某种联系。俄罗斯童话中并没有明确说明英雄与蛇之间从一出生就存在着联系，但它是从“最初的对手”的母题中显现出来的。巨蛇从未见过英雄，但不知何故，它知道他的存在，不仅如此，它还知道他会灭亡在他的手中。在印度教童话中，这种联系表达得更清楚：“在地狱中，蛇王 Vaisingi 诞生，在天堂，国王 Indra 诞生，在地球上，国王 Dchobigand 诞生” 490。

In analyzing the fairy tale we have seen that the figure of the serpent is somehow connected pre-initially with the hero and his birth. That there is a connection between the hero and the serpent from birth is not explicitly stated in the Russian tale, but it is evident from the motif of the "original adversary." The serpent has never seen the hero, but somehow it knows that he exists, and not only that, but it also knows that it will perish at his hands. In a Hindu tale this connection is expressed more clearly: "In hell was born the king of serpents Vaisingi, in heaven was born King Indra, and on earth King Dchobigand . " 490

这个字也必须解释，虽然解释起来有很大的困难。它只能通过推测给出。

This character, too, must be explained, although its explanation encounters great difficulties; it can only be given by way of conjecture.

从引用的材料来看，蛇似乎完全与死亡重新联系起来，但它也与出生重新联系起来。

From the materials cited it emerges quite completely that the snake reconnects with death, but it also reconnects with birth.

我们来看一些这方面的案例。在毛伊岛的神话中，英雄神谈到他的出生时说：“我知道我在海边之前就出生了。你（转向母亲）用你特意剪下的一绺头发包裹着我，然后把我扔进了大海的泡沫中。在那里，海藻把它们的芽缠绕在我周围，塑造了我，给了我一个形状；软鱼围住我来保护我。无数苍蝇在我周围嗡嗡作响，并在我身上产卵。成群的鸟儿聚集在我周围啄食我。但就在那时，我的伟大祖先 Tamanui-ki-te-Rango 出现了，看到了苍蝇和鸟类。老人以最快的速度靠近，推开我周围的鱼，发现了一个人» 491。

Let us examine some cases in this connection. In the myth of Maui the hero-god says of his birth: "I know that I was born before my time on the seashore. You (he is addressing his mother) wrapped me in a lock of your hair, cut especially for this purpose, and threw me into the sea foam. There the seaweed twined its shoots around me, shaped me and gave me form; soft fishes girdled me for protection. Myriads of flies buzzed about me and laid their eggs on my body. Flocks of birds gathered around me to peck at me. But at that moment my great ancestor Tamanui-ki-te-Rango appeared and saw the flies and the birds. The old man approached as quickly as he could, pushed aside the fish that surrounded me and found a human being . " 491

这个神话显然与吞吐神话有关，但与上面分析的案例不同的是，这次的英雄不再是在鱼的肚子里，而是被鱼包围着。而且，当英雄从鱼中出来时，他就诞生了。这个案例表明，被蛇、鱼等包围是很危险的。它是鱼类后来的居住形式。

This myth is clearly connected to that of the swallowed and vomited, but it differs from the cases analyzed above in that this time the hero is no longer in the stomach of the fish, but is surrounded by fish. Furthermore, when the hero comes out of the fish, he is born. This case demonstrates that being wrapped up in snakes, fish, etc. is a later form of dwelling in the fish.

这种比较和解释似乎比库斯特、查鲁辛等人的解释更有可能，根据这些解释，蛇是一种图腾动物，被咬伤是无害的。蛇被贴在孩子们的身上：“如果他们非致命性地触摸或咬了他们，这意味着孩子们是真实的” 492。

This comparison and this explanation appear more plausible than the explanation given by Küster, Charusin and others, according to whom the snake would be a totemic animal, whose bite is not harmful. Snakes were applied to the bodies of children: "If they touched them or bit them not fatally, it meant that the children were authentic" 492 .

这里蛇是物质原则，就是肚子。我们不要忘记，在仪式中，蛇从子宫中退出是第二次出生，特别是英雄的诞生。我们已经看到它后来如何被沉入水中的棺材中沉积所取代。这样，即使是与蛇的诞生有关的这些表征也与与蛇决斗的整个复杂性具有相同的起源。进化阶段可以这样概括：凡是从蛇中诞生的人（即凡是经过蛇的人）都是英雄。下一阶段：英雄杀死蛇。这两个阶段的历史结合告诉我们：从蛇生的人杀死了蛇。

Here the serpent is the material principle, the belly. Let us not forget that in the rite the emergence from the belly of the serpent was a second birth, and precisely the birth of the hero. We have already seen how this was later replaced by being placed in a casket which was lowered into the water. Thus these representations connected with the birth from the serpent also have the same origin as the whole complex of the duel with the serpent. The evolutionary stages can be fixed schematically in the following way: he who is born from the serpent (that is, he who passes through it) is a hero. Next stage: the hero kills the serpent. The historical conjunction of the two stages gives us: he who is born from the serpent kills the serpent.

但蛇既可以作为父亲出现，也可以作为祖先出现，这种表现自然是后来的事。在后一种情况下，蛇成为阳具的象征：它代表父权原则，并且在一定时间后它成为祖先。这种表现形式似乎在非洲尤其发达。无论如何，我们在非洲收集了许多材料。讲乌沃语的人相信，如果蛇接近女性，就意味着她已经怀孕了。没有孩子的妇女祈求蛇给她们生孩子等等。孕妇梦见蛇或水精灵，则认为自己的宝宝将是水精灵的化身。 “他们被认为拥有蛇的本质，并被认为是水之灵的化身” 493。这里，蛇所生的人拥有蛇的力量和本性的表征已经清晰地显现出来。

But the serpent can figure either as a father or as an ancestor, and this representation is of course later. In the latter case the serpent becomes a symbol of the phallus: it represents the paternal principle, and after a certain time it becomes an ancestor. This representation, it seems, was particularly developed in Africa; at any rate much material has been collected in Africa. The peoples who speak the Uvo language believe that if the serpent approaches a woman it means that she has conceived. Women who have no children implore the serpent to send them children, etc. If a pregnant woman dreams of a serpent or a water spirit, she believes that her child will be the incarnation of the water spirit. "They are believed to possess the nature of the serpent and regard themselves as the incarnation of the water spirit." 493 Here the idea that the child born of the serpent possesses the strength and nature of the serpent is already clearly apparent.

在古典时期，刻克洛普斯就是这些蛇的祖先之一。他被描绘成半人半蛇或龙，但正如库斯特所确定的那样，人们普遍认为他具有真正的蛇的外观。

In classical antiquity, Cecrops was one of these serpent-ancestors. He was depicted as half-man and half-serpent or dragon, but, as Küster has ascertained, in popular belief he had the appearance of a real serpent.

底比斯的创始人卡德摩斯和他的妻子哈摩尼亚在生命的最后阶段变成了蛇龙。根据一些消息来源，Harmonia 是被 Cecrops 494杀死的同一条蛇的女儿。

Cadmus, founder of Thebes, and his wife Harmonia, were transformed into dragon-serpents towards the end of their lives. According to some sources, Harmonia was the daughter of the same serpent that had been killed by Cecrops 494 .

但如果蛇生者本身是蛇或成为蛇，而蛇生者杀死了蛇，那么这个事实不正是对“原敌”的解释吗？英雄杀死蛇，难道不是因为历史上他本身就是一条蛇，或者他是从蛇中诞生的，也就是说，他是从蛇中出来的吗？这就是为什么在埃及神话童话中，蛇居住的岛屿被称为双胞胎岛。童话里的蛇不也害怕它的双胞胎吗？

But if the serpent-born is a serpent himself or becomes one, and if this serpent-born kills the serpent, is not the explanation of the "original enemy" hidden in this fact? Does not the hero kill the serpent because historically he is a serpent himself or was born from the serpent, that is, came out of it? This is why in the Egyptian myth-tale the island inhabited by the serpent is called the island of the twin. Is not the serpent in the tale also afraid of its twin?

为了回答这些问题，我们将研究蛇死于蛇手中的案例。

To answer these questions we will study the cases in which the serpent perishes at the hands of the serpent.

36.蛇死于蛇之手。

36. The death of the serpent at the hands of the serpent .

我们已经发现了蛇被打败的案例，因为一个戴着蛇腰带的女孩进入了它的嘴。这条腰带在怪物的肚子里变得活跃并杀死了它。但是，当然，蛇死在蛇手上的明显案例只能是迟到的事，那时吞噬蛇已经完全转变为可怕的存在，但给予力量和力量的蛇却不是。却被遗忘了。这些材料是从埃及提供给我们的。

We have already found cases in which the serpent is defeated because a girl wearing a serpent belt enters its jaws. This belt comes to life in the belly of the monster and kills it. But, of course, the clear and evident cases in which the serpent dies at the hands of the serpent can only be late, when the swallowing serpent has already completely transformed itself into a terrible being, but the serpent, the giver of strength and power, has not yet been forgotten. These materials are supplied to us by Egypt.

第32章。 《亡灵之书》的标题是“驱逐似乎从地狱夺走魔语的鳄鱼之章”。我只会报告童话学者最感兴趣的段落。

The 32nd chapter of the Book of the Dead is entitled "Chapter of the Expulsion of the Crocodile Which Appears to Carry Away the Magic Words from Hell." I will report only the passages that are of most interest to the student of fairy tales.

« 生活在西方的鳄鱼啊，撤退吧，因为蛇瓦恩在我的肚子里，他会把你交给我。你的火焰不会反对我。

« Withdraw, O crocodile that dwells in the west, for the serpent Waan is in my stomach, he will deliver you to me. Your flame is not turned against me.

我的脸没有被遮盖，我的心在它的位置，蛇的冠冕日复一日地在我身上。我是拉（Rha），我自己的捍卫者，任何事情都无法降临到我身上。”

My face is uncovered, my heart is in its place, and the crown of serpents is upon me day by day. I am Rha, my own defender, and nothing shall ever overthrow me.

你如何保护自己免受蛇的侵害？

How do you protect yourself from a snake?

一方面，死者警告蛇，他的肚子里有Waan蛇。另一方面，他有一顶蛇冠来保护他。换句话说，蛇死于同类之手。在埃及，这种代表非常普遍，而且可能不仅在埃及。让我们记住，在《圣经》中，为了保护以色列人免受蛇的侵害，摩西下令放置一条铜蛇（摩西，IV，21、8）。因此，蛇被视为防御蛇。法老王的王冠上描绘了蛇。 “神圣的蛇，太阳的守护者，也站在他的地球代表法老面前，并用火焰焚烧他的敌人” 495。根据图拉耶夫的观察，自古埃及时代以来，对自然的诗意表现也随之发展起来，所有丰富的神话都源于此。太阳是上帝的眼睛；云、雾、暴风雨、夜黑都是他的敌人：天黑的时候，他去异国他乡，光明之神驱散了他，他又回来；他自己变成一条蛇，在神的额头上发射火焰，将众神驱散。在这种情况下，“Le”对图拉耶夫来说意味着黑暗、雾和风暴，太阳的敌人。但我们已经知道太阳的主要敌人是阿波菲斯，他也在另一条蛇的帮助下被击败了。至此我们可以推断，必然存在两条蛇互相打架的情况。而且，确实存在这样的情况。在《异世界之书》 496中，虽然文学编辑相当晚，但内容却很陈旧，详细描述了拉哈的飞船在来世世界、超越地球、从日落到日落的旅程。 '日出。整个旅程（以及整本书）分为12个部分，对应夜晚的12个小时。 « 午夜时分，道路转向东方，经过古老的奥西里斯-布西里斯和门德斯圣地、奥西里斯群岛、祭祀场和奥西里斯拟像的神秘宫殿，国王和国王的木乃伊都存放在那里。受祝福的死者位于。拉（Rha）向他们打招呼，并邀请他们与他一起对抗巨蛇阿波普（Apop），阿波普已经吞下了下一个小时的所有水，以阻碍拉神的旅程，并用它的缠绕充满了 450 英噚。仅凭拉哈的力量不足以对抗阿波普，蛇梅钦前来援助，在他周围形成了一种缠绕的混乱；伊希斯和其他女神通过驱魔束缚并伤害阿波普» 497。

On the one hand, the deceased warns the serpent that he has the serpent Waan in his stomach. On the other hand, he has a crown of serpents that serve to protect him. In other words, the serpent perishes at the hands of its own kind. In Egypt, this representation was very widespread, and probably not only in Egypt. Let us recall that even in the Bible, to protect the Israelites from serpents, Moses orders to place a copper serpent (Moses, IV, 21, 8). Therefore, it is seen that the serpent protects against the serpent. Serpents were depicted on the crowns of the Pharaohs. "The sacred serpent, guardian of the sun, also stands in front of its earthly representative, the Pharaoh, and incinerates its enemies with flames." 495 According to Turaev, poetic representations of nature also developed in the archaic period of Egypt, from which all the richness of mythology comes. The sun is the eye of the god; Clouds, fog, storms, and the darkness of night are his enemies: when the sky is dark, he goes to a foreign land, and returns when the god of light has put them to flight; he himself transforms himself into a serpent that emanates fire on the god's forehead and puts them to flight. "The" in this case means for Turaev darkness, fog, and storm, enemies of the sun. But we already know that the main enemy of the sun is Apophis, and he too is defeated with the help of another serpent. At this point we can come to the deduction that there must be cases in which two serpents fight each other. And, indeed, such cases do exist. In the Book of That Which Is in the Other World 496 , of a rather late literary edition but archaic in content, the journey of Rha's ship in the underworld, beyond the earth, from sunset to sunrise, is described in detail. The whole journey (and thus the whole book) is divided into 12 parts, corresponding to the 12 hours of the night. «At midnight the road turns east and passes in front of the ancient sacred places of Osiris-Busiris and Mendes, in front of the Osiride islands, the Fields of Offerings and the mysterious palace with the simulacrum of Osiris, where the mummies of the kings and the blessed dead are located. Rha greets them and invites them to fight with him against the serpent Apop, who has already swallowed up all the water of the following hour to hinder the journey of the god Rha and has filled 450 arms with his coils. The strength of Rha alone is not enough to fight against Apop, and the serpent Mechen comes to his aid, forming with his coils a kind of chaos around him; Isis and the other goddesses bind and wound Apop with their exorcisms » 497 .

图拉耶夫倾向于相信，正如他所说，这本书的内容是“埃及祭司病态想象力的虚构”。这种观念是非历史的。虽然整本《亡灵书》充满了对阿波普的诅咒，但最古老的有益之蛇的表现形式（正如我们所见，整组蛇的表现形式也从中出现）也许并没有死在人们中间，而是他们继续独立于宫廷和祭司的官方宗教而存在，并且按照邪恶的阿波普的宗教信仰进行分层。陈旧的祭司智慧借鉴了大众的代表并将其封圣。后来，益蛇的教义再次在奥菲特教派中传播，直到我们这个时代的六世纪，他们崇拜蛇作为主要和唯一的神。

Turaev is inclined to believe that the contents of this book are, as he says, "a product of the sick imagination of the Egyptian priests." This view is anti-historical. While the entire Book of the Dead is full of curses directed at Apop, the most ancient representations of the beneficent serpent (from which, as we saw, the whole group of representations of the serpent also emerged) were perhaps not dead among the people, but continued to exist independently of the official religion of the court and the priests, and they were stratified on that of the evil Apop. The decrepit priestly wisdom drew on the popular representations and canonized them. Later the doctrine of the beneficent serpent spread again and lasted until the sixth century of our era in the sect of the Ophites, who worshiped the serpent as the main and only deity.

原始仁慈的吞蛇与晚期可怕的吞蛇在这里面对面相遇。对抗蛇的主要战士，Rha，穿过蛇。在前面提到的《异界之书》中，拉住在地狱里，在她的宇宙飞船里。 « 船的绳索化身为蛇，将其带入光明，而船本身则穿过1300噚长蛇的身体，象征着新生。从蛇的嘴里，Rha 不再以“肉身”的形式出现，而是以“甲虫”的形式出现498。

The early beneficent swallowing serpent and the later terrible swallowing serpent meet here face to face as enemies. The chief fighter against the serpent, Rha, passes through the serpent. In the already mentioned Book of That Which Is in the Other World Rha lives in hell, in his little boat. "The rope of the boat is transformed into a serpent to carry it to the light, and the boat itself is passed through the body of the 1300 fathoms long serpent, symbol of renewal. From the jaws of the serpent Rha emerges no longer as 'flesh', but in the form of a 'scarab' . " 498

但这些材料适用于童话故事吗？难道童话中的伊凡杀死蛇是因为他穿过了蛇，而蛇在他身上看到了自己的孪生兄弟吗？明确地、直接地，这并没有出现在任何地方。俄罗斯童话并没有将蛇的诞生和蛇吞下视为一种好处。它保留了另一种形式：从鱼中诞生。事实上，可以看出，从鱼生出来的人往往是对抗蛇的斗士。我们已经看到，鱼的持久性与蛇的持久性是多么相似。这样，即使缺乏直接的迹象，也有间接的迹象证实我们的观察。此外，我们还可以举一个童话故事中蛇只能死于自己之手的例子。通常的公式可以简化为这样一句话：“我只能死在伊万手中。”这里简化为“我只能亲手灭亡”，从而证实了我们的观察。普斯科夫童话故事（Sm.111）中也有类似的情况。英雄在森林里行走，遇到了十二头蛇，其中六个头在睡觉，六个头没有睡觉。 « 蛇站了起来，没有逃脱它的牙齿。他只能自杀，任何外力都无法查出真相。”

But are these materials applicable to the fairy tale? Can it be said that Ivan in the fairy tale kills the serpent because he has passed through the serpent, which sees in him its twin? This is nowhere explicitly and directly stated. The Russian fairy tale has not retained either birth from the serpent or swallowing by the serpent as a benefit. It has retained another form: birth from the fish. And, in fact, it can be observed that he who is born from the fish is very often a fighter against the serpent. We have already seen how closely the stay in the fish approaches the stay in the serpent. Thus, even if there are no direct indications, there are indirect ones that confirm our observations. Moreover, one can cite a case in which in the fairy tale the serpent can perish only by its own hand. The usual formula can be reduced to the statement: "I can perish only by Ivan's hand." Here it is reduced to the statement: "I can perish only by my own hand," thereby confirming our observations. A similar case is found in a Pskov fairy tale (Sm. 111). The hero walks in the forest and meets the twelve-headed serpent, six heads sleep and six do not sleep. "The serpent rose up and there was no escape from its teeth. It could only kill itself, no external force could get to the bottom of it."

这段话乍一看很奇怪，但在已经引用的材料中找到了它的解释：蛇死于蛇之手；事实上，在这种情况下，是他亲手完成的。这条蛇是自杀身亡的。 “他用爪子刺入胸口，用力撕扯胸口，以致胸口裂成两半，他尖叫着倒地而死”（《SM》111）。因此，俄罗斯童话也知道蛇死于蛇之手，而且以一种非常有趣且有意义的形式：以蛇死于自己之手的形式。两条蛇，一条攻击的蛇和一条被攻击的蛇，在这里融合成一个整体，因为蛇是一个完整的原始敌人和对手，以至于我们当代的童话故事不能再让它代表杀手的英雄部分蛇，就像在埃及仍然发生的那样。但现在蛇知道它的敌人和胜利者的原因已经很清楚了：他是从自己、从蛇中诞生的，只有他才是蛇的“最初的敌人”，并将其击死。

This passage, strange at first glance, finds its explanation in the materials already cited: the serpent perishes at the hands of the serpent; or rather, in this case, at its own hands. This serpent dies by suicide. "It sank its claws into its breast and tore it so hard that it split in two, and fell down with a cry and died" (Sm. 111). Therefore, the Russian fairy tale also knows the death of the serpent at the hands of the serpent, and in a very interesting and significant form, too: in the form of the death of the serpent at its own hands. Two serpents, the one that strikes and the one that is struck, have merged here into one being, for the serpent is such an integral original enemy and adversary that our contemporary fairy tale can no longer make it play the heroic role of the slayer of the serpent, as is still done in Egypt. But now it is clear why the serpent knows its enemy and victor: this one was born from himself, from the serpent, he and he alone is the "original enemy" of the serpent and strikes him to death.

37.结论。

37. Conclusion .

我们的评测已经结束了。得出一般性结论并不容易，因为蛇是一种非常复杂且多方面的现象。所有给出单一解释的尝试都注定会失败，笼统的结论总是会将多样性简化为单一整体，从而扭曲现象的本质。

Our review has come to an end. It is not easy to draw a general conclusion because the snake is a very complex and multifaceted phenomenon. All attempts to give a single explanation are doomed to failure in advance, a generic conclusion will always reduce the multiformity to a single whole and, therefore, will distort the essence of the phenomenon.

最好的证据、最好的论据是由材料组成的。在这方面还有很多工作要做。藏品中还隐藏着多少关于所谓未开化或原始民族的资料！地中海文明一直是几代人研究的主题。目前还没有人对以前的文明进行过研究，而正是在这些文明中，我们找到了这个谜题的答案。但这项研究也是多年的工作。

The best evidence, the best argument, is that which is constituted by the material. In this respect there is still much work to be done. How much material is still hidden in the collections on the so-called uncivilized or primitive peoples! For many generations the Mediterranean civilizations have been the object of investigation. No one has yet undertaken the study of the earlier civilizations, and it is precisely in them that the solution to the enigma is found; but this study too is the work of many years.

由此首先得出一个方法论结论：必须研究现象的运动而不是静止。民俗学不能被视为脱离经济和社会制度的东西，而必须被视为它们的产物。这里我们朝这个方向做了尝试，并且取得了一些成果。今天，我们不能再与弗雷泽一起抱怨这项研究和结果的基础不稳固。确实，对我们来说，蛇不是太阳，也不是植物体，一般来说，它没有任何“意义”：它是一种改变其功能和形式的历史现象。所采用的方法使我们能够从礼开始追踪它的历史演变，它与氏族政权的社会制度和氏族政权的经济利益紧密相连；在这个仪式中，他在我们看来是一位吞咽者的恩人。

From this comes first of all a methodological conclusion: a phenomenon must be studied in its movements and not in its stasis. Folklore must be studied not as something detached from the economy and the social regime, but as their product. Here we have made an attempt in this direction and have obtained some results. Today we can no longer complain along with Frazer that the study and the results are on slippery ground. It is true that for us the serpent is not the sun, nor a vegetative being, and in general it does not "mean" anything: it is a historical phenomenon that changes its functions and its forms. The methods adopted have allowed us to follow its historical evolution starting from the rite, in which it is firmly connected with the social institutions of the clan regime and with the economic interests of that regime; in this rite it appears to us as a swallower-benefactor.

我们已经看到，海洋、旅行、地球和太阳纳入经济轨道如何改变了蛇的外观和功能，以及在这些因素的影响下，它如何变成水生、地下生物和蛇。天上的，就像在印度和埃及的国教中一样，他被新的神所废黜，这些神根据新文明中人类的新利益和需要来统治元素。

We have seen how the inclusion of the sea, of travel, of the earth and of the sun in the economic orbit changes both the appearance and the functions of the serpent, and how, under the influence of these factors, he becomes an aquatic, subterranean and celestial being, how in the state religions of India and Egypt he is displaced by the new gods, by the gods who govern the elements in accordance with the new interests and the needs of the man of a new civilization.

我们还看到它与死亡表征的联系如何仍然牢固，在埃及，死亡表征呈现出如此丰富的形式。

We have also seen how its connection with the representations of death, which in Egypt take on such exuberant forms, remains strong.

童话故事反映了这一进化的所有阶段，从最古老的阶段开始，例如通过蛇获得鸟类语言的知识；它反映了过渡阶段，例如在鱼体内完成的异国之旅，也反映了晚期阶段，例如骑马和剑战的英雄的高级形式。

The fairy tale reflects all the stages of this evolution, beginning with the most ancient, such as the acquisition of knowledge of the language of birds through the medium of the serpent; it reflects the transitional stages, such as the journey to foreign lands made inside a fish, and also the later ones, such as the advanced form of the hero who fights on horseback and with the aid of the sword.

童话故事还保留了蛇进化的一些其他特征，例如吞咽者张开的嘴前法庭的表现。其他一些细节，例如截掉蛇的舌头，它改变了意义，但总的来说，它非常精确地保留了有益的蛇转变为相反的整个过程：这一次，童话似乎也我们作为一个宝贵的来源，就像一个早已从我们的意识中消失的文化现象的宝贵容器。

The fairy tale has also preserved some other features of the evolution of the serpent, such as the representation of the court before the gaping jaws of the swallower. It has transposed the meaning of some other details, such as the amputation of the serpent's tongues, but on the whole it has preserved very accurately the whole process of the transformation of the beneficent serpent into its opposite: once again the fairy tale appears to us as a precious source, as a precious receptacle of cultural phenomena that have long since vanished from our awareness.

第八章 遥远的国度之外

Chapter EightBeyond the Far Lands

一、童话中的遥远国度499

I. The Faraway Realm in Fairy Tale 499

1.地点。

1. The location .

英雄所到达的王国与他父亲的家被不可通行的森林、大海、一条火河和一座藏有蛇的桥所隔开，或者被英雄跌落或下降的深渊所隔开。这就是“遥远”的国度，或者说“异国”，甚至是“非凡的国度”。那里统治着一位骄傲而专横的公主，那里住着一条蛇。英雄到达那里是为了寻找被绑架的美丽，或者神奇的东西，可以恢复活力的苹果，可以治愈的活水，赋予永恒的青春和健康。

The kingdom the hero arrives in is separated from his father's house by an impassable forest, by the sea, by a river of fire with a bridge in which the serpent is hidden, or by an abyss into which the hero falls or descends. This is the "far" kingdom, or the "other kingdom", or the "extraordinary kingdom". A proud and domineering princess reigns there, the serpent lives there. The hero arrives there in search of the kidnapped beauty, or of miraculous things, of apples that rejuvenate, of living water that heals, gives eternal youth and health.

达到这个境界的方法我们已经讲过了，现在我们需要更仔细地研究它。首先我们会看到童话里的画面，然后我们才会突破界限，走向更广阔的空间。

We have already spoken of the way in which one arrives at this realm; now we must examine it more closely. First of all we will see the picture that the fairy tale offers and only after that will we move the limits and go out into a wider space.

但一旦我们开始观察这个王国，我们立即意识到它不呈现任何外在的统一性，而且似乎不可能对它画出一幅图画；你必须画很多。这首先必须说的是领域的位置。

But as soon as we begin to observe this kingdom, we immediately realize that it does not present any external unity and that it does not seem possible to draw a single picture of it; it is necessary to draw several. This is said first of all because of the location of the kingdom.

有时它位于地下：“没人知道过了多久，伊万发现了一条地下通道。通过这条通道，他下降到了深渊，到达了六头蛇居住和统治的地下王国。他看到一座白色石头的宫殿并进入了它»（Af. 130 b）。

Sometimes it is located underground: "After an unknown amount of time, Ivan came across an underground passage. Through this passage he descended into a deep abyss and came to the underground kingdom where the six-headed serpent lived and reigned. He saw a palace of white stone and entered it" (Af. 130 b).

但那里并没​​有什么特别的地下空间：通常根本不会变黑，地球就像在这里一样。 « 他们在那条地下通道里走了许久，突然一道光芒亮起，变得越来越清晰，出现在晴空下的一片空地之上；在那片空地上建造了一座宏伟的宫殿，宫殿里住着美丽女孩的父亲，那个地下国家的国王”（Af. 112 b）。

But there is nothing specifically underground down there: usually it is not dark at all and the earth is just as it is here. "They walked for a long time through that underground passage, suddenly a light blazed out, it became brighter and brighter and they came out onto a large clearing under the clear sky; on that clearing was built a magnificent palace, and in the palace lived the father of the beautiful girl, king of that underground country" (Af. 112 b).

但王国也可以位于山上：“突然，船升到空中，一瞬间，就像离弦的箭一样，把他们引向一座巨大的石山”（Af.78）。或者：“他们仰面坐着，熊王带领他们到了一些高耸入云的山下；到处都荒无人烟，无人居住”（Af. 117）。故事《水晶山》（Af.97）向我们展示了一个特殊且非常有趣的案例。据说：“……飞进了遥远的王国。但那个王国的大半都被水晶山吞没了。” « 旅行，旅行，他们终于到了。他们观看并看到一座玻璃山”（ZP 59）。 “看哪，一座水晶山”（ZV 3）。

But the kingdom can also be located on a mountain: "Suddenly the boat rose into the air and in a flash, like an arrow shot from a bow, it took them to a great stony mountain" (Aph. 78). Or: "They sat on the backs, and the king of the bears took them to the bottom of mountains so high and steep that they reached up to the sky; everywhere it was deserted, no one lived there" (Aph. 117). The story The Crystal Mountain (Aph. 97) presents us with a special and very interesting case. It says: "... and flew to the distant kingdom. But more than half of that kingdom had been absorbed by the crystal mountain." "Travel, travel, finally they arrived. They looked and saw a mountain of glass" (ZP 59). "And behold, a mountain of crystal" (ZV 3).

最后他也发现自己在水下：“小国王伊万去了水下王国；即使在那里，光线也和这里一样，有田野、草地、绿色的树林和温暖的阳光”（Af. 125 d）。有时也会提到淹没在湖中的城市，如基特兹城的传说（Af. 123 V/3）。

And finally it can also be found under water: "And the little king Ivan went to the underwater kingdom; there too the light is just like ours and there are fields and meadows, and green woods, and the warming sun" (Af. 125 d). Sometimes there are also mentions of cities submerged in the lake, as in the legend of the city of Kitezh (Af. 123 V/3).

无论位于何处，该领域有时都会有美丽的草地。 « 小鸟飞过绿色的草地，草如丝绸，开着蓝色的花朵，然后落在地上。伊凡国王站起来，走过草地并践踏它”（Af. 93）。但值得注意的是，无论那个境界的风景多么美丽，却从来没有森林或耕地生长小麦。

Regardless of where it is located, the kingdom sometimes has beautiful meadows. "The bird flew over the green meadows, with silky grass and blue flowers, and fell to the ground. King Ivan rose up, walked across the meadow, and trampled it" (Af. 93). It should be noted, however, that no matter how beautiful the landscape of that kingdom is, there are never any forests or cultivated fields where the grain is growing.

然而，另一方面，还有别的东西：有花园、树木，这些树结果子。大多数花园都位于岛屿上：“白痴意识到他们在一个美丽的岛上，岛上长满了不同的树木和各种水果（Af.100a）。 « 他们去了那个岛。那个岛上有精致的水果、植物、花卉”（Chud. 41）。在出现恢复活力的苹果的童话故事中，我们几乎总是能找到花园。

On the other hand, however, there is something else: there are gardens, trees, and these trees bear fruit. Mostly the gardens are located on islands: «And the simpleton realized that they were on a beautiful island, full of different trees with fruits of every kind (Af. 100 a). «They went down to that island. On that island there are exquisite fruits, plants, flowers» (Chud. 41). In fairy tales in which rejuvenating apples occur, we almost always find gardens.

到目前为止，我们还没有遇到遥远王国的任何建筑，有时童话会强调这是一个无人居住的地方。 “他们来到一座山上，你无法步行或骑马爬山，没有房屋，除了山之外什么也没有”（Chud.82）。然而，在遥远的王国里有建筑物，而且总是宫殿。现在让我们仔细看看这座建筑。大多数时候都是金色的：“她住在一座伟大的金色宫殿里”（Af. 164）。宫殿的建筑真是太棒了：“那座金色的宫殿矗立在一根银色的柱子上，宫殿上方有一层宝石的面纱，楼梯是珍珠母的，它们像翅膀一样向两侧延伸……他们一进去，银柱就发出呻吟声，楼梯打开，所有的小圆顶都闪闪发光，整个宫殿开始转圈”（Af.74）。它也通常由大理石和水晶制成。这座宫殿无法进入：“他们从远处看到一座水晶宫殿，四周环绕着墙壁”（Af. 73）。然而，这种难以接近并不对英雄构成障碍，他会穿过墙壁，或者在其他情况下，变成蚂蚁，从裂缝中溜进去。有时他会变成一只鹰，飞过城墙。宫殿里经常有动物守卫，几乎都是狮子或蛇，但这些蛇不像山蛇，它们很容易被安抚。 « 不知过了多久，他看到了一座金光闪闪的宫殿；可怕的巨蛇聚集在门口，身上挂着金链，到处都是水井，金链上挂着一个金桶。伊凡国王用桶打水，给蛇喝了一口，它们就平静下来了”（Af. 71 b）。

So far we have not encountered a single building in the distant kingdom, and sometimes the tale emphasizes that it is an uninhabited place. "They came to a mountain, which could not be climbed on foot or on horseback, there were no houses, there was nothing there except the mountain" (Chud. 82). However, in the distant kingdom there are buildings, and they are always palaces. Let us now take a closer look at this palace. Most of the time it is all made of gold: "She lives in a great golden palace" (Af. 164). The architecture of the palace is absolutely fantastic: "And that golden palace stands on a silver pillar, and above the palace is a curtain of precious stones, the stairs are of mother-of-pearl, and they stretch out on both sides like wings... As soon as they entered, the silver pillar groaned, the stairs opened, all the little domes sparkled, and the whole palace began to turn in circles" (Af. 74). It is also often made of marble and crystal. The palace is inaccessible: "And they saw in the distance a palace of crystal, all surrounded by walls" (Aph. 73). This inaccessibility, however, does not constitute an obstacle for the hero, who slips through the walls, or in other cases, transformed into an ant, insinuates himself through a crack. Sometimes he transforms himself into an eagle and flies over the walls. Very often the palace is guarded by animals, almost always lions or serpents, but these serpents do not resemble the Mountain-Serpent, they are easily appeased. "After I know not how long a golden palace passed by, which was all shining; at the gates swarmed terrible serpents, chained with golden chains, and everywhere there were wells, where a golden bucket hung from a golden chain. The little king Ivan drew water with the bucket and gave the serpents to drink, and they calmed down" (Aph. 71b).

有时英雄到达的地方被描述为一座城市或一个州。 “在这根柱子之外，有一座一百俄里长的黄金城”（Af. 125 b）。 “看哪，蓝色的大海，广阔无边，出现在她面前，远处金色的尖塔在白色石头的高塔上闪闪发光”（Af. 129）。伪俄罗斯画风乐于用许多教堂来表现这个境界，但这并不是不知道天堂耶路撒冷的童话故事的特征。最近的合理化将英雄转变为商人，将穿越转变为商务旅行，将城市转变为港口。 “船抵达一座富裕的大城市，停泊在港口并抛锚”（Af. 135）。我们对这个国家一无所知，只知道有人在统治它。 “船在陆地上行驶，在海上航行，最后到达了少女王的王国”（Af.103b）。 “他们到达了无形的王国，处于非凡的状态”（AF.77）。

Sometimes the place where the hero arrives is described as a city or a state. "Beyond this pillar there is a golden city a hundred versts long" (Aph. 125b). "And behold, the blue sea, wide and boundless, appeared before it, and in the distance shone the golden spires on high towers of white stone" (Aph. 129). The pseudo-Russian style of painting likes to depict this kingdom with many churches, but this is not in the nature of the fairy tale, which knows nothing of the heavenly Jerusalem. A more recent rationalization transforms the hero into a merchant, the crossing into a business voyage, and the city into a port. "The ship arrived at a large and rich city, stopped in the port and dropped anchor" (Aph. 135). We know nothing about this state except that someone reigns in it. «The ship ran on dry land, sailed on the sea and finally arrived in the realm of the maiden-king» (Af. 103 b). «They arrive in the invisible realm, in the extraordinary State» (Af. 77).

上述所有元素都以各种方式组合在一起：城市可以位于岛上、山间、水下和地下。建筑物、草坪和花园也是如此，它们相互自由组合，位于不同的环境中。

All the elements indicated above are combined in various ways: the city can be located on an island, between the mountains, under water and underground. The same can be said of the palaces, the lawns and the gardens, which are freely combined with each other and are located in different environments.

2.与太阳的联系。

2. The connection with the sun .

更仔细地审视这种“非凡状态”，我们发现它与太阳有某种联系。因此，例如，在一篇文本中，我们发现英雄被指示去获取一根“生长在遥远的土地、遥远的王国、靠近太阳的国家的金松树枝”（Af. 106 P） 。这个境界位于天空，也就是太阳所在的地方。 « 小国王杀死了怪物，骑马来到了钻石宫殿，他的母亲娜斯塔西娅·金丝就住在十二头蛇附近。钻石宫殿像磨坊一样转动，从那个宫殿你可以看到整个宇宙，你可以看到所有的王国和国家，就像在你的手掌中一样”（Af.71P）。要回答建筑物的旋转是否是天球的旋转这一问题并不容易，但很明显，这里以某种方式代表了天空。阳光的性格在其他故事中显得更加清晰。例如，英雄从蛇的追击中拯救了自己：“他有多近了！”现在它到了我身边！就在这时，小国王伊万飞奔到太阳姐妹楼的楼上，喊道：“索利切洛，小阳光，开门！ “太阳姐姐打开窗户，小国王和马一起跳了进去”（AF.50）。说实话，这个童话故事没有任何变化，但它绝不是唯一一个提到太阳的童话故事。

Looking even more closely at this "extraordinary state", we find that it has some connection with the sun. Thus, for example, in one text we find that the hero has been instructed to procure a branch of the golden pine "which grows in a distant land, in a distant kingdom, in the state next to the sun" (Af. 106 P). This kingdom is in the sky, where the sun is. "The little king killed the monster and rode to the diamond palace, where his mother, Nastasya Golden-Braid, lived with the twelve-headed serpent. The diamond palace turns like a mill, and from that palace one can see the whole universe, all the kingdoms and countries as if in the palm of one's hand" (Af. 71 P). It is not easy to answer the question whether the rotation of the palace is meant as the rotation of the celestial spheres, but it is clear that, in one way or another, the sky is represented here. The solar character appears even more clearly in other stories. The hero, for example, saves himself from the pursuit of the serpent: "How close it is! Now it is catching up with me! At that very moment the little king Ivan came galloping up to the upper rooms of the Sister of the Sun and cried: 'Little Sun, little Sun, open the door! ' The Sister of the Sun opened the window and the little king jumped in together with his horse" (Af. 50). To tell the truth, this tale has no variants, but it is by no means the only one in which the sun is mentioned.

这个境界与地平线相连。 “走啊走，天地间，他们停在了一座不知名的小岛上”（AF.84）。尽管这个指示更多的是指旅程而不是境界，但也有一些文本非常清楚地表达了境界在地平线上的位置。 « 弓箭手骑上他勇敢的马，出发前往遥远的地方；不知过了多久，他到达了世界的尽头，那里有红色的小太阳从蓝色的大海中升起”（AF.163a）。在提到雷和闪电的情况下，这种与天空的联系表达得更加清楚。丽莎（穿靴子的猫）对英雄说：“火焰国王和恐怖闪电女王有一个女儿，一个美丽的公主；我会把她嫁给你（Af.99）。尽管这些名字还不能证明什么，但这种联系并非偶然。因此，在那个领域，可以听到撞击声和轰鸣声；当被问及它们来自哪里时，女术士回答：“在山里，我们听到轰隆隆的巨响和雷声隆隆，因为王女红颊黑辫子坐着马车散步”（Af. 104 d）。

This realm is connected with the horizon. "Walk, walk, between heaven and earth, they stopped on an unknown island" (Aph. 84). And although this indication refers more to the journey than to the realm, there are also texts in which the position of the realm on the horizon is expressed very clearly. "The archer sat on his brave horse and set out for distant lands; after I know not how long he arrived at the end of the world, there where the red sun rises from the blue sea" (Aph. 163a). This connection with the sky is expressed even more clearly in cases where thunder and lightning are mentioned. Lisà (Puss in Boots) says to the hero: "King Fire and Queen Terrible Lightning have a daughter, a beautiful princess; I will give her to you as a wife" (Aph. 99). And although the names do not yet prove anything, nevertheless this connection is not accidental. So in that realm a crash and a rumble are heard; when asked where they come from, the witch answers: "Here in our mountains one hears banging and thunder rumbling because the maiden-king Red-cheeks-Black-braids goes for a ride in a carriage" (Af. 104 d).

3.黄金。

3. Gold .

一切与遥远国度有某种联系的东西都会呈现出金色的色彩。我们已经看到这座宫殿是用金子建造的。英雄在遥远的国度必须获得的物品几乎总是由金制成的：它们是金色的鬃毛、金色的鸭毛、金色的角的鹿或金色的尾巴，一匹有着金色鬃毛和尾巴的马。 （不是 Sivko-Burko 类型）等。在火鸟的故事中，火鸟本身被锁在金笼中，马有金缰绳，美丽的海伦的花园被金门包围（Af.102）。芬尼斯特童话中，美丽的猎鹰来到异国寻找心爱的女孩，买了三晚，换来了一个银底金纺锤、一个装有小金蛋的银盘和一个带小金框的金框。针（AF.129）。

Everything that is connected in any way with the distant realm can take on the hue of gold. We have already seen that the palace is of gold. The objects that the hero must procure in the distant realm are almost always of gold: a golden bristle, golden duck feathers, a stag with golden antlers or a golden tail, a horse with a golden mane and tail (not of the Sivko-Burko type), etc. In the tale of the Firebird, the bird itself is enclosed in a golden cage, the horse has golden bridles, and the garden of Helen the Beautiful is enclosed by a golden fence (Af. 102). In the tale of Finist, the beautiful falcon , the girl who came to the other kingdom to seek her delight buys three nights in exchange for a golden spindle with a silver bottom, a silver plate with small golden eggs and a golden frame with a small needle (Af. 129).

王国的居民、公主身上总是固有一些黄金属性。她居住在一座金顶高塔中（Af. 93 c）。 “他看到瓦西里莎公主驾着一艘银色的小船在蓝色的大海中航行，用金色的桨向前推进”（Af.103a）。她有金色的翅膀，她的仆人有银色的翅膀（Af.130）。乘金色战车飞翔。 « 在那儿，许多鸽子一瞬间飞了起来，覆盖了整个草地；中间矗立着一座金色宝座。过了一会儿，六条火蛇拉着的金色战车，照亮了天地，飞了起来；战车上坐着的是智者海伦娜女王，她的美丽难以形容，令人无法想象、猜测或讲述”（Af. 131）。即使公主被描绘成一位武士处女，她也骑着一匹细长的马，“带着金矛”（122 P）。童话中提到公主的头发总是金色的，因此得名“艾琳娜金辫，美丽发现”。在阿布哈兹童话故事中，他的脸也散发着光芒：“他看到一个美丽的女人，她站在阳台上，即使没有阳光，她也会发光……从她身上，就像从太阳一样，光倾泻而出，即使在有阳光的情况下，她也发出光芒。”不，它既不是太阳，也不是月亮” 500。

The inhabitant of that kingdom herself, the princess, always has some golden attribute. She resides in a high tower with a golden top (Aph. 93 c). "And she sees in the blue sea Princess Vasilissa sailing in a silver boat, pushing forward with a golden oar" (Aph. 103 a). She has golden wings, her servant has silver ones (Aph. 130). She flies in a golden chariot. "In a flash doves flew there and covered the whole meadow; in the middle stood a golden throne. After some time, illuminating the sky and the earth, a golden chariot flies, drawn by six fiery serpents; in the chariot sits Queen Helen the Wise, so indescribably beautiful that one cannot imagine or guess or tell about it" (Aph. 131). Even when the princess is depicted as a warrior virgin, she gallops on a slender horse, "with a golden spear" (122 P). When the fairy tale mentions the princess's hair, it is always golden, hence the name "Helena Golden Braid, Discovered Beauty". In Abkhazian fairy tales, even her face radiates light: "And he saw a beautiful woman, shining without the sun, standing on the balcony... from her, as from a sun, light poured out, even when there was neither sun nor moon" 500 .

我们可以继续枚举并填写一些页面。黄金的出现如此频繁、如此鲜明、形式如此多样，以至于这个遥远的王国可以正确地称为黄金王国。正是这种典型而稳定的特征，使得“一切与遥远王国有联系的东西都可以有金色的颜色”这一命题是正确的，即使顺序颠倒过来：所有具有金色颜色的东西都背叛了它属于“遥远的王国”。其他王国。金色是他界的标志；以火鸟的羽毛为例。伊凡国王埋伏在等待这只鸟：“一个小时过去了，然后是一个小时，然后是第三个小时，突然整个花园都亮了起来，好像被许多火光照亮了：火鸟飞来了”。他丢了一支笔：“这支笔是如此美妙和闪亮，如果把它带进一个黑暗的房间，它就会像点燃许多蜡烛一样被点亮”（Af. 102）。这只鸟实际上来自另一个王国，英雄开始寻找它。这里的联系非常清楚；但即使在它不能直接产生该词的真正含义的情况下，也可以提出并考虑其存在的问题。例如，英雄发现了一只神奇的鸭子：“主人把他的鸭子锁在一个黑暗的棚子里；主人把他的鸭子锁在一个黑暗的棚子里；”晚上她下了一个金蛋。农夫路过，看见一道强光，以为着火了，大声喊道：“着火了，着火了！老婆，拿水桶跑去倒水吧！ “他们打开棚子：既没有火也没有火焰，只有金蛋在发光”（Af. 115 P）。

We could continue the list and fill several pages. Gold appears so often, so conspicuously, and in so many different forms, that this distant kingdom can rightly be called the kingdom of gold. It is such a typical and stable characteristic that the proposition: "everything that is connected with the distant kingdom can have the color of gold" is correct even if the order is reversed: everything that has the color of gold betrays its belonging to the other kingdom. The golden color is the sign of the other kingdom; let the feather of the Firebird serve as an example. The little king Ivan lies in wait for the bird: "An hour passes, then another, and then a third, and suddenly the whole garden lit up as if it were illuminated by many fires: the Firebird had arrived in flight." He loses a feather: "This feather was so wonderful and bright that if one had taken it into a dark room it would have lit it as if a multitude of candles had been lit" (Aph. 102). This bird actually comes from the other realm, and the hero sets out to find it. Here the connection is very clear; but even in cases where it does not appear directly in the true sense of the word, the question of its existence can be raised and considered. Thus, for example, the hero finds a miraculous duck: "The master locked his duck in a dark shed; during the night it laid a golden egg. The farmer passed by, saw a great light, and thinking it was a fire, he began to shout at the top of his lungs: 'Fire, fire! Wife, take the buckets and run to pour water!' They opened the shed: there was neither fire nor flame, it was only the golden egg that was shining" (Aph. 115 P).

很明显，这两起案件之间存在联系。与遥远王国的联系没有被表达，但它是一个假设，必须研究。

It is evident that there is a connection between these two cases. The connection with the distant kingdom is not expressed, but is a postulate and must be studied.

金蛋的故事从另一个方面也很有趣：它说明了金色是火成的代名词。我们还从火鸟闪亮的羽毛中看到了这一点。知道遥远的领域也常常是天界和太阳界，我们很容易得出结论，物体的天体颜色是其日光的表现。在某些情况下，这一点表述得非常清楚。因此，在彼尔姆童话故事中，我们读到：“你看到那边有一堆像太阳的火吗？ ——我看到了，他回答道。 “那不是看起来像太阳的火，但它是他的房子，都是金子”»（ZP 1）。

The story of the golden eggs is interesting in another respect: it shows that the golden color is synonymous with fire. We see this also in connection with the shining feather of the Firebird. Knowing that the distant kingdom is also very often the celestial and solar kingdom, we can easily conclude that the celestial color of objects is the expression of their solarity. In some cases this is stated very clearly. Thus in a Perm fairy tale we read: "Do you see, over there, a fire that looks like the sun?" — I see it, he answered. "That is not a fire that looks like the sun, but its house, it is all of gold" » (ZP 1).

4.三个王国。

4. The three kingdoms .

根据NP Andreev的观察，讲述英雄在旅途中如何穿越铜、银和金王国的童话故事是俄语中流传最广的，并且被认为是众所周知的。在我们看来，这三个王国似乎是遥远王国的三倍体。由于童话故事倾向于将所有事物都增加三倍，因此这个主题也适合这种趋势，这可以解释三个王国的总体存在。但由于遥远的王国是金子，以前的王国将是银和铜。想要在这里寻找与铁器时代、银器时代、金器时代的表征以及赫西俄德时代循环的一般联系，将是徒劳的，甚至无法发现与金属表征的任何联系。人们还可能会问，这些是否不是三个王国的代表：天上的、地上的和地下的。但这种联系甚至没有得到材料的证实：铜、银和金王国不是一个在另一个之下，而是一个在另一个之后，而且通常这三个王国都在地下。但是，根据童话故事的经典，遥远的王国是英雄旅程的最后阶段，然后是他的回归，而三个到达是不可能的（因为在这种情况下，他们之前必须有尽可能多的回归和新的出发），前两个王国已经成为一种舞台，第三个王国是到达点。然而，在童话故事的经典中，我们已经有了另一个过渡阶段，即女巫的小屋。在这里，我们发现自己面临着一个奇怪的现象，即三个王国与女巫小屋的同化。确实，回顾这三个王国的众多例子，我们发现它们的某些元素总是源自遥远的王国和公主，而另一些则来自女巫。除了名字之外，这三个王国没有任何具体的名称。我们以 Af 变体为例。 71 a.伊万抵达铜王国，在那里受到“一位美丽的女孩”的欢迎：这当然不是女巫。接下来是英雄的审问和责备：“他没有给我任何吃的或喝的，他向我打听消息。”这个元素显然源自女术士。然后女孩给了他一枚戒指，也就是说，她充当了捐赠者的角色。但在礼物的对象——戒指上，却预示着订婚。然而，英雄只与第三个女孩订婚，即来自黄金王国的女孩，从逻辑上和功能上来说，她都是公主。其他变体也可以用同样的方式进行分析，这种检验将使我们有权利确认三个王国是童话故事的内在形成。不可能找到任何材料表明这一主题与原始心态或原始仪式之间的联系。

According to NP Andreev, the tale about the hero's journey through the copper, silver and golden kingdoms is the most widespread in the Russian language and is assumed to be known. It seems to us that these three kingdoms arose as a tripling of the distant kingdom. Since the tale tends to triplicate everything, this motif also lent itself to this tendency and this would explain the presence of the three kingdoms in general. But since the distant kingdom is golden, the preceding ones will be silver and copper. To try to find a connection here with the representations of the iron, silver and golden ages, and in general with Hesiod's cycle of ages, would be a futile effort and one would not even be able to discover any connection with the representations of metals. One might even ask whether these are not representations of the three kingdoms: celestial, terrestrial and underground. But this connection is not even confirmed by the materials: the copper, silver and golden kingdoms are not one under the other, but one behind the other, and generally all three are underground. But since, according to the canon of the fairy tale, the distant kingdom is the last stage of the hero's journey, followed by his return, and three arrivals are impossible (because in that case they would have to be preceded by as many returns and new departures), the first two kingdoms have become a kind of stage, and the third is the point of arrival. But in the canon of the fairy tale we already have another stage of passage, namely the witch's hut. And here we find ourselves faced with a curious phenomenon of assimilation of the three kingdoms with the witch's hut. Indeed, reviewing the numerous examples of these three kingdoms, we see that some of their elements always derive from the distant kingdom and the princess, and the others from the witch. Apart from their names, these three kingdoms have nothing that specifies them. Let us take the variant Af. 71 a. Ivan arrives in the copper kingdom, where he is welcomed by "a very beautiful girl": it is certainly not the sorceress. This is followed by the hero's interrogation and his reproach: "She gave me neither food nor drink, she asked me for news." This element clearly derives from the sorceress. Then the girl gives him a ring, that is, she acts as a donor. But the object of the gift, the ring, foreshadows the engagement. However, the hero becomes engaged only to the third girl, the girl from the golden kingdom, who logically and functionally is the princess. The other variants can be analyzed in the same way, and this examination will give us the right to affirm that the three kingdoms are an intrinsic formation of the fairy tale. It has not been possible to find any material indicating a connection between this motif and primitive mentality or primitive rites.

5.遥远王国的兽形。

5. The theriomorphism of the distant kingdom .

但我们对遥远王国的研究还远没有结束。另一个特征依然存在：这个王国有时表现为动物王国，而不是人类王国。

But our study of the distant kingdom is far from over. One more characteristic remains: this kingdom sometimes appears as a kingdom of animals and not of men.

说实话，这些提示并不经常出现；与黄金、大理石和珍珠母贝建造的华丽宫殿相比，类似的表现形式仍然略显模糊，但对于学者来说，它们表现出了特别的兴趣。因此，举例来说，如果绑架公主的人是一只动物，那么这只动物就会把她带到他的王国，那里没有男人。由于大多数情况下俘虏者是蛇，所以这个领域往往是蛇的领域。 « 他在球后走了很长一段时间，进入了一个没有人魂、没有鸟、没有野兽、只有蛇的国度。这是蛇的王国”（Af. 112 b）。在故事中，Af. 123 b 我们读到：“瓦西里国王骑上马，越过遥远的土地，进入遥远的国度；后来不知道多久他才到达狮子王国。” “狮子王”住在这里，我们特别注意这个关于野兽之王的指示，因为它对我们以后有用。此后，英雄也最终进入了蛇和乌鸦的王国。王国的这种动物特征并不排除城市、宫殿和花园的存在：“那个王国里只生活着蛇和爬行动物。城市周围有一条大蛇，盘绕着，头碰着尾巴”（Af. 104 P）。在托博尔斯克的童话故事中，我们读到：“在他面前，他看到一座有两级台阶的房子，一层是银的，另一层是金的。他想：“谁住在里面？ ” ……他上前，打开第一个房间的门，看到几只鸡坐着：“难不成这里也有像我们鸡一样的人？ „ » (Sm. 335)。在童话《Mary Morevna》（Af. 94）中，鹰、乌鸦和老鹰向三个女孩求婚。女孩们的哥哥去看望她们的男朋友。 “一天过去了，又过去了，第三天黎明时，他看到一座奇妙的宫殿，宫殿旁边有一棵橡树，橡树上有一只猎鹰。”这是鹰的王国。可以肯定的是，熊王也会把孩子们带到熊的王国。我们还注意到老鼠王国的到来：“他们穿越了大海；他们到达了遥远王国的另一边，老鼠的王国”（Aph. 112 b，参见 Af. 124）。

To be sure, such references are not very often encountered; such representations remain slightly in the shade, compared to the sumptuous palaces of gold, marble and mother-of-pearl, but for the scholar they are of particular interest. Thus, for example, if the kidnapper of the princess is an animal, this animal carries her off to his kingdom, where there are no men. Since in most cases the kidnapper is a serpent, this kingdom is often the kingdom of serpents. "He walked a long way behind the ball of yarn and came into a country where there was no human soul, no birds, no wild beasts, it was only swarming with serpents. It was the kingdom of serpents" (Aph. 112b). In the tale Aph. 123b we read: "The little king Vasilij mounted his horse and rode away, beyond the distant lands, to the distant kingdom; after an unknown amount of time he came to the kingdom of lions." Here lives the "lion king", and we particularly note this indication about the king of beasts because it will be useful to us later. After this the hero also ends up in the kingdom of snakes and that of ravens. This animal character of the kingdom does not at all exclude the presence of cities, palaces and gardens: "In that kingdom lived only snakes and reptiles. All around the city was a large snake coiled up so that its head touched its tail" (Af. 104 P). In a Tobolsk fairy tale we read: "In front of him he saw a house with two flights of steps, one of silver and the other of gold. He thought: 'Who lives in there?' ... He went forward, opened the door of the first room and saw some chickens sitting: 'Can there be people here like our chickens?' " (Sm. 335). In the fairy tale Marya Morevna (Aph. 94) the falcon, the crow and the eagle ask for the hand of three girls. The girls' brother goes to see the fiancés. "One day passes, another passes, at dawn on the third day he sees a wonderful palace, next to the palace there is an oak tree, on the oak tree sits the falcon." It is the kingdom of falcons. It is reasonable to assume that the bear-king also takes the children away to the kingdom of bears. We also note the arrival in the kingdom of mice: "They crossed the sea; they came to the other side of the distant kingdom, to the kingdom of mice" (Aph. 112b, cf. Aph. 124).

二.另一个世界

II. The Other World

6.外部世界的原始形式。

6. Primitive forms of the world beyond .

因此，不存在统一性；存在多样性。首先我们要说，不存在对另一个世界有完全统一的描述的民族。这些表述总是多方面的，部分甚至是矛盾的。

There is therefore no uniformity; there is multiformity. Let us say first of all that there are no peoples with a perfectly uniform representation of the other world; such representations are always multiform and in part even contradictory.

童话故事非常天真但却非常准确地表达了问题的本质，它说：“那里的世界就像我们这里的世界一样。”但随着世界的变化，随着人类社会形态的变化，“另一个世界”也随之变化。人在那里不仅转移了他的社会秩序（在目前的情况下是氏族的社会秩序，领主随后转变为国王），而且转移了他的国家的生活方式和地理特征。岛民想象着以岛屿为幌子的另一个世界。宫殿显然源自男人的房屋，是村里最显眼的建筑等。但人也将自己的利益转移到它身上，特别是经济利益。因此，对于猎人来说，彼岸的王国里充满了动物。死后，他再次接受所有入会考验，并继续狩猎，就像在这里一样，唯一的区别是在另一个世界，他的狩猎永远不会徒劳。

The fairy tale expresses the essence of the matter very naively but very accurately when it says: "And there the world is just as it is with us." But since the world changes, since the forms of human community change, the "other world" also changes with them. Man transfers there not only his social order (in the present case it is that of the clan, with the lord who later becomes the king), but also the forms of life and the geographical peculiarities of his country. The insulars imagine the other world in the form of an island. The palaces are evidently derived from the houses for men, which were the most conspicuous buildings in the village, etc. But man also transfers there his interests, especially his economic ones. Thus for the hunter the kingdom beyond is peopled with animals. After death he is subjected once more to all the tests of initiation and continues to hunt, as down here, with the only difference that in the other world his hunting will never be fruitless.

这种从此世界到彼世界的投射，在氏族社会中已经表现得很清楚了。猎人完全依赖于动物，他让世界充满了动物。他将自己的族序归于动物，并相信自己死后会变成动物，会遇见“主人”，或者用童话的语言来说，是蛇、鱼、小龙虾的“王”， ETC。

This projection of the world of this world into the next world appears very clearly already in the society of the clan. The hunter depends entirely on the animal and he populates the world with animals; he attributes to the animals his clan order, and believes that, after death, he will become an animal and will meet the "master", or, to use the language of the fairy tale, the "king" of snakes, fish, crayfish, etc.

在来世生活着有能力将这些动物送给人类的主人。斯滕伯格研究了吉利亚基人的熊节，得出的结论是，熊被杀是为了把它送到它的主人那里：“被杀的熊的灵魂，”他说，“去了它的主人那里，去了那个主人那里。501.人类的福祉取决于“因此我们可以看到，童话保留了这一层，虽然说实话，倒影很苍白。这解释了为什么另一个王国充满了动物，以及为什么英雄在那里遇到了他们的国王或主人。宫殿里的这些动物与我们从第四章开始就知道的“大房子”里的动物居民非常相似。另一个世界的居民是蛇、狮子、熊、老鼠、鸡，也就是图腾意义上的野生动物。

In the afterlife live masters who have the power to send these animals to men. Sternberg, who studied the bear festival among the Ghiliaki, comes to the conclusion that the bear is killed in order to send it to its master: "The soul of the killed bear," he says, "goes to its master, to the master on whom the well-being of man depends." 501 We can therefore see that the fairy tale has preserved this layer, although, to tell the truth, with very pale reflections. This explains why the other realm is peopled with animals and why the hero meets their king or master there. These animals in the palace very closely resemble the animal inhabitants of the "great house" known to us from chapter IV. In the other world the inhabitants are serpents, lions, bears, mice, chickens, that is to say wild beasts, in the totemic meaning of this word.

7.下颌和自走山。

7. The jaws and the moving mountains .

我们已经熟悉这样一种观念：要想获得对动物的控制权，就必须进入它。这里我们找到了我们已经注意到的现象的关键：死亡的表征与启蒙的形式惊人的相似。但是，尽管如此，没有必要肯定一件事总是从另一件事产生。另一个世界的宫殿不仅与“大房子”惊人地相似，有时甚至与之重合，这表明两者之间无法划出明确的分界线。进入王国是通过动物的下颚；这些钳口不断地闭合和张开。 « 这个王国时不时地开放；当蛇把它的下巴移开时，门也打开”（ZP 13）。在这种情况下，很明显，嘴就是门。从这里而来的，一方面是猛烈关上、有时囚禁英雄脚后跟的门，是带牙齿的门，是咬人的门，另一方面，还有威胁要压垮新来者的自行推进的山脉。我们报告了阿法纳西耶夫抄本中的文本。 « 彼界有两座高山，并立，紧连；它们每 24 小时只有一次分开、分开，两三分钟后又重新聚在一起。赋予生命和健康的水源就保存在这些移动的山脉之中”（Af. 118 c V/2）。这里的类比太大了，不能随意：我们有相同的打开和关闭的周期性，相同的保护功能，相同的被压碎的危险，相同的脚后跟或血管的一小部分的咬伤或监禁，这出现在阿尔戈英雄的传说中。当动物不再是狩猎的对象，不再是主要的、甚至是唯一的生存来源时，它的功能就会转移到其他物体、门、山上。那么，为什么恰恰在山区很难说，但毕竟，这种替代是完全自然的。

We are already familiar with the idea that in order to gain power over an animal, one must enter into it. Here we have the key to the phenomenon we have already noted: the striking similarity of the representation of death to the forms of initiation. But, with all this, there is no need to assert that one thing always proceeds from the other. The palace in the other world not only bears a striking resemblance to the "great house", sometimes it simply coincides with it, so that between the one and the other it is not possible to draw an exact dividing line. The entrance into the kingdom takes place through the jaws of the animals; these jaws are continually closing and opening. "This kingdom opens from time to time; when the serpent opens its jaws, then the doors also open" (ZP 13). In this case it is quite clear that the mouth is the door. From here come, on the one hand, the doors that slam and sometimes trap the heel of the hero, the doors with teeth, the doors that bite, and, on the other, also the moving mountains that threaten to crush the newcomer. We report the text in Afanasiev's transcription. "In that realm there are two high mountains, they stand together, tightly joined to each other; only once in 24 hours do they separate, move apart and after two or three minutes they reunite. Between these moving mountains are preserved the waters that give life and health" (Af. 118 c V/2). Here the analogy is too great to be coincidental: we have the same periodicity in opening and closing, the same function of custody, the same danger of being crushed, the same biting or imprisonment of the heel or of a piece of the ship, which is found in the legend of the Argonauts. When the animal ceases to be the object of hunting as the main, indeed the only source of subsistence, its functions are transferred to other objects, to doors, to mountains. Why, then, to mountains in particular is difficult to say, but, after all, such a substitution is entirely natural.

但自走山只出现在史诗传说中，还是也存在于信仰中？在密克罗尼西亚（吉尔伯特岛上），当地人相信，在不利的情况下，“死者的灵魂可能会被两块石头压碎并被剥夺生命” 502。守卫宫殿入口的动物，主要是狮子和蛇，也来自这里。为了让他们让他通过，英雄必须扔给他们一个蛋糕或给他们水。将物体扔进嘴里的动作，作为后来跳入物体的动作的替代，也是我们已知的。这就解释了守卫宫殿入口的狮子和蛇的原因。

But do moving mountains occur only in epic legends or also in beliefs? In Micronesia (on the Gilbert Islands) the natives believed that, under certain unfavorable circumstances, "the soul of the deceased could be crushed between two stones and deprived of life." 502 From here also come the animals, mainly lions and serpents, which guard the entrance to the palace. In order for them to let him pass, the hero must throw them a cake or give them water. The act of throwing an object into the jaws, as a later replacement for the act of jumping in, is also already known to us. This explains the lions and serpents which guard the entrance to the palace.

我们不会引用证明其他领域的本地化形式与曾经实际存在的形式相对应的材料。我们会找到足够的材料来证明另一个世界，不仅在童话故事中，而且在宗教表述中，都被认为位于水下、山脉之间或地平线之外，这取决于周围的自然环境和人们的基本职业。在这里，我们已经研究过的空间表示很重要。阐述这些类比并不存在困难，问题本身并不代表问题。然而，我们对其他更困难的问题感兴趣，特别是水晶山的问题。

We will not cite materials proving that the forms of localization of the other realm correspond to forms that actually existed once. We will find sufficient materials that the other world, not only in fairy tales but also in religious representations, is conceived as being located under water, between mountains or beyond the horizon, depending on the surrounding nature and the basic occupations of the people. Here the spatial representations already studied by us are important. The elaboration of these analogies presents no difficulty, the question itself does not represent a problem. We are interested instead in other more arduous questions, in particular that of the crystal mountain.

8.水晶。

8. The crystal .

要了解水晶山的原因，必须记住，一个人去那里是为了获得超越动物、超越生死、超越疾病和治愈的力量。一方面，我们在这里认识到萨满的职责，另一方面，我们认识到英雄的职责，寻找返老还童的苹果、活水和死水，以及治疗失明、老年、疾病和疾病的方法。这种仙女媒介的一种非常原始的形式是水晶或石英，在另一个世界中发现并用于各种魔法动作，广泛分布于澳大利亚和美国。在与蛇战斗的章节中，我们已经看到石英被引入到初始者的身体中，并且在蛇的头部中发现了钻石。一个美国神话讲述了一个被父亲殴打的年轻人。他感到被冒犯并想死。 « 他走近一块陡峭的岩石；他爬到山顶又跳了下去，但没有受伤。他继续前行，很快就看到前方一座闪烁着光芒的山峰。那是纳奥拉科阿岩石，那里不断落下晶莹的雨。她取了四英寸长的碎片，将它们排列在头发上。他到达了山顶，全身被水晶覆盖。他很快意识到，通过水晶，他获得了飞行的能力。之后他飞越了整个世界” 503。

To understand the motif of the crystal mountain, one must bear in mind that one goes up there to obtain power over animals, over life and death, over illness and healing. On the one hand we see here the functions of the shaman and on the other those of the hero in search of rejuvenating apples and living and dead water, as well as means to cure blindness, old age, illnesses and ailments. A very primitive form of this fairy medium, found in the other world and used for all kinds of magical actions, is that of rock crystal or quartz, widespread in Australia and America. In the chapter on the fight against the serpent we have already seen that quartz is introduced into the body of the initiate and that diamonds are found in the head of the serpent. In an American myth it is told of a young man who has been beaten by his father. He feels offended and wants to die. "He approached a steep rock; he climbed to the top and threw himself off, but did not hurt himself. He continued on his way and soon saw before him a mountain sparkling with light. It was the Naolakoa rock, where a shower of rock crystal was falling incessantly. He took four pieces of it, one inch long, and placed them in a row in his hair. He reached the top and was completely covered with rock crystal. He soon found that through the rock crystal he had gained the ability to fly. After that he flew over the entire world . 503

与这个神话完全相符的是，多尔加尼人的神话说：“站起来，他开始走路；无论你往哪里看，所有的地球、所有的沙子都是由雏菊和玻璃珠组成的”（《多尔加尼民间传说》，第 70 页）。这个神话给我们解释了俄罗斯童话中的水晶山、德国童话中的玻璃山等。在俄罗斯童话中，水晶山与居住在那里的蛇重新联系在一起。即使在神话中，我们也注意到水晶和蛇之间的联系：在启蒙期间，水晶被引入体内。 « 石英晶体和虹彩蛇之间有着广泛的联系，在整个澳大利亚，石英晶体是巫师使用的最重要的魔法物质之一 » 504。因此这种表示方式是非常原始的。可以合理地假设，从蛇身上获得的“仙沙”也是对相同表征的回忆。

In complete accordance with this myth, a Dolgan myth says: "Having stood up, he begins to walk; wherever he looks, all the earth, all the sand is made of daisies, of glass beads" ( Dolgan Folklore , p. 70). This myth explains the crystal mountain of Russian fairy tales, the glass mountain of German fairy tales, etc. In the Russian fairy tale the crystal mountain is connected with the serpent that lives in it. In myths too we have noticed the connection between the crystal and the serpent: during initiation crystals were introduced into the body. "There is a widespread connection between quartz crystals and the iridescent serpent, and throughout Australia quartz crystals are among the most important magical substances used by the sorcerer." 504 Therefore this representation is very primitive. It is reasonable to suppose that the "Fairy Sand" obtained from the snake is also a reminiscence of the same representations.

9.鱼米之乡。

9. The land of plenty .

我们已经分析了另一个王国的某些方面，这些方面反映了它的演化最原始的阶段，并一直延续到了我们的时代。在属于父权制政权最初形式的“狩猎谷”中，我们已经注意到这里和那里的王国在各个方面都彼此相似。但有一个区别：在另一个世界里，丰富的游戏永远不会停止。

We have analyzed some aspects of the other kingdom, which reflect the most primitive stages of its evolution that have come down to us. Already in the "hunting valleys" belonging to the first forms of patriarchal regime we note that the kingdom on this side and that on the other resemble each other in every way; but there is one difference: in the other world the abundance of game never ceases.

人不仅把自己的生活方式转移到了另一个世界，而且还把自己的兴趣和理想转移到了另一个世界。在与自然的斗争中，他是软弱的，他在这里不能成功的事情，他可以在那里成功。值得注意的是，在另一个世界中，猎人继续他的职业：在那里，赋予他统治自然力量的力量被保留下来，从那里它们可以转移到人类世界，从而获得狩猎方面的进步，箭永远不会失火。但后来在另一个世界，我们停止生产和工作，我们只消费，从来世带来的致命手段确保了永恒的幸福。

Man transfers into the other world not only the forms of his life, but also his interests and ideals. In the struggle against nature he is weak, and what he cannot succeed in here he can succeed in there. What is important to note is that in the other world the hunter continues his craft: there the forces that give him power over nature are preserved, from there he can transfer them to the world of men and thus achieve a refinement of hunting, the arrows that never fail. But later in the other world one stops producing and working, one only consumes, and the fatal means brought from the beyond ensure eternal well-being.

这种表述的出现表明，人们与工作的关系已经发生了变化，这种变化源于工作变成了强迫劳动。劳动力的强迫与财产的出现有关，财产的出现与农业有关。

The appearance of such representations shows that the relations towards work have changed and the change is caused by the fact that work has become forced labor. The coercion of work is connected with the appearance of property, property appears with agriculture.

众所周知，最古老的农业生产形式是园艺。随着农业的兴起，花园和树木也出现在另一个世界，这些树木不需要工作就能满足人类的需求。这种超凡脱俗的形式只有园艺民族才知道。例如，在北美和西伯利亚人民中，这种现象是缺失的，但在波利尼西亚和美拉尼西亚却很普遍。弗雷泽说，在马克萨斯群岛，“天国被描绘成一片幸福的土地，盛产由面包果、猪肉和鱼制成的面食；还有可以想象到的最美丽的女人。成熟的果实不断从面包果树落到地上，椰子和香蕉的供应永远不会耗尽。灵魂安息在比 Nikahiva 垫子厚得多的垫子上，每天沐浴在椰子制成的黄油河中 » 505。对于民俗学家来说，这是极其珍贵的材料，因为它证明了“鱼米之乡”、牛奶河和基塞尔河岸的古老起源， 506 。博尔特和波利夫卡也认为它“非常古老”，但他们引用的最古老的相似之处是指古典时期。与我们上面所说的相比，弗雷泽的材料表明，控制动物丰富度的神奇力量只是被大量可供消费的东西所取代。这就是表示取之不尽、用之不竭的丰富的源泉。在死者之地，食物永不停息；如果你能把这些食物带到这里来，地球上也永远不会耗尽。这就是自定型桌布的由来。

It is well known that the oldest form of agricultural production is horticulture. With the rise of agriculture, gardens and trees also appear in the other world, and these trees provide for the needs of man without any need for work. This form of the other world is known only to horticultural peoples; it is absent, for example, in North America and among the Siberian peoples, but is widespread in Polynesia and Melanesia. In the Marquesas, says Frazer, "the celestial region is represented as a happy land, rich in bread-fruit paste, pork and fish; there are also the most beautiful women imaginable. Ripe fruit continually falls from the bread-fruit tree, and the supply of cocoa-nuts and bananas is never exhausted. The souls rest on mats much thicker than the Nikahiva mats, and bathe every day in rivers of butter made from the cocoa-nut . " 505 For the folklorist this is an extremely valuable material, as it attests to the archaic origin of the motif of the "land of plenty," of the rivers of milk and the banks of kisel . 506 Bolte and Polivka also consider it "very ancient," but the oldest parallels they cite refer to classical antiquity. Frazer 's materials, compared with what we have said above, show that the magical power over the abundance of animals is simply replaced by an abundance of food ready for consumption. Here lies the source of the representation of inexhaustible abundance. In the land of the dead food never runs out; if one succeeds in bringing this food down here, it will never run out on earth either. From here comes the self-laying tablecloth.

必须指出的是，这种表述本身隐藏着一种非常严重的社会危险：它们导致人们拒绝工作。后来，祭司阶层拥有了这些对另一个世界的表征，在那里希望和欲望得到了满足，以便安慰人们，希望他们在这个地球上的忍耐会得到回报：这些表征变得反动。但我们还可以观察到另一个事实：工人阶级非常清楚地感受到这种表述的危害。人的健康本能导致他否认和拒绝这些概念，但尽管如此，它们的诱惑使它们不朽。从这两种矛盾的力量中，我们得出了对主题的喜剧处理作为平衡元素。在童话故事中，基塞尔河岸的主题常常与闲人的喜剧性兴奋联系在一起（格林，151）。即使在古代，我们也有类似的喜剧处理方式：我们知道这个主题在希腊喜剧中有多普遍，我们稍后会在谈到古典时期时对此说几句话。

It must be said that such representations conceal within themselves a very grave social danger: they lead man to refuse to work. Later the priestly caste takes possession of these representations of the other world, where hopes and wishes are fulfilled, in order to console the people with the prospect of a reward for their endurance on this earth: these representations become reactionary. But we can also observe another fact: the working classes feel very clearly the harm of such representations. Man's healthy instinct leads him to deny and reject these concepts, but, for all that, their allure makes them immortal. From these two contradictory forces, the comic treatment of the motif is derived as a balancing element. In the fairy tale the motif of the kisél banks is often connected with the comic exaltation of idlers (Grimm, 151). Even in antiquity we have a similar comic treatment: we know how widespread this motif was in Greek comedy and we will say a few words about it later, when dealing with classical antiquity.

上述考虑有助于我们更好地理解禁止框设置的原因。

The above considerations help us to understand a little better the reason for the forbidden casket.

最初，神话中从另一个世界带来的东西愉快地到达了人类的手中，并给他们带来了好处，正如我们通过研究仙女物品所看到的那样，我们也能够确定动物（即狩猎）是许多动物的起源。其中。

Originally, the things that are brought from the other world in myths happily end up in the hands of men and bring them a benefit, as we have seen when studying fairy objects, and we have also been able to establish the animal, that is, hunting, origin of many of them.

当涉及到能够带来永恒丰富的物品时，事情就会发生变化。一方面，对这些物品的处理是滑稽的：自动设置的桌布或桌子与单独惩罚笨手笨脚的小偷的俱乐部相连。每转一圈都提供煎饼或糕点的作坊也受到了善意的喜剧对待。这是我们上面谈到的反对的温和形式。另一方面，英雄从另一个世界带来的不是火或其他对人类有用的东西，而是不费吹灰之力就能确保常年富足的物品，他却因为这个物品而灭亡，并且没有把它带到人类的最后。 。因此，在美拉尼西亚神话中，英雄从月亮上收到了一个名为莫努亚的盒子，但月亮禁止他在回家之前打开它。英雄踏上归程，当然也触犯了禁令；四周出现了大量的鱼，这些鱼不断增加，最后使507号船倾覆。

Things are different when it comes to the objects that provide perennial abundance. On the one hand, the treatment of these objects is comical: the tablecloth or the table that sets itself is connected with the cudgel that punishes the clumsy thief by itself. The millstones that provide pancakes or pastries at every turn are also treated with good-natured comedy. This is a mild form of the reprobation we spoke of above. On the other hand, the hero who has brought from the other world not fire or anything else useful to men, but an object that ensures perennial abundance without any effort, perishes because of this object and does not bring it to men. Thus in a Melanesian myth the hero receives from the moon a casket called monuia , but the moon forbids him to open it before returning home. The hero embarks on the return journey and, of course, transgresses the prohibition; From all sides, multitudes of fish appear, which continually increase in number and finally capsize the boat 507 .

在俄罗斯童话故事中，我们也有同样的情况：英雄收到一个棺材，里面有牛出来；整个岛上到处都是牛，英雄受到致命危险的威胁（Af. 125 a）。在希腊神话中的潘多拉，被禁止的“棺材”中蕴藏着一种蔓延到世界各地的邪恶：这是对同一主题的文学和象征性阐述。

In the Russian fairy tale we have the same case: the hero receives a casket from which cattle emerge; the whole island fills with cattle and the hero is threatened by mortal danger (Af. 125 a). In the Greek myth of Pandora the forbidden "casket" contains an evil that spreads throughout the world: this is a literary and symbolic elaboration of the same motif.

10.太阳王国。

10. The Solar Realm .

在继续之前我们还要研究一条线，即代表太阳国的线。要确定这个概念的确切出现时间并不容易。与其他变得僵化或变形、意义转换或被滑稽对待的特殊性相反，这种表征在诸如埃及宗教这样的进化宗教中发展并达到顶峰。例如，我们可以看到，在亚库蒂人（Iacuti）中，即在以养牛为生的民族中，有非常明显的那个王国的代表。 « 他来到孙先生的女儿，萨满Kiuegjam，坐在八足铜凳上，将八根长长的红丝头发缠在银钉上，用金梳子梳理它（丘贾科夫，拉克. ，第 78 页）。这位太阳的女儿是第四位遇到的女主角。 （在西伯利亚，有时，就像在北美经常发生的那样，数字四与这里的数字三履行相同的职责。）第一个女主角与云相连，第二个与星星相连，第三个与月亮相连，第四个与太阳相连。我们认为，这个例子证实了研究俄罗斯童话材料的人的猜想，即金色或铜色是太阳王国的颜色。

Before continuing, there is one line that remains for us to study, namely the line of representation of the kingdom of the sun. It is not at all easy to establish exactly when this concept appeared. Contrary to what happens with other particularities that petrify or deform, undergo transpositions of meaning or are treated comically, this representation develops and reaches its apogee in advanced religions such as the Egyptian one. We can note that among the Yakuts, for example, that is, among a people who live from cattle breeding, there are very clear representations of that kingdom. « She came to Mr. Sun. The daughter of Mr. Sun, the shaman Kiuegjam, sitting on an eight-legged copper stool, after having wrapped her red silken hair, eight sažen long, around a silver peg , combs it with a golden comb (Chudjakòv, Racc . Verchoj ., p. 78). This daughter of the sun is the fourth heroine encountered. (In Siberia, sometimes, as always happens in North America, the number four fulfills the same function as the number three with us.) The first heroine is connected with the clouds, the second with the stars, the third with the moon, and the fourth with the sun. This example, in our opinion, confirms the conjecture which occurs to those who study Russian fairy-tale materials, that the golden or copper color is the color of the solar kingdom.

与遥远境界相连的物体的金色是太阳的颜色。不了解太阳宗教的人们，不知道仙物的金色。

The golden color of objects connected with the distant realm is the color of the sun. Peoples who are unknown to the religion of the sun do not know the golden color of fairy objects.

为了更好地理解这个原因，有必要观察遥远王国的表征通常是如何随着向农业的过渡而发展的。埃及、巴比伦和亚述、中国和古典世界都可以作为例子。

To better understand this reason, it is necessary to observe how the representations of the distant kingdom generally developed with the transition to agriculture. Egypt, Babylon and Assyria, China and the classical world can serve as examples.

即使每个人都有所有具体和独特的特征，也可以发现非常明显的共同特征，这些特征也在童话故事中找到。首先，正如我们所说，旧的表征并没有消失，而是继续存在，并且新的表征叠加在它们之上。到目前为止，我们已经看到，人们将他们所知道的生命和物质存在的生产形式归因于来世的王国。来世的世界重复着今生的世界；猎人在其中饲养动物，园艺家在其中种植花园。但随着向农业的过渡，这一过程被中断。在另一个世界里，没有耕耘，没有播种，也没有收获。即使在遥远的童话王国里，也没有进行任何农业工作。动物、花园、岛屿在所有宗教中都得到了保留，但出​​现了一个新的元素：赋予生育力的神灵出现了。正如我们所见，这些神的踪迹也被保留在童话故事中。这是第一个观察结果。现在这是第二个：在埃及，另一个王国的太阳概念达到了充分发展，逐渐演变并呈现出象征形式。最古老的金字塔“仍然几乎完全在拉哈宗教和死者的太阳天居所的轨道内，后来的金字塔越来越多地转向奥西里斯” 508。我们不会停下来详细研究埃及的表述。在我们看来，它们本质上包含三层：动物层、园艺层和太阳能农业层，这显然是君主制的。众所周知，另一个世界充满了动物，埃及人无法向希罗多德解释动物崇拜的原因，希罗多德也无法解释。树木和花园也是这一信仰的重要组成部分。布雷斯特德就此说道：“法老希望在拉王国中生存的众多资源中，最重要的资源之一，即使不是最重要的，就是位于神秘岛屿上的生命树。优惠字段的中间；他在晨星的陪伴下去找他 » 509。顺便说一句，这颗晨星也是一只绿鹰。这就是在土地制度下，椰子变成的样子，它的果实永远掉落：这棵棕榈树实体化为生长在死亡王国中的生命之树。谁到达这棵树，谁就获得永生。根据古老的说法，留在另一个领域会赋予魔法美德，无论谁成功返回，都会成为魔术师和施法者，不会死。我们在美国遇到的“魔水晶”并没有被忘记。但这里的“水晶山”或“水晶雨”是以“水晶天空”的形式出现的，已经缺乏它的神奇功能。 “普塔用水晶覆盖了他的天空”（《死者之书》，XIV）。在世界历史上，这种神奇的功能第一次传递给另一个充满神秘和力量的物体，那就是书。埃及是第一个创造“童话书”的国家，即使在童话故事中也能在公主或其父亲的手中找到它。这些表征在宫廷和祭司以及民间的官方宗教中占主导地位，他们讲述着这本书如何从死亡王国被带出来的精彩故事。雷岑斯坦说：“让我们再看一下死亡之岛的表现，它由一条巨大的蛇守护着。对我们来说，想象将其放置在河流的下游（例如在三角洲）或上游……或在红海中并不重要，该岛是否是唯一的还是有很多，例如在亡灵之书的划分。最重要的是，将童话形式精确地赋予这些在一系列预言和魔法故事中重复出现的表现形式。它们的基础是纯粹的埃及表征，根据这种表征，任何人想要获得最高科学和最高权力，就必须成为神，并且通过死者世界或天空的朝圣成为神。”这种“纯粹的埃及再现”我们已经从澳大利亚和美国的材料中了解到，也是童话故事的基础。作者所指的“短篇小说”是萨特纳-夏莫恩斯与木乃伊的冒险故事，以及他的510号海难故事。
