"In a single night he must plough, sort the seed, sow so that everything grows, make it ripen, grind the grain and make bread" (Sev. 1). This feat is found in many versions. Elsewhere the hero is put to the test to see if he possesses the virtue of hastening the harvest. This was precisely what was required of the magician-sorcerer at the dawn of agriculture. "On the island of Yap the natives believe that the priest or magician of the sacred grove possesses the magical power of influencing the production of certain fruits of the earth and thus contributes directly to the maintenance of men. Thus, for example, it was believed that the high priest or great magician of Tomi was able to hasten the harvest of taro and the growth of breadfruit plantations throughout the island. In Ologi and Pernogo the priest or magician knows the magic of the sweet potato; in Maki he is a specialist in the magic of the coconut and the arek palm . These priests can also make the sun descend to the earth." 536 We see what abilities the future chief and king brings with him. Even the fairy tale does not completely forget the ability to command the sun and the celestial elements. "I will not marry him... First of all ask him for the red sun and the white moons and the thick stars at midnight." The hero "fabricates" all this and "delivers" it, that is, he establishes it on the spot.

这些材料表明，英雄建造宫殿、种植花园或获得异常早期收获的主题可以追溯到魔术师和祭司的代表，他们能够凭借他们所经历的启蒙来加速收获。

These materials show that the motif of the hero who builds the palace and plants the garden, or produces an unusually early harvest, dates back to the representations of magicians and priests, capable of hastening the harvest by virtue of the initiation they underwent.

这使我们了解另一种类型的测试，即火测试或沸水测试。

This brings us to understand another type of test, namely the test of fire or the test of the boiling bath.

14.卫生间测试。

14. The bath test .

坐在滚烫的热水浴缸里的壮举很受欢迎。 “浴池加热了三个月，热得五英里外都无法站立”（Af.77）。英雄失去了信心：“你疯了吗？我会在那里燃烧。”但就在那一刻，他想起了他的助手们，其中就有我们已经认识的“霜裂者”。 « “交给我吧，我知道该怎么做！ “他跳进浴室，对着一个角落吹气，对着另一个角落吐口水，整个浴室都变冷了，角落里都是雪。”通过这一壮举，英雄证明了，拥有助手，他可以统治元素。

The feat of sitting in a boiling bath is very popular. "The bath was heated for three months and it was so hot that at a distance of five versts one could not stand it" (Af. 77). The hero loses heart: "Are you mad? I will burn in there." But at that moment he remembers his helpers, among whom is the "Frost-Squeak" whom we already know. "'Leave it to me, for I know what I'm talking about!' He jumped into the bath, blew into one corner, spat into the other, the whole bath became cold and there was snow in the corners." With this feat the hero proves that, possessing helpers, he rules the elements.

在上面引用的海洋神话中，我们已经看到了未来的领导者如何度过寒冷和炎热。如果说沐浴是俄罗斯童话故事中的人物，那么这自然是俄罗斯近代的火刑审判形式。在美国神话中，希望与太阳之女或“远方的人”结婚的英雄要经历火的考验。 « 座位前面着火了。 Tsowatalalis（新娘的父亲）添加了更多的木材来烘烤 Gyii（英雄）。然后他把姨妈给他的贝壳扔进火里，他们把火扑灭了” 537。英雄的阿姨相当于我们的女巫给予者。男主角还经历了其他考验，最后新娘的父亲说：“你不仅仅是一个男人，我会把我的女儿嫁给你。”

In the Oceanic myth cited above we have already seen how the future leader passes through cold and heat. If bathing figures in Russian fairy tales, this is of course a more recent Russian form of the ordeal by fire. In American myths the hero who wishes to marry the daughter of the sun or "someone who lives far away" goes through the ordeal by fire. "In front of the seat there was a great fire. Tsowatalalis (the bride's father) adds more wood to roast Gyii (the hero). Then he threw the shells given to him by his aunt into the fire and they tamed the fire." 537 The hero's aunt corresponds to our sorceress-giver. The hero also undergoes other tests, and at the end the bride's father says: "You are more than a man and I will give you my daughter."

在其他包含求婚和英雄考试的神话中，给予女性的人将一块石头加热并放入英雄的嘴里。通过这个手势，她赋予了他控制火元素的力量538。

In other myths containing the request for marriage and the examination of the hero, the woman-donor heats a stone and puts it in the hero's mouth. With this gesture she gives him power over the element of fire 538 .

可以举出几个例子来证明，从最早的时候开始，神话中就出现了英雄的形象，因为他拥有从森林里带来的仙女礼物，所以经过了火的考验并通过了考验。对我们来说更重要的是要确立另一个事实：北美神话中发现的证据准确地反映了婚礼习俗。正如神话中所发生的那样，未婚夫的考验在现实中进行，并且这种考验具有舞台表现的特征。博阿斯给我们讲了一个这样的例子：未婚夫与他的父亲和朋友一起乘船去见新娘。一路上，领导叮嘱他们不要害怕。他们带来了彩礼和400条毯子。一旦到达那里，他们就会被邀请进入。新娘的父亲转向陌生人说：“现在你们要小心，因为这里有一只海怪，它吞噬了所有人，而在房子后面，有一个将所有试图娶我女儿的人撕成碎片的人，而这场大火将烧死所有试图娶她的人。”然后，他转向自己说道：“现在，酋长，生起火来，把我们的女儿带到这里来。”他点燃了火，并对陌生人说：“现在，大家要小心，因为我要考验你们了。你说你不怕这个怪物？我将考验你们所有人，你们家族的领袖。因为这场大火，没有人能够拥有我的女儿。”然后每个人都裹着毯子躺在火边。毯子正在燃烧。每个人都站起来吹牛。新娘的父亲称赞他们：“你们是第一个没有因为怕火而逃跑的人。”其他证据如下，即：在陌生人到来之前，未来的岳父制作了一只嘴巴张开又闭合的熊面具。面具贴在熊皮上，熊皮上充满了从墓地带来的头骨和骨头。新娘的父亲对着熊说：“现在，你，万民的吞噬者，站出来，让未婚夫的父亲和所有外国人（他说出他们的名字）看到是谁吞噬了我女儿的求婚者。”熊走上前来，新娘的父亲拿起一根棍子，插进熊的肚子里。熊吐出了七个头骨和其他骨头。然后父亲转向陌生人：“现在看：他们是来这里娶我女儿的求婚者的骨头，然后在火堆前逃跑了。人民的吞噬者已经吞噬了他们。这是他吐出来的。现在，女儿，过来接近你的未婚夫。”至此仪式539结束。

Many examples could be collected to demonstrate that from the earliest times the figure of the hero appears in myths who undergoes the ordeal of fire and overcomes it because he possesses a magical gift brought with him from the forest. For us it is more important to establish another fact: the ordeals found in the myths of North America reflect exactly the wedding customs. Precisely as it takes place in the myth, so in reality does the ordeal of the fiancé take place, and this ordeal has the character of a scenic representation. Boas tells us of a case of this kind: the fiancé goes to the bride by boat together with his father and his friends. On the way the chief urges them not to be afraid. They bring with them the bride price, 400 blankets. When they arrive at the place, they are invited to enter. The father of the bride turns to the strangers and says: "Now be on your guard, for here is a sea monster that swallows everyone, and behind the house is the one who devours all those who try to marry my daughter, and this fire will burn all those who try to marry her." Then, turning to himself, he says: "Now, chief, stir up the fire and have our daughter brought here." He lights a pyre and says to the strangers: "Now, people, be careful, for I am about to test you. You say you are not afraid of this monster? I will test all of you, leaders of your lineage. Because of this fire, no one will be able to have my daughter." Then they all lie down around the fire wrapped in blankets. The blankets burn. They all get up and boast. The father of the bride praises them: "You are the first who did not run away for fear of the fire." Further evidence follows, namely: before the arrival of the strangers, the future father-in-law has fashioned a bear mask whose mouth opens and closes. The mask is fixed to the skin of a bear that has been filled with skulls and bones brought from the cemetery. Addressing the bear, the bride's father says: "Now you, devourer of all peoples, come forward so that the father of the fiancé and all the strangers (he says their names) can see who has devoured my daughter's suitors." The bear comes forward, the bride's father takes a stick and sticks it into its belly. The bear vomits out seven skulls and other bones. Then the father turns to the strangers: "Now look: these are the bones of the suitors who came here to marry my daughter and ran away from the fire. The devourer of peoples has devoured them. This is what he has vomited. Now, daughter, come here and approach your fiancé." Thus ends the ceremony 539 .

我们问自己：父亲有什么权利考验他的男朋友？这个测试的意义是什么？从博阿斯的材料中我们知道，在夸扣特尔人中，年轻人的入会费用不是由他的父亲支付的，而是由新娘的父亲支付的540。新郎成为了他妻子家族的一员。婚礼前，在负责未婚夫知识和能力的人（即新娘的家人）在场的情况下，庆祝一种重复的入会仪式（燃烧、吞咽和打嗝，外观略有变形）。父亲。新郎以传统和模仿的形式证明他有能力完成这次考试的所有科目，他证明他已经经历过火并且对此不敏感。

The question arises: by what right does the father put the fiancé to the test? What is the meaning of this test? From Boas's materials we know that among the Kwakiutl the initiation of the young man was not paid for by his father, but by the father of the bride . 540 The groom entered the wife's clan. Before the wedding a kind of repetition of the initiation ceremony (burning, swallowing and belching, under a slightly distorted appearance) is celebrated in the presence of the person responsible for the fiancé's knowledge and abilities, that is, in the presence of the bride's father. In conventional and mimic form the groom demonstrates his ability in all the matters of this test, demonstrates that he has passed through the fire and is insensitive to it.

神话和仪式包含相同的内容。我们已经知道，这些神话是在启蒙时告诉年轻人的，并构成了启蒙者的一种财产。它们不会向其他人报告，而是在庄严的场合上演。由此诞生了史诗传统，这一传统也保留在当代童话故事中。童话故事中经常出现烧伤新郎的案例，但这种做法采取了某种夸张的形式，并根据童话故事的民族色彩（例如洗澡）进行了修改。通常体现在物体上的神奇美德，在这里以拟人化的助手、元素之主的形象化身。新郎通过了测试，助手也通过了测试。

Myth and rite contain the same thing. We already know that myths were told to the young man during initiation and constituted a kind of property of the initiate. They were not to be referred to others, but were performed on solemn occasions. This is how the epic tradition was born, which has also been preserved in contemporary fairy tales. Fairy tales have preserved quite frequent cases of the burning of the groom, but this operation has assumed rather hyperbolic forms and has been modified by the national colouring of the fairy tale (for example, the bath). The magical virtue, usually embodied in the object, is embodied here in the image of the anthropomorphic helper, lord of the elements. The groom passes the test because the helper passes it.

15.进餐测试。

15. The meal test .

洗澡的痛苦常常与吃饭的痛苦联系在一起。 « 好吧，如果你这么聪明，就表现出你的勇气吧。你和你的同伴必须一口气吃掉十二头烤牛和十二袋面包”（Af. 83）。 « 国王下令准备一顿丰盛的晚餐；各种各样的菜肴被端上了餐桌。贪吃者善意地接受了它，并吞噬了一切”（Af.78）。这项事业有特殊的帮助者：“Mangione”或著名的“食者和饮者”英雄。童话《Ruzzola-pisello》（Af.74）向我们展示了一个特殊的案例。在这里，英雄沿途遇到了一些牧羊人，他们建议他依次吃羊群中最大的公羊、一头猪，最后是十二头公牛、十二头公羊和十二头猪。此后，英雄来到蛇面前，蛇提议他吃一斗铁豆和铁谷物。英雄吃掉一切（Af. 74 b）。这些豆子和铁粒让我们想起了童话《鹰菲尼斯特》（Af.129）中女孩随身携带的面包和铁杖，这让我们想知道食物和食物的证据之间是否存在联系。在另一个世界的永恒。这种联系似乎与以下事实相矛盾：该测试通常不包括吃铁质食物，而是吃大量食物。然而，知道英雄与地下世界和空中世界的联系有多牢固，我们也可以在这里假设这种联系。众所周知，在古典神话的英雄中，赫拉克勒斯因其特别的贪婪而脱颖而出。但赫拉克勒斯恰恰非常接近童话故事中的英雄：他也完成了艰巨的壮举，他也坠入地狱。来自地狱的人拥有神奇的能力，其中之一就是吃很多东西的能力。为什么？这个问题无法用任何参考来回答，只能注意事实本身。然而，死者的本质（英雄获得死者的美德）是已知的：死者的特性之一是他们不吃东西。它们是无形的、透明的。我们稍后会看到，英雄获得了使自己隐形的能力等。食物不会留在死者体内，而是会穿过他们。因此，严格来说，英雄并不像活着的人那样吃东西：他可以继续无休止地吃东西，而这种吃东西的行为在童话故事中呈现出奇妙的维度。让我们记住，女巫和与她类似的生物通常没有背部。这种解释只是一个假设，但对我来说，它似乎比 OM Freidenberg 的假设更有可能，根据该假设，英雄是贪婪的，因为“死亡是贪婪的和无法满足的” 541。

The test of the hot bath is very often connected with that of the meal. "Well, if you are so clever, show your courage. At one time you and your companions must eat twelve roast oxen and twelve sacks of bread" (Aph. 83). "The king ordered a great feast to be served; a great many dishes of every kind were brought to the table; the glutton sat down to it with gusto and devoured everything" (Aph. 78). For this task there are special helpers: the "Glutton" or the famous heroes "Eat-it-all and Drink-it-all". A special case is presented to us by the fairy tale Ruzzola-pea (Aph. 74). There the hero meets some shepherds on the way who propose to eat in turn the largest sheep of the flock, a pig, and finally twelve oxen, twelve sheep and twelve pigs. After this the hero comes to the serpent who proposes to eat a bushel of iron beans and iron wheat. The hero eats everything (Aph. 74 b). These beans and this grain of iron remind us of the bread and the iron stick that the girl takes with her in the tale of Finist the Falcon (Aph. 129), and this makes us wonder whether there is a connection between the test of food and the stay in the other world. It would seem that this connection is contradicted by the fact that usually the test does not consist in eating iron food, but a large quantity of food. However, knowing how constant the bond is that unites the hero to the underworld and the airy world, we can also assume such a connection here. It is known that among the heroes of classical mythology Heracles stands out for his particular voracity. But Heracles is in fact very close to the hero of the tale: he too performs difficult feats, he too descends into hell. From hell magical abilities come to men and one of these is precisely the ability to eat a lot. Why? This question cannot be answered with any reference, one can only note the fact itself. However, the nature of the dead (and the hero acquires the virtue of the dead) is known: one of the peculiarities of the dead is that they do not eat. They are invisible, diaphanous. We will see later that the hero acquires among other things the ability to make himself invisible. Food does not remain in the dead, it passes through them. Therefore the hero does not eat strictly speaking as the living eat: he can continue to eat indefinitely and this act of eating takes on fantastic dimensions in the fairy tale. Let us remember that the witch and beings similar to her often do not have backs. This explanation is only a hypothesis, but it seems more likely to me than the hypothesis of OM Freidenberg, according to which the hero is voracious because "death is voracious and insatiable" 541 .

可能其他表征也在这里发挥作用，根据这些表征，食物的共享创造了血统的共享。 « 只有家庭或宗族的成员才能参加宴会。如果一个外国人被允许参加，就意味着他被欢迎进入氏族或者氏族将他置于其保护之下542。这里我们有一类婚礼仪式，其中还包括共享餐食。与此相反的是，童话中只有新郎吃饭，新娘不吃饭，这样就无法解释英雄的贪婪。不管情况如何，我们在这里反映了与庆祝婚姻或在另一个世界逗留有关的仪式膳食的形式。

It may be that other representations also come into play here, according to which the community of food creates the community of lineage. "Only members of the family or clan may take part in the banquet. If a stranger is allowed to take part, it means that he is accepted into the clan or that the clan takes him under its protection . 542 Here we have a category of wedding rites which also include the common meal. In contrast to this is the fact that in the fairy tale only the groom eats and not the bride, and this does not explain the hero's voracity. Be that as it may, we have here a reflection of the forms of the ritual meal, connected with the celebration of the marriage or with the sojourn in the other world.

16.比赛。

16. The competitions .

有时，在婚礼之前，英雄必须经历某些比赛。乍一看，这些比赛具有纯粹的体育性质。弗雷泽（Frazer）曾处理过这个问题，他在其中看到的只是体育斗争；而不是运动斗争。他将这种习俗归因于遥远的起源，并将其投射到“原始社会”。 « 这些个人品质的表现可能会随着时代和社会制度的不同而改变。但有理由相信，在原始社会，体力和美貌发挥着突出的作用。公主的手和王位本身有时就是体育比赛的奖品。例如，阿利泰姆诺斯的利比亚人将王权授予跑得最快的人。在古代普鲁士人中，渴望获得高头衔的人必须驰骋到国王那里，而第一个到达的人就会被授予头衔” 543。除了“可以合理地假设”之外，弗雷泽无法为他的陈述找到任何其他理由。这件事不是以竞技或美貌来决定的，而是以完全不同的品质决定的。在她关于格鲁吉亚童话的作品中，蒂查贾感受到了这一点，但无法证明这一点：“英雄的个人品质也同样具有特色：美丽、运动力量、智力和其他反映他的神话本质的品质;它们是与公主结合的条件，但不是起源” 544。作者正确地看到了弗雷泽没有看到的东西：运动力量或敏捷性反映了英雄的神话本质。

Sometimes, before the wedding, the hero has to undergo certain contests. At first sight these contests have a purely sporting character. Frazer, who has dealt with the question, sees in them only athletic wrestling; he attributes to this custom a remote origin and projects it into "primitive society". "The representation of these personal qualities perhaps varied according to the epoch and the social system. But it is reasonable to assume that in primitive society physical strength and beauty played a pre-eminent role. The hand of the princess and the throne itself were sometimes the prize of the athletic contest. The Libyans of Alitemnos, for example, awarded the royal power to the fastest runner. Among the old Prussians the aspirants to a high title had to gallop to the king and the title was awarded to the first to arrive" . 543 Frazer can find no other reason for his statement than "it is reasonable to assume". The matter was not decided by athletic competition or beauty, but by quite other qualities. In her work on Georgian fairy tales Tichaja feels it but cannot prove it: "No less characteristic are the hero's personal qualities: beauty, athletic strength, intelligence and other qualities reflecting his mythological nature; they are the condition, but not the origin of the union with the princess" 544 . The author has rightly seen what Frazer did not: athletic strength or agility reflect the mythological nature of the hero.

仔细研究这个童话故事就会发现，在比赛中，英雄的敏捷性和力量都没有得到体现，而是体现了其他品质。给予胜利者，是神助；没有他，英雄将一事无成，这与他的个人力量无关。

A careful study of the tale shows that in the competitions neither the agility nor the strength of the hero are reflected, but other qualities. The one who gives the victory is the magic helper; without him the hero can do nothing and it is not a question of his personal strength.

我们来看看跑步比赛。 “国王的女儿将跑到井边，并被嫁给跑得比她快的人为妻”（Chud. I，33）。在这里，不仅比赛的速度很重要，而且比赛的目的地也很重要。乍一看，这口井并没有什么特别之处。但通过变化的比较可以看出，水才是比赛的目标；这不是我们从阿法纳西耶夫童话故事中看到的普通水：在很短的时间内“国王吃完午餐之前”，人们必须找到“可以治愈并赋予生命”的水。主人公绝望了，一年之内都找不到她；听到这个任务后，“他的同伴将他的腿从耳朵上解开，开始奔跑，瞬间收集了可以治愈并赋予生命的水”。在回程途中，他躺下休息，但奥基奥菲诺和菲乌托菲诺让他大吃一惊，弓箭手用熟练的箭叫醒了他，信使及时赶到了水（Af.83）。

Let us examine the race competition. "The king's daughter shall run to the well, and shall be given as a wife to the one who outruns her" (Chud. I, 33). Here it is not only the speed of the race that is important, but also its goal. At first glance the well does not present anything special; but a comparison of the variants shows that water is the goal of the race; that it is not the usual water we see from Afanasiev's tale: in a very short time "before the king has finished his lunch" the water "that heals and gives life" must be found. The hero despairs, not even in a year will he be able to find it; having heard of this task, "his companion unties his leg from his ear, runs off and in a flash collects the water that heals and gives life." On the return journey he lies down to rest, but Occhiofino and Fiutofino surprise him, the archer wakes him up with a skillful arrow and the courier arrives in time with the water (Af. 83).

这些例子证明，早跑是不够的，而是要早跑，跑得很远，然后返回。后来这个目标消失了，“生命之水”变成了一口井，比赛的速度本身就是一个目标。最初的基础在童话故事中更加清晰地体现出来，在童话故事中，国王离开他的国家三年，派人去取一把受伤的剑，而他把这把剑忘在了城堡里。 « 我们的国王把自伤之剑、战刀忘在家里了，花了三个月才到达我们的王国。国王许诺，谁能及时把女儿带到他面前，他就可以娶她为妻”（Chud. 3）。英雄变成了不同的动物，从一个王国跑到另一个王国。

These examples prove that it is not enough to run quickly, but to run quickly and very far, and then return. Later this goal disappears, the "water of life" turns into a well, and the speed of the race becomes an end in itself. The original basis shines through even more clearly in the fairy tales in which the king is three years away from his country and sends for the self-wounding sword, which he has forgotten in his castle. "Our king has forgotten the self-wounding sword, the battle knife, at home, and it takes three months to get to our kingdom. The king promises his daughter in marriage to whoever brings her to him in time" (Chud. 3). The hero, transformed into different animals, runs from one kingdom to another.

同样的表现在射击比赛中也有明显的体现。乍一看，一切似乎都取决于武器的重量和大小，以及弓的张力程度，就像《奥德赛》中所发生的那样。在阿法纳西耶夫的童话故事（Af. 116 c）中，四十个人拿着这把弓，英雄的帮手把它折断了。在《楚贾科夫》中，弓由六头牛驮，箭由三对牛驮（Chud.19）。但这不仅仅是射击武器，而是从一个领域射击到另一个领域。例如，公主通过快递员向英雄寄来一根重达三个布丁的铁棒。英雄绝望：“我该如何将她扔到遥远的王国呢？” » 解决问题的人是英雄的仙女帮手，他的帮手。 « 主人哈哈大笑，一手抓起狼牙棒，挥动三下，扔向遥远的王国，咆哮着飞过山野，重重地落在王后的房间上，整个宫殿都震动了»（ AF.116a/V）。这里与俱乐部发生的事情发生在另一个关于箭头的童话故事中。 « 在一个印度王国，女王是一位伟大的女巫，她答应要结婚。承诺是：“当我送你一把从未射过的弓箭时，你试试看。如果你能找到她，请告诉我，我就娶你。”弓箭是由牛驮的。突然，伊凡以成本价买来的弓箭射出了。箭飞入印度王国，撞倒了王宫的二楼”（Chud.19）。

The same representations are clearly reflected in shooting competitions. At first glance it would seem that everything depends on the weight and size of the weapon, on the degree of tension of the bow, as in the Odyssey . In Afanasiev's tale (Af. 116 c) forty men carry this bow and the hero's assistant breaks it. In Chudjakov the bow is carried by six oxen and the arrow by three pairs of oxen (Chud. 19). But it is not just a question of shooting with this weapon, it is a question of shooting from one kingdom to another. The princess, for example, sends the hero by a courier an iron club weighing three poods . The hero despairs: "How will I be able to throw it into the distant kingdom?" The hero's fairy assistant, his assistant, solves the problem. « The farmer burst out laughing, grabbed the club with one hand, swung it three times and threw it into the distant kingdom: it flew with a roar across mountains and plains and fell so heavily on the little queen's room that the whole palace shook » (Af. 116 a/V). What happens here with the club happens in another tale with the arrow. « In an Indian kingdom the queen was a great enchantress and had promised to take a husband. The promise was: “When I send you a bow and an arrow that has never been shot before, try it. If you can shoot it, let me know and I will marry you „. The bow and arrows are carried by oxen. Suddenly Ivan-bought-at-a-price drew his bow and shot the arrow. The arrow flew into the Indian kingdom and knocked down the second story of the royal palace" (Chud. 19).

从对执行武士公主命令的功绩的助手的分析中，也可以清楚地看出这些比赛的神奇特征。我们已经在上面研究过它们，认识到它们是两个世界之间的中介。

The magical character of these competitions is also clear from the analysis of the assistants who carry out the tasks ordered by the warrior princess. We have already studied them above, recognizing in them intermediaries between the two worlds.

这里表达的考虑也适用于丰富的经典材料。在古典时期，英雄在赛跑后占有女孩的例子有很多。在这种情况下，英雄几乎总是在帮助者或神明的帮助下获胜。因此，弗雷泽关于英雄个人品质的理论甚至没有得到经典材料的支持。根据众多版本之一，珀罗普斯在一场战车比赛中赢得了俄诺玛奥斯，因为他得到了波塞冬的马匹作为礼物。而如果按照传统，奥运会是由恩底弥翁创办的，比赛以他的坟墓为起点，奖品是力量545，那么比赛中两个王国联合的表现不也在这里发生吗？古典世界的学者应该从这个方面来分析梅兰帕斯与涅琉斯之女的婚姻、赫拉克勒斯与埃纽斯、欧律托斯的功绩、希波墨涅斯支持的争夺阿塔兰忒的斗争等等。最后，如果比赛也是葬礼庆祝活动的一部分，而且不仅在希腊人之间，而且在其他民族之间，这些比赛难道不是与死者从一个王国到另一个王国的旅程有关吗？罗德等人还观察到，死者坟墓上的游戏与灵魂崇拜有关。 “葬礼以跑步结束的事实可以解释为一种古老且更强烈的灵魂崇拜的雏形” 546。但他无法解释这一点，因为他（以及其他学者）相信死者参加了游戏，并且玩这些游戏是为了取悦他，瓦伦也提出了这一理论。尽管对葬礼庆祝活动的分析根本不属于我们的范围，但我们必须说，民俗材料使我们认为赛跑与将死者运送到另一个世界有关。

The considerations expressed here can also be applied to the very abundant classical material. In classical antiquity there are very numerous cases in which the hero takes possession of the girl after a race. In such cases the hero almost always wins by virtue of an assistant or a god. Consequently, Frazer's theory about the personal qualities of the hero is not confirmed even by the classical material. Pelops, according to one of the many versions, defeats Oenomaus in a chariot race because he has been given the horses of Poseidon. And if, according to tradition, the Olympic games were instituted by Endymion and the race had as its starting point his tomb and the prize was power , 545 does not perhaps here also emerge the representation of the union of the two kingdoms in the race? In this respect, classical scholars should analyze the marriage of Melampus to the daughter of Neleus, the exploits of Hercules with Oeneus and Eurytus, the struggle of Hippomenes for the possession of Atalanta, etc. And finally, if competitions were also part of the funeral festivities, and not only among the Greeks but among other peoples, are these competitions not perhaps connected with the journey of the deceased from one kingdom to another? That the games on the tomb of the dead are connected with the cult of souls has been observed, among others, by Rohde. "The fact that the funeral rites conclude with a race is explained as the rudiment of an ancient and more intensive cult of souls." 546 But he was unable to explain this, since he (and other scholars with him) believes that the dead took part in the games and that they were held to please him, a theory also formulated by Varron. And although the analysis of funeral celebrations is not at all part of our intentions, we must nevertheless say that the folklore material leads us to think that the races are related to the deceased's ferry to the other world.

17.捉迷藏。

17. Hide and seek .

特别有趣的是我们的隐藏壮举。国王发布公告：“对于那些躲藏了半生、半生都找不到的人，我将赐我的小公主为妻，在我死后，他将成为国王”（Onč . 2 ）。这位国王是一位死灵法师，一位魔法师。仅仅躲在浴室或烘干室里的假英雄会被判处死刑。真正的英雄会变成貂、鹰等，或者躲在这些动物的巢穴里，或者被它们吞掉。然而，大多数时候，这些任务并不是由国王强加的，而是由公主强加的，她是英雄的妻子，她抛弃了她飞到了一个遥远的王国。这种困难的商业形式就是这种情况的典型。一般情况下，英雄都会被公主发现两次，但第三次他就下落不明，公主只能通过看魔镜或魔法书才发现他；英雄躲在镜子后面，或者变成一根别针，藏在书页之间。

Of special interest to us is the feat of hiding. The king issues a proclamation: "To him who hides and does not let me find him for half his life, for half his existence, I will give my little princess in marriage, and after my death he will be king" (Onč. 2). This king is a necromancer, a magician. The false hero who simply hides in the bath or in the drying room is punished by death. The true hero turns into an ermine, a falcon, etc., or hides in the nests of these animals, or is swallowed by them. However, most often these feats are not imposed by the king, but by the princess, the wife of the hero whom she has abandoned to fly away to a distant kingdom. This form of difficult feat is typical of such a situation. Usually the hero is discovered twice by the princess, but the third time he remains untraceable and the princess discovers him only by looking into the magic mirror or the magic book; the hero is hiding behind the mirror, or, having transformed himself into a pin, is between the pages of the book itself.

破译这种现象并不容易。毫无疑问，镜子和书是后来的现象，取代了另一种先前存在的发现英雄的方式。 Tichaja 得出的结论是，这款捉迷藏游戏是“坠入地狱、坠入虚无的隐喻” 547。从历史上看，这无法根据材料得到证明，尽管这种解释很有可能。基于N. Ia 制作的格鲁吉亚语sarke中“镜子”一词的分析。 Marr, Tichaja 说道：“在众多高加索童话故事中，尤其是梅格里安童话故事中，女主人公寻找未婚夫或心上人的藏身之处，并照向“镜子”，从古生物学角度来说，这意味着她观察“镜子天空”；因此，他从天空和星星中绘制了星座图。”镜子代替了天空，不仅可以从语言材料中看出，而且可以从民俗资料中看出。然而，目前尚不清楚蒂查贾在哪里发现了这些星星。在童话故事中，英雄通常最初隐藏在大气层中，被一只鹰带到那里，而公主则将目光固定在镜子反射所指示的那个点上。在这方面，蒂查贾的解释没有遇到任何异议。但尽管如此，我们仍然不明白为什么英雄必须躲起来。可以提出这样的假设：英雄必须拥有使自己隐形的艺术；隐形是地狱居民的一种品质。隐形帽子是哈迪斯的礼物。

It is not very easy to decipher this phenomenon. There is no doubt that the mirror and the book are later phenomena, which replaced another pre-existing way of discovering the hero. Tichaja comes to the conclusion that this game of hide-and-seek is "a metaphor for sinking into hell, into non-being." 547 Historically, this cannot be proven on the basis of the materials, although such an interpretation is very plausible. Based on the analysis of the word "mirror," in Georgian sarke , made by N. Ia. Marr, Tichaja says: "When in numerous Caucasian and especially in Megrelian fairy tales the heroine searches for the hiding place of her betrothed or the suitor for her heart and looks into the 'mirror,' paleontologically this means that she looks into the 'sky-mirror'; consequently, she casts her horoscope from the sky and its stars." That the mirror has replaced the sky can be seen not only from linguistic material, but also from folkloristic material. It is not clear, however, where Tichaja found the stars. In the fairy tale, the hero most often hides first in the atmosphere, carried there by an eagle, and the princess fixes her gaze on the spot indicated to her by the reflections of the mirror. In this respect, Tichaja's interpretation meets no objections. But with all this, it is still not clear why the hero must hide. One could suggest that the hero must possess the art of making himself invisible; invisibility is a quality of the inhabitants of hell. The hat-that-makes-one-invisible is a gift from Hades.

首先必须注意两种情况：隐藏任务是在哪里施加的？它是如何实施的？在《阿法纳西耶夫》中，英雄找到离家出走的妻子的地方位于地下。在彼尔姆童话故事中，这位妻子住在一座金色宫殿里，门口有狮子（ZP 1）；在楚贾科夫的童话故事中，它是“在天堂”（Chud.63），在斯米尔诺夫的另一则童话故事中，它是在“仙女屋”中（Sm.49）。从这个方面我们开始明白，英雄必须表现出他的隐形性。隐形作为仪式的一部分，我们已经分析过（参见白色或黑色的绘画）。

First of all, two circumstances must be noted: where is the task of hiding imposed? How is it carried out? In Afanasiev, the realm in which the hero finds his fugitive wife is located underground. In a Perm tale this wife lives in a golden palace with lions at the gates (ZP 1); in a tale by Chudjakov she is "in the heavens" (Chud. 63), in another by Smirnov she is in the "fairy house" (Sm. 49). From this point of view, one begins to understand that the hero must prove his invisibility. Invisibility, as a part of the rite, has already been analyzed by us (cf. painting in black and white).

另一方面，完成这一壮举的方式让我们回到了同样的循环：英雄躲在动物的巢穴或巢穴中，或者坐在动物的背上被携带，或者被动物吞掉，或者甚至变成它。鉴于我们对仪式的了解，最后两种形式必须被认为是原创的。说实话，在童话故事中，事业的完成会带来负面的结果，但这些结果可以被认为是纯粹的童话现象，是事业增加三倍所产生的。三次吞咽给出了否定的结果，但这种形式有历史的过去，而最终的任务（英雄躲在镜子后面、书下、床下等）是一种童话故事的装置，在现实世界中没有类比。仪式是童话故事中特有的。

On the other hand, the way in which the feat is accomplished brings us back to the same cycle: the hero hides in the nest or lair of an animal, or sits on its back and is carried, or is swallowed by this animal, or is transformed into it. Given all that we know about the rite, the last two forms must be considered original. To tell the truth, in the fairy tale the accomplishment of the feat gives negative results, but these results can be considered a purely fairy-tale phenomenon, produced by the tripling of the feats. The three swallowings give a negative result, but this form has a historical past while the definitive feat (the hero hides behind the mirror, under the book, under the bed, etc.) is a fairy-tale expedient that has no analogy in the rite and is peculiar only to the fairy tale.

因此，我们在这里也看到，在婚礼之前，仪式似乎被重复了，但这一次是对新郎进行的检查，而不是作为赋予他魔法美德的程序：这一次是他使自己隐形的能力受到考验，与变成动物、呈现其外观有关：简而言之，检查他是否留在动物体内。英雄证明他已被吞噬并且有能力使自己隐形。

We see therefore that here too, immediately before the wedding, the rite seems to be repeated, but this time as a check carried out on the groom, and not as a procedure to confer upon him magical virtue: this time his ability to make himself invisible is put to the test, connected with that of transforming himself into an animal, of assuming its appearance: in short, it is checked whether he has stayed in the animal. The hero demonstrates that he has been swallowed up and that he is capable of making himself invisible.

这种联系或许也解释了“riampiattino”的主题与死去公主的选举权祈祷之间存在的类比：在这种情况下，一切都是基于英雄的隐形，而在这里，可以瞥见的东西实质上出现了仅在“安全”主题中清晰；隐形是否与实际死亡或仪式死亡的表现领域有关系并不重要。选举权的祈祷也经常在大房子的环境中进行。英雄在自己周围画了一个圆圈。死去的女人无法摆脱它。第三天晚上，英雄躲在一个圣像后面，就像其他童话故事中他躲在书后面或镜子后面一样。 “公主找遍了每个角落，但找不到它”（AF.207）。这些话向我们表明，在这种情况下，英雄也在隐藏，并且向我们揭示了这种隐藏的本质：这些话是一个死人对一个活人说的；这些话是一个死人对一个活人说的；这些话是一个死人对一个活人说的；这些话是死人对活人说的。只有死人是透明的、看不见的，而英雄就具备了死人的品质。在另一个版本中，我们观察到完全相同的事情：英雄滑到炉子后面，从而变得隐形。 « 此刻他还在这里，现在他却走了！我再也找不到了！ » 这是一个死去的女人所说的话（Af. 208 c）。这种巧合是巧合还是非随机的？这并非偶然。生者看不见死者。但如果我们从这样的假设开始：即使是死人也看不到生者的表征在这里反映出来，那么这个主题的心理基础就变得清晰了。公主死了，准确地说，她无法见到英雄。但它的巫术恰恰在于，尽管如此，它仍然看到了生者：它吞噬了英雄的所有前辈。但这一次的英雄也是一个巫师，一个巫师。他用自己的巫术回应死去女人的巫术，让她看不见自己。在英雄被迫躲藏的童话故事中，公主始终是一位伟大的女巫：她拥有童话书。这里的测试呈现出魔术比赛的特征。考官和考生都是大魔法师，但谁赢了就是英雄。

This connection perhaps also explains the analogy between the motif of the "hide and seek" and that of the prayers for the dead princess: here too everything is based on the hero's invisibility, and here what is only glimpsed in the motif of the "hide and seek" becomes substantially clear; whether invisibility has to do with the sphere of representations of actual death or ritual death is of no importance. The prayer for the dead also frequently takes place in the great house. The hero draws a circle around himself. The dead woman cannot go beyond it. On the third night the hero hides behind an icon, just as in other fairy tales he hides behind the book or the mirror. "The princess searches and searches, rummages in every corner, but cannot find him" (Af. 207). These words show us that here too the hero hides, and they reveal to us the nature of this hiding: the words are spoken by a dead person towards a living person; only a dead person is diaphanous and invisible, and the hero has acquired the quality of the dead. In another version we observe exactly the same thing: the hero slips behind the stove and thus becomes invisible. "He was here at that moment, and now he is gone! I cannot find him again!" These are the words of a dead person (Af. 208 c). Is this coincidence accidental or not? It is not accidental. The living do not see the dead. But if we assume that this reflects the idea that the dead also do not see the living, the psychological basis of this motif becomes clear. The princess is dead and, strictly speaking, cannot see the hero. But her witchcraft consists precisely in the fact that, nevertheless, she sees the living: she has devoured all the hero's predecessors. But this time the hero is also a sorcerer, a magician. To the witchcraft of the dead woman he responds with his own witchcraft and makes himself invisible to her. In fairy tales where the hero is ordered to hide, the princess is always a great sorceress: she is in possession of the enchanted book. Here the test takes on the character of a magic contest. Both the examiner and the examinee are two great sorceress, but the winner is the hero.

18.认出你要找的人。

18. Recognize the person you are looking for .

让我们记住，隐藏的任务通常是由抛弃英雄的公主强加的。他寻找她，并在他的王国中找到了她，那里是强加承诺的地方。

Let us keep in mind that the task of hiding is generally imposed by the princess who has abandoned the hero. He searches for her and finds her in her kingdom, where the task is imposed.

同样，在十二个平等者中识别所寻找的人的任务也被强加在另一个领域，即水灵。他向英雄展示了他的十二个女儿，英雄必须找到其中最小的一个，即他的新娘。

Likewise, the task of recognizing the person sought among twelve equals is also imposed in the other realm, with the Water Spirit. He shows the hero his twelve daughters and the hero must discover among them the youngest, that is, his wife.

同样的要求也适用于带儿子回到他学习“聪明科学”的魔法师之家的父亲：父亲必须在十二个完全相同的学生中认出他的儿子。

The same thing is required of the father who goes to pick up his son from the sorcerer's house where he had learned the "clever science": the father must recognize his son among twelve completely identical students.

这项事业是基于这样一个事实：在另一个领域，所寻求的人没有自己的个人外表。住在这里的每个人看起来都一样。这种表现形式以纯粹的形式存在于多尔干神话中。三年过去了，一位老人的女儿去世了，奥基奥菲诺去寻找她。他睡着了，在梦中他到达了“死者灵魂居住的地方，但他无法认出它”。那里有三个女孩，她们的容貌和衣着都一模一样，其中一个是老人的女儿，但奥基奥菲诺却认不出她来。数一下他们衣服的接缝数，所有人的数量都是一样的。他厌倦了数数。 « 他终于认出了他要找的那个，因为上面提到了她母亲送给她的一件物品。他带她走。他醒来发现自己已经连续睡了九天。但那个女孩却没有动，要么死了，要么睡着了。在女孩体内，就像在麻袋里一样，他开始整理骨头。她复活了，复活后就成了老人的女儿。”最后这句话非常重要：复活的人会获得他的个人特征。相反，人在死亡时会失去其个人品质和特征，变得面目全非（参见多尔加尼民间传说，第 65 页）。

This feat is based on the fact that in the other realm the person sought has no individual appearance. All those who reside there have the same appearance. This representation is found, in its pure form, in a Dolgan myth. The daughter of an old man dies, three years pass and Occhiofino goes to look for her. He falls asleep and in a dream arrives at the place "where the soul of the deceased lives, but he cannot recognize her." There are three girls there, absolutely identical in face and dress, one of whom is the daughter of the old man, but Occhiofino cannot recognize her. He counts the seams of their dresses, their number is the same for all of them. He has grown tired of counting. "Finally he recognizes the one he is looking for because she mentions an object that was given to her by her mother. He takes her and carries her away. He wakes up and discovers that he has slept for nine days straight. But the girl did not move, she was either dead or asleep. Inside the girl, as in a sack, he began to arrange the bones. And she was resurrected, and when she was resurrected she became the daughter of the old man. "These last words are very important: the dead man, brought back to life, acquires his individual characteristics. On the contrary, man, when dying, loses his individual qualities and characteristics and becomes unrecognizable (see Dolgan Folklore , p. 65).

与童话相比，上述神话更为原始和古老；它展示了这一主题与另一个领域的持久性之间的联系。我们已经看到了童话《聪明的科学》和“大房子”综合体之间的联系。巫师的学生被认为处于死亡状态并且都一样。

Compared to the fairy tale, the above-mentioned myth is primary and older; it demonstrates the connection that also unites this motif with the permanence in the other realm. We have already seen the connection between the fairy tale The Clever Science and the complex of the "big house". The sorcerer's pupils are believed to be in a state of death and are all the same.

还可以提到的是，当英雄不是独自一人而有他的先生们陪伴的时候，所有人都是平等的，以至于无法区分他们。表达这种相似性的不变公式是：“声音像另一个，头发像另一个”（Sev.66）。这种相似性让我们回到了森林的兄弟情谊，其中每个人都是平等的或隐形的，因为他们处于传统的死亡状态。

It can also be mentioned that in cases where the hero is not alone but is accompanied by his gentlemen, all are so similar to each other that it is not possible to distinguish them. The constant formula to express this similarity is: "one voice like another, one hair like another" (Sev. 66). This similarity brings us back to the brotherhood of the forest, where all are equal or invisible because they are in a state of conventional death.

但尽管如此，并非所有事情都已澄清。在许多相似的人中认出一个受欢迎的人的壮举不仅出现在萨满教实践中，而且还作为一种婚礼习俗，直到19世纪才在整个欧洲被发现。萨姆特（Samter）的研究《出生、婚姻、死亡》中收集了有关该主题的大量材料，卡加罗夫（Kagarov）在他关于婚礼的书中也讨论了相同的主题548。我们在这里报告一些案例。在法国孚日地区，婚礼当天，新郎必须从一群女孩中选择自己的未婚妻……在撒丁岛，即将订婚的年轻人被领进一个房间，里面坐着尽可能多的女孩，他们都静静地站着。在许多其他地方也有同样的习俗。例如，在贝里（法国），婚礼结束时所有女性都排队。新郎从他们身后经过，必须从新娘的裸腿上认出她549。

But, nevertheless, not everything has been clarified. The task of recognizing a person sought among many equals is encountered not only in shamanic practice, but also as a wedding custom, and is found throughout Europe up to the nineteenth century . A great deal of material on the subject is collected in Samter's study, Birth, Marriage, Death , and Kagarov also deals with the same subject in his book on wedding ceremonies 548 . Here we report some cases. In the French region of Vosges on the wedding day the groom must choose his fiancée from among a crowd of other girls… In Sardinia the young man who is about to become engaged is led into a room where as many girls as they can gather are sitting, all silent and still. The same custom is found in many other places. Thus, for example, in Berry (France) at the end of the wedding all the women line up in a row. The groom passes behind them and must recognize the bride from her bare leg 549 .

卡加罗夫报告了学者们对这种普遍习俗提出的五种不同的解释。作者倾向于他简洁地表述为“欺骗灵魂的陷阱” 550。除卡加罗夫外，还有十一位学者支持这一解释。卡加罗夫将这一仪式纳入了一系列感应仪式或掩饰仪式（仪式小说）中。但这些作者都没有引用民俗材料或与萨满教有关的材料。卡加罗夫给出的解释是从仪式目的的角度给出的解释。但准确地说，这一目的从未被表达出来，人们可以根据需要创造任意数量的假设。我们所说的“精神”是什么？问题不在于目的，而在于原则：问题不在于庆祝这个仪式的目的是什么，而在于它是如何产生的，而童话故事的材料使我们能够确定这个原因的起源。一般来说，我们无法解释一个在其诞生的基础上幸存下来的仪式，我们只能谈论它的含义被转换的方式。但在这种情况下，婚礼仪式甚至没有意义的转换，仪式的庆祝没有人知道为什么，按照传统，就像一场游戏，也没有人问它追求什么目的。这样，就为科学仪式的“解释”奠定了基础，即为使无限任意解决方案成为可能的错误程序奠定了基础。

Kagarov reports five different explanations that scholars propose for this widespread custom. The author is in favor of what he laconically formulates as a "trap to deceive the spirits" 550 . Eleven scholars, in addition to Kagarov, support this explanation. Kagarov includes this rite in the series of exopathetic or dissimulative rites (ritual fictions). But none of these authors cites folkloristic or shamanic materials. The explanation given by Kagarov is an explanation given from the point of view of the purpose of the rite. But, precisely, this purpose is never expressed and one can base as many hypotheses as one wants on it. What "spirits" are we talking about? The problem is not in the purposes, but in the principles: it is not a question of seeing for what purpose this rite is celebrated, but how it arose, and the material of the fairy tale allows us to establish the origin of this motif. In general, one cannot interpret a rite that has survived from the basis on which it was born; one can only speak of the ways in which its meaning has been transposed. But in this case, in the wedding rite, there is not even a transposition of meaning; the rite is celebrated for some unknown reason, by tradition, as a game, and no one asks what purpose it pursues. In this way, the basis is created for the "interpretation" of the rite in science, that is, for an erroneous procedure that makes infinite arbitrary solutions possible.

19.新婚之夜。

19. The wedding night .

童话故事可能会以婚姻结束。但有时仍然有一个考验等待着英雄：初夜的考验。通常这种测试不以企业的形式进行；但本质上，它和其他测试一样是一种测试，有时我们也会发现它以公司的形式表现出来。 “国王发布公告：他将把他的女儿送给与她过夜的人”（《SM》142）。在其他地方，我试图证明，即使是识别公主的特殊标志的壮举，“我会把我的女儿嫁给任何能猜出她哪里有痣的人”（ZV 12），也是一种委婉说法，表明另一种测试第551章

The tale could end with the wedding. But sometimes there is still a test that awaits the hero: the test of the first night. Usually this test does not take the form of a feat; but, in essence, it is a test just like the others and sometimes we also find it expressed in the form of a feat. "The king published a proclamation: he would give his daughter to whoever spent a night with her" (Sm. 142). Elsewhere I have tried to show that even the feat of recognizing the princess's special signs, "I will give my daughter in marriage to whoever can guess where she has a mole" (ZV 12), is a euphemism for a test of another kind 551 .

那天晚上有什么危险？童话故事呈现出一幅相当多样化的画面。很多时候我们看到的是压在英雄身上的重手。副官得知了这一危险，并警告国王：“陛下，请小心，不要做任何愚蠢的事情。前三个晚上，它会考验你的力量，它会把手放在你身上，开始使你窒息；你将无法以任何方式承受它”（Af. 116 a）。 “他们一上床睡觉，她就用神奇的力量把手放在他身上”（Chud.19）。

What is the danger of that night? The tale presents a rather varied picture. Most often we see that it is a heavy hand that weighs on the hero. The assistant is informed of this danger and warns the little king: "Be careful, your majesty, do not do anything foolish. During the first three nights she will test your strength, she will lay her hand on you and begin to choke you very hard; and you will not be able to bear it in any way" (Af. 116 a). "As soon as they had gone to bed, she laid her hand on him with magical strength" (Chud. 19).

这不是一个简单的力量实验。公主想要勒死新郎。 “小女王将一只手放在他身上，另一只手也放在他身上，然后抓住枕头开始勒死他”（Af.76）。

This is not a simple experiment of strength. The princess aims to strangle her groom. "The little queen put one hand on him, put the other on him, then grabbed the pillow and began to strangle him" (Af. 76).

有时，所有公主的新郎都会在第一夜神秘死亡。 «一到那个城市，国王就发布公告宣布，他将把他的女儿嫁给三个已订婚的男人；他们结婚了，他们带他们上床，年轻女子还活着，年轻人死了。国王宣布：谁愿意娶她为妻，他就把他的王国交给谁”（悲伤5）。但还有另一种危险：有一条蛇飞向公主（Aph. 93 c，var. 2）。我们稍后再讨论这个问题。但无论危险是什么，是重手还是勒死，或者新郎突然莫名其妙地死亡，或者蛇拜访公主，补救办法总是只有一个：新郎的位置被帮手。 “如果你想活下去，就让我和女王一起躺在你的位置上”（Af. 93 c，var. 2）。 《快离开房间，我来代替你》（阿弗.116a）。这些例子足够清楚地表明，我们在这里面对的是童话故事的一个规范，一个标准，根据这个标准，剥夺女孩童贞的不是新郎，而是拥有魔法武器和强大力量的帮助者。在童话故事中，这并没有公开地说：帮手只是把女孩推回墙上，握她的手等等。尽管如此，情况还是很清楚的。

Sometimes all the princess's husbands die mysteriously during the first night. "And once in that city the king made it known by proclamation that he would give his daughter in marriage to three betrothed men; they marry, they take them to bed, the girl is alive, the young man is dead. And the king made proclamation: to whoever would take her as a wife he would give his kingdom" (Sad. 5). But there is a danger of another kind: there is a serpent that flies to the princess (Aph. 93c, var. 2). We will speak of this later. But whatever the danger consists in, in the heavy hand or in the strangulation, or in the sudden and inexplicable death of the groom, or in the visits of the serpent to the princess, the remedy is always one: the groom's place is taken by the helper. "If you wish to remain alive, let me lie in your place with the little queen" (Aph. 93c, var. 2). "Come out of the room quickly, I will take your place" (Af. 116 a). These examples show clearly enough that we are here faced with a rule of the fairy tale, a canon, according to which it is not the groom who deprives the girl of her virginity, but the helper, magically armed and powerful. In the fairy tale, this is not actually said openly: the helper simply pushes the girl against the wall, squeezes her hand, etc. Nevertheless, the picture is clear enough.

但第一晚的事件并没有就此结束。通常，驯服新娘后，帮手会拿着三种棍子折磨公主。 « 然后他抓住她的辫子，把她从床上拉起来，开始用鞭子抽打她。他狠狠地鞭打了她，然后把她扔到床上，出去叫库斯玛·费拉蓬托维奇（英雄）»（Sk.72）。米什卡·沃多沃兹抓住她的脖子，将她摔倒在地，并将两根铁棒和第三根铜棒折断。他把她像狗一样扔在地上……现在，伊凡国王，去睡觉吧，不会再发生任何事情了！ »（第143页）。

But the events of the first night do not end there. Usually, after taming the bride, the helper takes three kinds of rods and tortures the princess. «Then he grabbed her by the braid, pulled her out of bed and began to beat her with that whip. He whipped her well, then threw her on the bed, went out and called Kusma Ferapóntovič (the hero)» (Sk. 72). «Miška Vodovoz grabbed her by the neck, threw her on the ground, broke two iron rods and a third copper one. He threw her on the ground like a dog… And now, little King Ivan, go to bed, nothing more will happen!» (Sk. 143).

简而言之，这就是第一个晚上的常见画面。很明显，我们在这里反映了基于真实婚姻关系的非常古老的心理现象。

This, in a few words, is the usual picture of the first night. It is very evident that we have here a reflection of very ancient mental phenomena, founded on real conjugal relations.

如果更仔细地审视这个童话故事本身，就会发现在这种情况下，丈夫的男子气概受到了考验。但这不仅仅如此。总体而言，我们看到丈夫的无能、女人的恶魔力量以及克服她的帮助者的力量。正是助手赢得了公主。对助手的研究向我们展示了他的“森林”出身。从这个角度来看，卡托姆的故事（Af.116）对我们来说特别有趣。公主被助手击败，想要拆散助手，并成功了。他砍掉了卡托姆的双腿，并与其他残废者一起走进了树林：在那里，他领导着我们从“大房子”一章中已经知道的存在。他恢复双腿并回家。通过这样做，他获得了对公主的权力。 “‘好吧，’王后想，‘既然他已经成功地重建了双腿，你就不能戏弄他了，’她请求他和国王的原谅。”在这里我们发现了一幅众所周知的画面：留在森林里是缔结婚姻的条件，英雄必须证明这一点。通过这种方式，童话故事在某种程度上告诉我们为什么助手取代了丘脑中的英雄。

The tale itself, when examined more closely, shows that in this case the virile power of the groom is put to the test. But it is not only that. As a general picture we have the impotence of the groom, the demonic strength of the woman and the strength of the helper who conquers her. It is precisely the helper who conquers the princess. The study of the helper shows us his "sylvan" origin. In this respect the tale of Katom (Af. 116) is particularly interesting for us. The princess, conquered by the helper, wants to separate him from her husband and succeeds. She has Katom's legs cut off and he goes into the forest together with other cripples: there he leads the existence we already know from the chapter on the "big house". He has his legs made and returns home. In doing so he acquires power over the princess. "Well," thought the little queen, "since he has managed to make his legs better, one cannot play tricks on him," and she asked him and the little king for forgiveness. Here we find a familiar picture: staying in the forest is a condition for contracting marriage and the hero must demonstrate this stay. In this way, it is the fairy tale that tells us, up to a certain point, why the helper replaces the hero in the bedchamber.

然而，事情还远未明朗。首先，目前还不清楚危险是什么，以及夫妇俩在第一天晚上死于什么。这个问题的答案是由属于更古老阶段的材料给我们的。从美国和西伯利亚的材料中可以看出，危险并非来自“严厉的手段”，而是纯粹的性特征。女人的阴道里有牙齿。在北美神话中，一个美丽女人的所有配偶都会死去。最后，他们中的一个人采取了在适当的时候引入一块石头的方法。 « Ex illo tempore vagina innocens semper fuit » 552 .这是一个相当普遍的原因。 Sternberg 引用了一个非常有趣且重要的例子，取自 Ghiliaki 553的民间传说。六名艾诺人去狩猎海豹并迷路了。他们“从另一边”到达。在那里，六名妇女坐在平台上，专注于清理鱼。妇女们邀请客人进入她们的小屋并准备丰盛的宴会。 « 他们爬上木板，躺下，睡着了。过了一会儿，其中一人起身，从桌子上下来，躺在那女人的床上，小声嘀咕了几声，爬到她身上，“哎哟，哎哟，哎哟！ “然后死吧。”同样的事情也发生在第二个身上。 « 然后他们的主人起身，出去，走到海滩上，捡起一块圆石，把它搬进小屋，爬上木板。过了一会儿，他起身，走到左边那块木板上躺着的女人身边，最后，靠近中间那块木板的地方，爬上来，躺在她旁边，低声说了几句，就听见一声巨大的尖叫声；他爬到她身上，把石头放进她体内，她咬了他，她的牙齿都断了，连一颗都没有留下。”一切顺利后，女子就解除了武装。在注意到博阿斯和博戈拉兹材料中的类似案例时，斯滕伯格在注释中对此原因给出了理性主义的解释。据他说，整件事都归结为一种女性疾病。但我们必须拒绝这样的解释。疾病有很多种，但为什么其他疾病不会产生神话，而这个却会呢？此外，这种解释并不同意人的死亡，在这种情况下，死亡是不可避免的和突然的。更正确的说法是，这个主题象征性地反映了对女性被摘花所产生的危险的再现，以及这种危险具有神话性质的事实：它是对女性权力再现的反映。斯滕伯格的报道也因其他原因而有趣。这里有一种女性状态：在艾诺人到达的神秘海岸上，只有女性居住；在这里，妇女的神奇力量对应于一种特定的政权，一种特定的制度，在这种制度中，社会是由妇女创造的，她们做所有的工作和统治，也许还杀死所有的男人，吸引外国人短暂结婚，简而言之，我们发现自己面对的是亚马逊人。在童话故事中，英雄所向往的公主也是一位英勇的处女、一位少女国王、一位武士处女、一位专制的君主。

But things are still far from clear. It is not clear, first of all, what the danger consists of, and what the spouses die of on the first night. The answer to this question is given us by materials belonging to older stages. In American and Siberian materials it can be seen that the danger does not come from a "heavy hand" but is of a purely sexual character. The woman has teeth in her vagina. In a North American myth all the spouses of a very beautiful woman die. Finally one of them resorts to the means of introducing a stone at the right moment. " Ex illo tempore vagina innocens semper fuit " 552 . This is a fairly widespread motif. Sternberg cites a very interesting and important example, taken from the folklore of the Ghiliaki 553. Six Ainos go hunting for seals and get lost. They arrive "on the other side". There, on a platform, six women sit busy cleaning fish. The women invite guests into their hut and prepare a rich banquet. "They climbed onto the planks, lay down, and fell asleep. After a while, one of them got up, got off the plank, lay down in the woman's bed, whispered a little, climbed on top of her, "Oh, oh, oh!" And he died. " The same thing happens to the second. "Then their lord got up, went out, went down to the beach, picked up a round stone, brought it into the hut, climbed on to the plank. After a while, he got up, approached the woman who was lying on the plank on the left, at the back, next to the middle one, climbed up and lay down next to her, whispered a little, a great creaking sound was heard; he had climbed on top of her, had put the stone in her, she had bitten him, he had broken all his teeth, not a single one was left. After that, things go smoothly, the woman is disarmed. In noting similar cases in the materials of Boas and Bogoráz, Sternberg gives a rationalistic explanation of this motif in a note. According to him, the whole matter boils down to a female illness. But we must reject this explanation. There are many illnesses, but why do other illnesses not give rise to a myth and this one does? Furthermore, this explanation does not accord with the man's death, which is inevitable and sudden in such cases. It would be more correct to say that this motif figuratively reflects the representation of the danger arising from the defloration of the woman and the fact that this danger is of a mythological quality: it is a reflection of the representation of the woman's power. My report by Sternberg is interesting for other reasons as well. We have in it a kind of female state: on the mysterious shore where the Ainos arrive, only women live; the magical power of women here corresponds to a particular regime, to a particular system in which society is created by women who do all the work and reign, and, perhaps, kill all the men, attracting foreigners for a short period of married life; in short, we find ourselves here before a kind of Amazons. In the fairy tale, the princess to whom the hero aspires is also a heroic virgin, a maiden-king, a warrior virgin, sovereign autocrat of her kingdom.

在后来的宗教中，至高无上的女性被转变为一位女神，展现出狩猎女神和农业女神的综合特征。这些女神在她们的第一个晚上就杀死了她们的情人。这一事实可以在小亚细亚和古典时期的崇拜中观察到，但在这里，杀戮有时变成了阉割，并成为解释祭司阉割的病因学传说。哈恩说：“毫无疑问，在最古老的神话中，阿芙罗狄蒂本人化身为一头野猪，杀死了她的情人，或者通过阉割导致他死亡，就像小亚细亚的众神之母对她的阿提斯所做的那样。 ...我们有迹象表明，伊什塔尔杀死了她所有的情人，就像阿耳忒弥斯对阿克泰翁所做的那样，就像伊西斯杀死了她的情人马内罗斯» 554。

In later religions the sovereign woman is transformed into a goddess who presents the combined characteristics of the goddess of the hunt and the goddess of agriculture. These goddesses kill their lovers during the first night. This fact can be observed in the cults of Asia Minor and classical antiquity, but here the killing sometimes turns into castration and serves as an etiological legend to explain the castration of the priests. "Without a doubt," says Hahn, "in the most ancient myth Aphrodite herself, in the form of a wild boar, killed her lover or caused him to die by castrating him, as the mother of the gods in Asia Minor did with her Attis... We have indications that Ishtar killed all her lovers, just as Artemis did with Actaeon, just as Isis killed her lover Maneros . " 554

这些材料表明，第一次婚姻的危险的表现已经抵抗了多久：在这里，强大的女人已经是女神，但与她结婚的危险总是一样的。

These materials show how long the representation of the danger of the first marriage has persisted: here the powerful woman is already a goddess, but the danger of a marriage with her is always the same.

因此，与女人的第一次婚姻对男人来说是危险的。有一些数据让我们推测，在古代，摘花仪式是女孩入会期间的一种特殊仪式。在民族志文献中，我们发现关于这个问题的数据很少，但这种情况是可能的。雷岑斯坦也提出了这个想法，他说：“在许多此类仪式中，我们或多或少都明显地发现在前景中扮演主要角色的某个角色;我们必须在他身上看到对最初庆祝这些仪式的巫师的回忆。这个角色戴着特殊的面具，在大多数情况下清楚地表明他是森林精神的地球代表” 555。根据雷岑斯坦的说法，女孩向女人的转变正是在这些仪式中发生的。 « 入会仪式的一个基本特征必须考虑到这样一个事实，即女孩不是通过婚姻或肉体结合而成为女性，而是通过入会仪式（Reifezeremonien），其目的是使妇女受精，而肉欲结合已经发生了很久以前了。”在启蒙前出生的孩子被杀死，“因为他不被视为一个人，也就是说，人们相信他不是由血统的祖先产生的”。

Thus the first union with a woman is dangerous for the man. There is some evidence that ritual defloration was practiced in ancient times as a special rite during the initiation of girls. In ethnographic literature we find very little evidence on this subject, but, nevertheless, such a situation is possible. This idea has also been formulated by Reitzenstein, who says: "With greater or lesser evidence in many ceremonies of this kind we find in the foreground a certain character who plays the main part; we must recognize in him a reminiscence of the sorcerer who originally celebrated these rites. This character wore special masks which in most cases clearly show that he was an earthly representative of the sylvan spirit." 555 According to Reitzenstein, the transformation of the girl into a woman takes place precisely during these rites. « A fundamental characteristic of the initiatory ceremonies must be considered the fact that girls become women not through marriage or carnal union, but through the initiation ceremonies ( Reifezeremonien ) which have as their aim the fertilization of the woman, while the carnal union had already taken place a long time before ». The child born before the initiation is killed « because he is not considered a man, that is, it is believed that he was not generated by the ancestors of the lineage ».

这一理论虽然没有得到民族志数据的充分验证，但仍然可以让我们解释（尽管是假设的）童话故事中存在的一种情况，也就是说，它可以让我们回答为什么在新婚之夜帮手和新娘一起睡觉的问题，在英雄本人面前。与这种情况相关的表征可能曾经有着非常深厚的根源和广泛的传播，我们发现它们不仅反映在童话故事中。在黑山，婚礼后的第一个晚上，新郎的一位朋友睡在新娘旁边，尽管正如他们所说，“没有别有用心”。在波斯尼亚，每位参加婚礼的男性宾客都有将新娘按在墙上的习惯，从而象征婚姻的拥抱” 556。

This theory, although not sufficiently supported by ethnographic data, nevertheless allows us to explain, even if hypothetically, a situation existing in the fairy tale, that is, it allows us to answer the question why during the wedding night the helper sleeps with the bride, before the hero himself. The representations that are connected with this situation probably once had very deep roots and wide diffusion and we find them reflected not only in the fairy tale. In Montenegro during the first night after the wedding a friend of the groom sleeps next to the bride, although, as they say, "without ulterior motives". In Bosnia every male guest at the wedding has the habit of pressing the bride against the wall, thus symbolizing the conjugal embrace" 556 .

如果雷岑斯坦的理论是正确的，那么可以认为，之前在时间上分开的两个事件，即“神灵”的婚前摘花仪式和与男人的新婚之夜，后来在一个瞬间聚集在一起。摘花不再发生在婚礼之前，而是发生在婚礼之后。因此，执行此行为的角色也必须在婚礼后的第一个晚上出现。人类的新婚之夜与图腾的摘花融为一体。这种摘花行为是“森林精灵”的杰作，即童话故事中英雄的帮手，从他手中接过新娘。

If Reitzenstein's theory is correct, it can be assumed that the two events, namely the premarital ritual defloration by a "deity" and the wedding night with a man, which were once separated in time, were later reunited in a single moment. The defloration no longer takes place before the wedding, but afterwards. Therefore the person who performs this act must also figure after the wedding, during the first night. The human wedding night has merged with the totemic defloration. This defloration is the work of a "sylvan spirit," that is, in the tale, of the hero's helper who receives the bride from his hands.

根据雷岑斯坦的理论，大蛇绑架公主也可以被理解为以图腾摘花为目的的绑架。公主与蛇或科什切伊共存的问题，蛇在秘密壁橱中的永久存在等问题。根据这个理论，可以在一定程度上解决这个问题。从这个角度来看，杀死科什切伊或蛇必须被视为最近的现象，类似于烧死女巫。新的社会制度、新的婚姻形式意味着男人不再将实施摘花的面具视为恩人，而是视为强奸犯，而他被杀了。其特点是，如果蛇飞向新娘，新婚之夜，与蛇的决斗就会在卧室里进行。 « “别睡，小国王，和公主在一起的第一晚，你会遇到麻烦，不如让我睡在你的地方吧！ “国王同意了……午夜来临；突然，狂风呼啸，十二头蛇来了。布拉特开始与他战斗，砍下所有十二个头并将它们扔出窗外»（Af. 93 c，var. 2）。因此，在这里我们也看到了双重线：一方面，帮助者（在童话故事中，总是以蒙着面纱的形式出现）进行的摘花行为被认为是一件好事，另一方面，强奸犯则被认为是一件好事。战斗并被杀。

In the light of Reitzenstein's theory, even the abduction of the princess by the serpent can be interpreted as an abduction aimed at totemic defloration. The problem of the princess's cohabitation with the serpent or with Košcej, of the serpent's presence in a secret closet, etc. can be solved to a certain extent in the light of this theory. From this point of view, the killing of Košcej or the serpent must be considered as a more recent phenomenon, analogous to the burning of the sorceress. The new social regime, the new forms of marriage make men see in the mask that carries out the defloration not a benefactor, but a rapist, and he is killed. It is characteristic that in cases where the serpent flies to the bride, during the wedding night a duel with the serpent takes place in the bedroom. " " Don't sleep, little king, on the first night, with the princess, you'll get into trouble, let me sleep instead of you! "The little king agreed… Midnight came; suddenly the winds hissed, the twelve-headed serpent arrived. Bulat began to fight with him, cut off all twelve heads and threw them out of the window" (Af. 93 c, var. 2). Therefore, here too we see the double line: on the one hand, the defloration carried out by the helper (who, in the tale, always appears in a veiled form) is judged to be a good thing, on the other hand, the rapist is fought against and killed.

雷岑斯坦的理论让夫妻二人之间的刀剑问题得到了巧妙的解决。在俄罗斯童话中，它是一个相当罕见的主题（On.Zav.p.162），但在世界民间传说中它却相当普遍。雷岑斯坦报道说，在新婚之夜，两个配偶之间放置了一个图腾雕像。受孕被认为是祖先灵魂的杰作，而新郎在第一晚就没有与妻子发生性行为。后来这个“施肥器变成了分裂器”，变成了放置在夫妻之间的一把剑。也许这一事实可以为我们提供对至今仍在实行的首晚禁欲的新解释。根据卡加罗夫的说法，这是一种辟邪程序557。禁欲可能起源于这样的描述：在第一个晚上，女人被图腾祖先怀孕，从这里也衍生出初夜权：这项权利然后从最强者的手中神奇地传递到那些人手中。社会上最强者的权力，并成为篡夺夫妻权利的手段。

Reitzenstein's theory has brilliantly solved the problem of the sword between the two spouses. In Russian fairy tales it is a rather rare motif (On. Zav. p. 162), but in world folklore it is quite widespread. Reitzenstein points out that during the wedding night an effigy of totemic character was placed between the two spouses. It was believed that conception was the work of the spirit of an ancestor, while the groom abstained from having sexual intercourse with his wife during the first night. Later this "fertilizing instrument was transformed into a disunifying instrument", it was transformed into a sword placed between the husband and wife. Perhaps this fact can provide us with a new interpretation of the abstinence of the first night, which is still practiced today. According to Kagarov it is an apotropeic procedure 557 . It may be that abstinence has its origins in the idea that during the first night the woman is impregnated by a totemic ancestor, and from here also derives the jus primae noctis : this right subsequently passes from the hands of the magically strongest to those of the socially strongest and becomes a means of usurping conjugal rights.

但这一切还不足以解释新婚之夜画面的一个细节，即新娘所遭受的酷刑。

But all this is still not enough to explain a particular detail of the picture of the wedding night, namely the tortures inflicted on the bride.

其特点是，在一些极其原始的案例中，妇女的阴道里长着牙齿，我们并没有遇到酷刑的动机。这些牙齿是一种象征，它们是女性力量的象征性表达，是她对男性的首要地位的体现。拔牙和酷刑是同一顺序的现象：它们表明妇女已经失去了体力。

It is characteristic that in the stage-primitive cases in which the woman is represented with teeth in her vagina, we have not encountered the motif of torture. These teeth are a symbol, they are the figurative expression of the woman's power, of her primacy over the man. The pulling out of the teeth and the torture are phenomena of the same order: they indicate that the woman has lost her strength.

从此公主就乖乖听从自己的丈夫了。这一切都归结为这一点；古代妇女的力量已被男人的统治所粉碎。但仍然有一个领域，男人仍然害怕女人，因为女人凭借生育孩子的能力而强大。即使在历史上，女性的力量也是建立在性原则之上的。由于这种性欲，她坚强而可怕。无论这个事实是用牙齿的形象还是用重手或勒死的形象来表达，都没有多大关系。新婚之夜的恐惧，是少女王尚未破灭的力量激发出来的恐惧。她被剥夺了这种权力，她是通过启蒙而被剥夺的，这种权力只为男人保留。从那一刻起，女人就被征服了，她把自己的位置让给了男人，她从最后的堡垒撤退，人们相信她仍然可以在那里表达她的神秘力量。从那一刻起，人类就成为了至高无上的统治者。

From now on the princess will be docile and obey her husband. It all comes down to this: the ancient power of the woman has been shattered by the lordship of the man. But there is still a field in which the man continues to fear the woman, strong and powerful by virtue of her ability to generate children. Historically too, the power of the woman is based on the sexual principle. Because of this sexuality, she is strong and fearsome. It does not matter much whether this fact is expressed with the image of the teeth or of the heavy hand or of strangulation. The fear of the wedding night is the fear that the not yet shattered power of the maiden-king inspires. She is deprived of this power, she is deprived of it by virtue of the initiation, reserved for men only. From that moment the woman is enslaved, she yields her place to the man, she withdraws from the last fortress where it was believed she could still exert her mysterious power. From that moment the man reigns unchallenged.

20.初步扣除。

20. Preliminary deductions .

这里提到的壮举并没有穷尽材料，在这部作品中我们也不能谈论俄罗斯童话剧目中的所有壮举。只能通过指出这些企业的类别来发现这些企业是否存在一个统一体、一个体系，从而找到历史研究的方向。

The feats mentioned here do not exhaust the material, nor can we speak in this work of all the feats that are found in the repertoire of the Russian fairy tale. It can only be a matter of indicating the categories of these feats to discover whether in such a variety there is not a unity, a system, to find the direction in which historical research can be carried out.

我们的结果是什么？通过对企业及其实施条件的分析可以得出哪些扣除？

What are our findings? What conclusions can be drawn from the analysis of enterprises and the conditions under which they are imposed?

首先，我们已经看到，最多元化的公司实际上并不构成一种异质的、异质的材料：它们表明它们彼此紧密相连并代表单一现象。一般情况可以这样表述：在获得公主的手之前，英雄要经历各种考验，只有遵循英雄的整个经典道路，即拥有一个仙女，他才能克服这些考验。帮助者和魔法手段和力量。从内容上看，这些企业虽然各有不同，但却透露出一定的统一性。英雄以各种形式证明他曾在另一个世界（与研究有关的冒险、坠入地狱等）或他拥有死者的本质。他可以变得隐形（隐藏功绩），他可以无休止地吃东西，他没有个人特征，等等。在另一个世界的停留并不只是一次简单的旅程，更重要的是它的结果。这些结果是双重的：一方面与氏族政权的宗教有关，另一方面与婚礼和婚前习俗有关。英雄不仅仅是一个人。通过完成困难的壮举，他证明了他统治着太阳。通过管理雷、寒、暑，他证明了他可以创造丰收。这是一个神话传统，反映了图腾祖先、世界的创造者或秩序者的故事。这位祖先为人类带来了地球上最早的果实，教给他们所有的工艺和艺术，教他们舞蹈，制定习俗，赋予他们社会秩序。这是神话传统的路线。

First of all, we have seen that the most diverse enterprises do not in reality constitute heteronomous, heterogeneous material: they prove to be closely connected with each other and to represent a single phenomenon. The general situation can be formulated in the following way: before obtaining the hand of the princess, the hero undergoes various tests that he can overcome only by having followed the entire canonical path of the hero, that is, by being in possession of a fairy helper and of magical means and forces. From the point of view of their content, these enterprises, although so different, reveal a certain unity. In various forms the hero proves to have been in the other world (enterprises concerning the search, the descent into hell, etc.) or to possess the nature of the dead. He can become invisible (enterprises concerning hiding places), he can eat endlessly, he has no individual features, etc. The stay in the other world is important not as a simple journey, but above all for its results. These results are twofold: on the one hand they are connected with the religion of the clan regime, on the other with the nuptial and pre-nuptial customs. The hero is not just a man. By accomplishing difficult feats he shows that he governs the sun; by governing thunder, cold and heat he shows that he can create an abundant harvest. This is a mythical tradition that reflects the stories about totemic ancestors, creators or orderers of the world. This ancestor brought men the first fruits of the earth, taught them all the crafts and arts, taught them dances, established customs, gave a social order. This is the line of mythical tradition.

另一方面，这些神话也反映了与习俗或仪式有关的具体现实。每个部落都有它的神奇帮手、它的护身符、它的舞蹈、它的故事。学者承认所有这些事情都符合一般规律，但是对于那些拥有护身符的人来说，对于那些学习了某些舞蹈的人来说，这些护身符和这些舞蹈与其他人的护身符和舞蹈有所不同。对困难事业的分析离不开对帮助者及其所处的整个环境的分析。在前一章中我们已经认识到女巫的角色是英雄的岳母、他妻子的母亲、阿姨或姐妹。与这一事实相关，由博阿斯撰写并由我们报道的对夸奎特人婚礼的描述就显得尤为重要。我们已经看到，年轻人入会的代价不是由他的父亲支付，而是由新娘的父亲支付，这意味着新郎没有被启蒙进入他的家庭或部落的奥秘，而是进入他妻子的氏族的奥秘。 .通过研究女巫，我们已经发现助手是遗传性的。这些材料使我们相信，英雄收到了他妻子家族特有的、与其他所有护身符不同的护身符。如果说童话故事向我们展示的是英雄接受考验，看他是否有帮手，那么民族志材料则告诉我们，新郎受到考验，看他是否拥有通过婚姻而受到欢迎的氏族的特殊秘密。支付入会费用的新娘父亲有权对新郎进行初步检查，并在婚礼前举行模仿入会仪式的仪式，在此期间新郎证明他已经完成了要求的一切实习。

On the other hand, these myths also reflect a concrete reality related to custom or ritual. Each tribe has its own magical helper, its amulets, its dances, its narratives. The scholar recognizes that all these things conform to a general law, but for those who possess an amulet, for those who have learned certain dances, these amulets and these dances are something different from the amulets and dances of others. The analysis of difficult enterprises is inseparable from the analysis of the helper and of the whole environment in which it is acquired. Already in a previous chapter we have recognized in the character of the sorceress the hero's mother-in-law, the mother, the aunt or the sister of his wife. In relation to this fact, the description of the wedding ceremony among the Kwakiutl, made by Boas and reported by us, acquires particular importance. We have seen that the price of the youth's initiation was paid not by his father, but by the father of the bride, which means that the groom was not initiated into the mysteries of his family or tribe, but into those of his wife's clan. Already in studying the sorceress we have seen that the helper was transmitted hereditarily. The materials lead us to believe that the hero received the helper or amulet peculiar to the wife's clan and different from all the other helper-amulets. If the fairy tale shows us that the hero is tested to see if he has helpers, the ethnographic materials show us that the groom is tested to see if he is in possession of the peculiar secrets of the clan into which he is welcomed through marriage. The father of the bride, who paid the price of initiation, had the right to subject the groom to a preliminary examination and before the wedding a ceremony was held which mimed the initiation, during which the groom demonstrated that he had completed all the required training.

三．王位英雄的降临

III. The Hero's Accession to the Throne

21.弗雷泽关于国王继承的观点。

21. Frazer's opinion on the succession of kings .

“艰难的事业”不仅发生在结婚之前，也发生在英雄登基之前。我们稍后会看到，继位是如何伴随着老国王被杀的。功绩、弑君与英雄登基之间存在着联系。

The "difficult deeds" precede not only the marriage, but also the hero's accession to the throne. We will see later how the accession to the throne is accompanied by the killing of the old king. There is a connection between the deeds, the killing of the king, and the hero's accession to the throne.

孤立地考虑公司的历史根源是很难具体追溯的。另一方面，权力的继承，即从一个人到另一个人的传承，绝对是一种历史现象，根本不是“童话”。这种转变的形式在整个历史中不断变化。弗雷泽研究了其中一种形式，他如下所述：“在一些雅利安民族中，在其社会进化的某些阶段，存在着一种习俗，根据这种习俗，王室出生或王室血统不是通过男性传播的，而是通过男性传播的。”通过妇女，根据这种习俗，王位也一代又一代地传给另一个血统的男人，有时甚至传给一个外国人，他娶了一位皇家公主，成为他妻子人民的国王。有一个广为人知的童话故事，有无数的变体，讲述了一个来自未知国家的爱冒险的男人，设法获得了公主的手以及半个王国的故事。这个流行的童话故事也许是一个绝对真实的古代习俗的遥远回声” 558。这一假设不仅得到了对童话故事的分析的证实，而且它的延伸范围比弗雷泽（他并没有专门研究过童话故事）所认为的要远得多。正如弗雷泽本人所表明的那样，通常旧国王会被新国王杀死——这正是童话故事所保留的情况。到目前为止，我们完全同意弗雷泽的观点，他甚至将女性血统的继承现象（通过国王的女儿）与社会进化的阶段联系起来。但弗雷泽是一个资产阶级学者，即使他走上了正确的道路，他也没有离开他的阶级的心态和信仰。

It is difficult to trace the historical roots of enterprises considered in isolation. On the other hand, the succession of power, its transfer from one person to another, is an absolutely historical phenomenon, not at all "fairy-tale-like". The form of this transfer changes in the course of history. One such form has been studied by Frazer, who states it as follows: "Among certain Aryan peoples, at certain stages of their social evolution, there existed a custom according to which royal birth or royal blood was transmitted not through men, but through women; and according to this custom the throne also passed from generation to generation to a man of another lineage, and sometimes even to a foreigner who, having married a royal princess, became king of his wife's people. A popular fairy tale, which has innumerable variations, tells of an adventurous man who came from an unknown country and succeeded in obtaining the hand of the princess and with it half of the kingdom. This folk tale is, perhaps, a distant echo of a very real custom of antiquity . 558 Not only is this hypothesis confirmed by the analysis of the tale, it can be extended much further than Frazer, who had not studied the tale in detail, believed. As Frazer himself shows, the old king was usually killed by the new one: this is precisely the situation that the tale has preserved. Up to this point we are in complete agreement with Frazer, who even establishes the phenomenon of succession in the female line (through the king's daughter) in connection with the stadiality of social evolution. But Frazer is a bourgeois scholar and even when he hits the right path he does not go beyond the bounds of the mentality and convictions of his class.

王位继承理论是金枝论的基础。但是，也许弗雷泽没有意识到，他把所有的注意力都转向了即将被废黜的国王。推翻旧国王的英雄仍然在他的视线之外，这种情况对他的整个建设来说是致命的。对于弗雷泽来说，它“只是任何竞争对手”。 “任何强者”等等。第559章也许童话故事更好地保留了远古时期存在的一种情况，并不是“随便什么强者”就能成为国王。弗雷泽也很少提及规范这种继承的规则。可以肯定的是，任何强者都不可能在任何时刻挺身而出，杀掉王者，取代他的位置。弗雷泽提到的唯一规则是这种继承的周期性。国王的继位周期为 5 年、10 年、12 年。 （还有其他截止日期。）如果君主生病，也可能被废黜。强制取代老国王的原因在于，人们相信国王，同时也是一名牧师和魔术师，田野和羊群的繁荣依赖于他，随着老年的到来或不久前他的魔力开始丧失，危及所有人的福祉。因此他被一个更强大的继任者所取代。

The theory of succession to the throne is the basis of The Golden Bough . But, perhaps without realizing it, Frazer turns all his attention to the king who is about to be deposed. The hero who overthrows the old king remains out of his sight and this circumstance proves fatal to his entire construction. For Frazer it is "any rival". "any strong man", etc. 559. It may be that the fairy tale has better preserved a situation that existed in ancient times, and that it is not "any strong man" who can become king. Frazer also says little about the rules that regulate this succession. What is certain is that any strong man cannot come forward at any moment, kill the king and take his place. The only rule that Frazer refers to is the periodicity of this succession. Kings succeeded one another at periods of 5-10-12 years. (There are other deadlines as well.) The sovereign could also be deposed in the event of illness. The reason for the forced replacement of the old king lies in the belief that the king, who was at the same time a priest, a magician on whom the prosperity of the fields and flocks depended, with the onset of old age or shortly before began to lose his magical power, endangering the well-being of all the people. Therefore he was replaced by a stronger successor.

在我们看来，民俗材料授权我们肯定这位继承者必须展示他的神奇力量，并且必须在这一事实中寻找“艰难事业”的根源。

It seems to us that the folkloric material authorizes us to affirm that this successor had to demonstrate his magical power and that the roots of the "difficult enterprises" must be sought in this fact.

22.童话里的王位继承。

22. The succession to the throne in the fairy tale .

国王继承哪个领域？他几乎从未继承过父亲的王国：他到达异国他乡，在完成了艰难的事迹后与公主结婚并在那里统治。如果这是在权力长期从父亲传给儿子而不是从岳父传给女婿的国家讲述的，这意味着童话在这里保留了更古老的情况。但是，当然，欧洲君主国的情况也反映在童话中也就不足为奇了。在获得公主之后，英雄有时会返回自己的国家并继承父亲的王位：这是童话故事对后来的王位继承形式的致敬。

Which kingdom does the little king inherit? He almost never inherits his father's kingdom: he arrives in a foreign land, marries the princess after completing difficult tasks, and reigns there. If this is told in countries where power has long been passed from father to son and not from father-in-law to son-in-law, it means that the fairy tale has preserved an older situation here. But, of course, it should not be surprising that the situation existing in European monarchies is also reflected in the fairy tale. After obtaining the princess, the hero sometimes returns to his country and succeeds his father: this is a tribute that the fairy tale pays to the later forms of succession to the throne.

有时，英雄登基的故事是从童话的第一句话开始的。国王宣布，他将把他的女儿嫁给任何能完成这个或那个壮举的人。童话故事从来没有说国王这样做的原因。从弗雷泽的材料中，我们看到国王们周期性地相互继承，并且可以合理地假设童话国王的时代也已经到来。在这种情况下，公告“国王已发出特许状：他将把公主嫁给谁建造了一艘可以飞的船”等。代表放弃王位的时刻。因此，我们看到，此时此刻与实施艰巨的任务有关。从弗雷泽的材料中我们看到，国王被废黜的原因之一是他神奇的阳痿的发生（有时与性能力的衰退有关）。俄罗斯童话没有保留这样的事实：国王只是人民的统治者，而不能统治自然。但有一个多尔干神话，把这种情况表达得非常清楚。国王坐在黑暗中，“他不认识太阳，甚至不认识月亮”（见第二章第1节）。他的人民的福祉归功于他：“孩子永远不会停止出生，男人永远不会在死亡时停止存在。”但有一天，到了结婚年龄的他生了一个女儿。 “游戏停止飞行，鱼开始消失、变薄”等。这意味着什么？显然，孩子的适婚年龄和新一代的崛起表明，老一代人离开、为新一代腾出空间的时候到了。国王不再能够统治自然。此外，他还被指责“因为他的罪孽，太阳隐藏了自己”。这位国王提出了一项艰巨的任务：打破天空并带回太阳。无论谁成功，他都承诺他的女儿和一半的王国560。在这里，国王被废黜的原始原因（弗雷泽指出这是一种历史现象），即魔法力量的丧失，被非常清楚地保留了下来。艰难的事业、婚姻和上台构成了一个不可分割的整体。这个例子特别清楚地表明，成年女儿的出现和新郎的出现对老国王来说意味着致命的危险。岳父和女婿是传统的敌人。如果权力是通过女婿传递的，国王就必须有一个成年的女儿；当她到了结婚的年龄，她的丈夫出现时，对于老国王来说这意味着与他的女儿一起移交王国。

Sometimes the story of the hero's accession to the throne begins with the first words of the tale. The king announces by means of a proclamation that he will give his daughter in marriage to the one who will accomplish this or that feat. The tale never says why the king acts in this way. From Frazer's materials it is clear that kings succeeded one another periodically, and it is reasonable to assume that the time had come for the king in the tale too. In this case the proclamation "The king has sent a letter: he will give the princess in marriage to the one who will build a ship that can fly", etc. represents the moment of renunciation of the throne. We see, therefore, that this moment is connected with the imposition of difficult feats. From Frazer's materials it is clear that one of the reasons for the king's deposition was the beginning of his magical impotence (sometimes connected with the decline of sexual potency). The Russian tale has not preserved this fact: for it the king is only the ruler of the people, but does not govern nature. But there is a Dolgan myth in which this situation is expressed very clearly. The king sits in the dark, "he did not know the sun and he did not know the moon either" (see chap. II, § 1). The well-being of his people is due to him: "Children did not cease to be born, and men did not cease to exist when they died." But one day a daughter is born to him who reaches marriageable age. "The game stopped flying, the fish began to disappear, to become sparser," etc. What does this mean? Evidently the marriageable age of the children, the rise of a new generation show that the time has come for the old generation to leave, to make room for the new. The king is no longer capable of governing nature. Moreover, he is reproached that "because of his sins, the sun has hidden itself." This king imposes a difficult task: it is a question of breaking through the sky and making the sun return. To the one who succeeds he promises his daughter and half of his kingdom . 560 Here the primary cause of the king's destitution (which Frazer has established as a historical phenomenon), namely the loss of magical power, has been preserved very clearly. The difficult undertaking, the marriage and the accession to power form an indissoluble whole. This example shows with particular clarity that the presence of a grown-up daughter and the appearance of the groom represented a mortal danger for the old king. Father-in-law and son-in-law are traditional enemies. If power was transmitted through the son-in-law, the king had to have a grown-up daughter; when she reached marriageable age and the groom appeared, for the old king this meant handing over the kingdom together with his daughter.

现在我们明白为什么企业具有双重特征了。它们必须吸引新郎，因为公众舆论希望如此，但它们也必须恐吓新郎，因为它们的实现涉及老国王的死亡。公主的处境也是双重的：作为女儿，她会憎恨她的丈夫，因为他是导致她父亲死亡的原因；作为王位继承人，她必须履行自己的公民义务，与新郎一起对抗国王。她渴望杀死她的丈夫，或者她渴望杀死她的父亲，在一些童话故事中，她亲手做到了这两件事。

Now we understand why the deeds have a double character. They must attract the groom, because public opinion wants it that way, but they must also intimidate him because their accomplishment involves the death of the old king. The princess's situation is also double: as a daughter she will hate her groom, the cause of her father's death; as the transmitter of the throne she must fulfill her civic duty and go against the king together with her groom. She aspires to kill her groom, or she aspires to kill her father, and in several fairy tales she does both with her own hands.

我们报道的多尔干民间传说的例子并不是个例，但非常完整、明显。即使在俄罗斯童话中，也残留着年轻人相对于老人的神奇优势：“他如此狡猾，我们要把我们的女儿嫁给他”（Chud.94）。稍后，当我们研究牛奶浴的壮举时，我们会再次遇到国王的这种阳痿，

The example from Dolgan folklore given by us is not a unique case, but it is very complete and evident. Even in the Russian fairy tale there are traces of the magical superiority of the young man over the old man: "He is so cunning, we will give him our daughter" (Chud. 94). Later, when we study the feat of bathing in milk, we will again encounter this impotence of the king,

23.年老。

23. Old age .

这种阳痿是年老的结果。年老、疾病、疾病正是改变国王的刺激因素，弗雷泽举了很多例子。 «部落首领得出国王统治时间足够长的结论，宣布“国王病了”。这个公式的意思是他即将被杀” 561。在童话故事中，国王的晚年都出现在故事​​的开头和结尾。 “一位国王已经变得很老了，几乎失明了”；例如，他想年轻三十岁，并派他的孩子“寻找他的青春”。 “他开始变老了”等等。 （AF.164a）。童话故事就此开始，并以英雄登基而告终。更常见的是，老年——政府更迭的原因——出现在最后。 « 好吧，万尼亚，我已经老了，放弃了一切；这里是我的整个王国，随心所欲地生活，统治，我把一切都交给你” 562。由于国王已经很老了，他把王冠戴在了农民的儿子伊凡的头上（Af. 165 P）。

This impotence is a consequence of old age. Advanced age, illness, and ailments were precisely the stimulus to change the king, and Frazer gives a fair number of examples. "The elders of the tribe, having come to the conclusion that the king has reigned long enough, declare that 'the king is ill.' This formula means that he is about to be killed." 561 In the tale, the old age of the king appears both at the beginning and at the end of the story. "A certain king had become very old and had almost lost his sight." For example, he wants to rejuvenate himself by thirty years and sends his sons "in search of his youth." "He was beginning to grow old," etc. (Aph. 164a). Thus begins the tale, which ends with the hero's accession to the throne. More often, old age, the cause of the change of government, appears at the end. "Well, Vanya, I have grown old and I renounce everything; "Here is my whole kingdom for you, live as you please, reign, I leave everything to you." 562 Since the king was already very advanced in years, he placed his crown on the head of Ivan, a peasant's son (Af. 165 P).

值得注意的是，在所有这些情况下，权力都不是传递给“任何强人”，而是传递给女婿，女婿完成了“艰难的壮举”，从而展示了自己的实力。

It is worth noting that in all these cases power is not passed on to "just any strong man", but to the son-in-law who has accomplished "the difficult task" and has thus demonstrated his strength.

24.神谕。

24. The Oracles .

除了任期届满、年老、王力衰弱之外，还有一个原因可以导致新王更替。这个因就是神谕。我们清楚地看到，在这种情况下，神谕是一种次要现象：人的意志是通过神的嘴表达的。 « 在麦罗埃，埃塞俄比亚国王被尊为神；然而，当祭司们需要时，他们会派出一名使者去见国王，并根据从众神的神谕或预言下令处死他”（弗雷泽，《魔法艺术》，II，第 50 页）。 “当祭司想要的时候”这句话有点令人费解。显然，他们一定是出于某种原因想要它，可能是因为时机已到，或者是因为国王没有满足他们。我们不能在这里深入研究神谕以及它们在宗教和神话中的非常重要的部分，我们必须限制自己只提及这一现象的一个方面。

Besides the expiration of the fixed term, the coming on of old age, and the decline of the king's strength, there is another cause which can bring about the replacement of the old king by a new one. This cause is the oracle. That oracles are in this case a secondary phenomenon, we see clearly: the will of men is expressed through the mouth of the gods. "At Meroè the Ethiopian kings were worshipped as gods; but when the priests desired it, they sent a messenger to the king and ordered him to die, relying on an oracle or prophecy received from the gods" (Frazer, The Magic Art , II, p. 50). The expression "when the priests desired it" leaves one somewhat perplexed. Evidently, they must have wanted it for some reason, probably because the time had come, or because the king did not satisfy them. We cannot here study oracles in depth and the very important role they play in religion and myths; we must limit ourselves to mentioning only one aspect of this phenomenon.

童话故事和历史现实一样，有两种王位传承方式：第一种是国王通过女儿传给女婿。公主是权力的传递者。这是一种导致统治者被杀和王位继承女儿结婚的冲突局势。这是第二种方式：王位由父亲传给儿子，没有任何冲突。第一种形式最古老，第二种形式较晚。随着第二种形式的出现，冲突从现实中消失，但它并没有从神话中消失，它并没有从人们的意识中消失：意识形态并不总是记录已经发生的变化。通过将旧的冲突转移到新的关系中，俄狄浦斯的案例出现了，这也保留在童话故事中。继承人不是女婿，而是儿子。为了维持冲突并将其转移到新的关系中，继承者杀死了统治者，儿子杀死了父亲。还有更多：在旧秩序中，继承王位的人是国王的女儿，在新秩序中，如果国王没有孩子，则会选举新国王，或者继承权力的人是国王的遗孀。通过保留与继承王位的女人的婚姻并将其转移到新的情境中，神话创造了与国王的遗孀、继承人的母亲的婚姻主题：儿子与母亲结婚。但由于这种情况与社会道德相矛盾，因此行为的非自愿性质被插入，旧秩序也被保留，根据继承人是外国人。为了确保他仍然是一个陌生人，他必须与他的父亲分开，这就是神谕发挥作用的地方。值得注意的是，在这一点上，即使是困难的事业也被保留了下来；俄狄浦斯解开了狮身人面像之谜。但这一原本是魔法力量展示的壮举，却转化为将人民从灾难中解放出来。王位的权利取决于这种解放，而不是魔法力量。当权力从岳父传给女婿时，老国王的去世是既定的事实，不需要任何神谕。但是，当权力从父亲传给儿子时，国王（父亲）死在继承人（儿子）手中就变得不自然或不诚实，并且是出于神的意志和命运。这也可以从神谕更多地涉及孙子和子女而不是女婿这一事实中看出。珀尔修斯的祖父预言他将在孙子手中失去王位，拉伊俄斯预言他将死于儿子手中，珀利阿斯预言他将把王国交给一个只穿一只凉鞋的英雄。 ：在这个英雄中，他认识到一个侄子，即他的血统的代表。

The fairy tale, like historical reality, knows two ways of transmitting the throne: the first is from the king to the son-in-law, through the daughter. The princess is the transmitter of power. This is a situation of conflict that leads to the killing of the ruler and the marriage of the daughter who transmits the throne. And here is the second way: the throne is transmitted from father to son, without any conflict. The first form is the oldest, the second is later. With the appearance of the second form the conflict disappears from reality but does not disappear from the myth, does not disappear from the conscience of men: ideology does not always record the changes that have occurred. By transferring the old conflict to the new relationships, the case of Oedipus emerges, which is also preserved in the fairy tale. The successor is not the son-in-law, but the son. By preserving the conflict and its transfer to the new relationships, the successor kills the one who reigns, the son kills the father. What is more, in the old order of things the person who transmits the throne is the king's daughter; in the new order, if the king has no children, a new king is elected or the person who transmits power is the king's widow. By preserving the marriage with the woman who transmits the throne and transferring it to the new situation, the myth creates the subject of the marriage with the king's widow, mother of the successor: the son marries the mother.
